text:
Markie sighs. The four of you trek on in silence until you reach the crater. You approach the edge and look down into the abyss. The area of impact stretches for miles.

"I don't even see a fucking twig, man," Meat says.

"It's been over a hundred years since the impact. I think all you're going find is dirt down there," Markie replies.

"Don't forget the radiation," Ryan says, kicking a pebble over the edge.

"That too."

Markie peers down. "Zoom," she says. You hear the computer inside her helmet respond in affirmation to the command.

"You gonna get that girl of yours a rock from the surface?" Ryan asks Meat. "I hear people used to go crazy over moon rocks after the Apollo landings. Might make a punny engagement ring, y' know? Girls go for that sort of thing."

Meat grunts. "Not my woman. She's endowed, but it ain't with brains. The humor would, uh, escape her."

"And the radiation," Markie points out.

"Stupid radiation. Ruining everything," Ryan says.

"Hmm. That's interesting," Markie says—it's almost a whisper.

1. [["Well, out with it Mark. What is it?"]]
2.[[Let someone else ask.]]

incoming: Say nothing; give the walkie to Meat.
text:
Meat takes the walkie from you. "Doc," he says.

"Please hurry," she begs. "We're in the cockpit."

"Hustle people," Meat says, breaking out into a sprint. 

You and Neil follow. 

You keep an eye out for Markie, but, thankfully, she never exploits your panic. When you reach the bend before the cockpit, Meat slows down and raises his hand for you to stop. You do so and listen. Just out of sight, you can hear something cracking.

Meat steps out of the corner. You and Neil join him, your pistol raised in the direction of the cockpit. There, covered in red and yellow grime, his back to you, is Ben biting into Salvucci's leg and tearing away flesh and muscle.  Salvucci is against the cockpit's door, either unconscious or dead. Blood trickles from his forehead. A crowbar is next to his body.

Meat aims down the sight and breathes hard.

"Conserve the ammo," Neil says.

Meat gently tugs the trigger. A round slams into Ben's neck; the creature masquerading in your crewmate's skin whirls around and slams into the wall. It hisses and stands up. What was once Ben's youthful face glares at you.

The thing takes a step forward.

Meat fires another two shots that slam into its chest. Ben is knocked back, but he recovers quickly, taking another step toward you. And then another. He's closing in.

"Well don't just stand there—shoot him!"

You aim down the sight.

1.	[[Fire the gun.]]

incoming: Remain silent and keep your hand over the tear in her suit.
text:
Above you you hear the roar of the Speedwell's thruster as the ship lands. The sound frightens the fungal crabs back into their home.

You and Meat help Markie to the ship's elevator. Meat enters a combination on the keypad and the door slides open.  Inside the elevator, as you ride up, all three of you remove your helmets. You notice for the first time that your face is drenched in sweat.

A ding. The door opens. Captain Jonas Salvucci, an older, muscular man with little patience for tomfoolery, awaits you—his hand wrapped around the pistol in his holster.

He takes his hand away from the gun when he sees there's no threat.

"Get her to sickbay."

You nod and help Markie through the hallway of the ship. She's delirious now, stumbling. Behind you, you can hear Salvucci interrogating Meat.

"What happened to Ryan?"

"I dunno. I think the blood on Markie's suit isn't all hers, though."

"Damn it, Travis. What did you find down there?"

When you get to sickbay, both Lenore Strauss, the doctor, and her geeky assistant Ben are prepping the examination table.

"Where's she wounded?" Lenore asks, as you help a woozy Markie out of her suit.  You glare at Ben as he gawks at her well-toned body. He smiles sheepishly and looks away, cheeks burning red with shame. Markie's drenched in sweat; she looks around wildly while Lenore straps her in. She examines the bite; it's just above the elbow, an inflamed bulging of the skin.

"And I was young and we were running," Markie rambles, "eyes bouncing up and down the shore while the sun cooked the corpses of washed up jellyfish."

You turn to Lenore; she's prepping some kind of tool.

1.[["What's she saying?"]]
2.[["What is that?"]]

incoming: "Someone dropped you on your head when you were an infant, didn't they?"
text:
"It doesn't work like that, Ryan. I'm reading at least seven tunnels, carved out exactly the same size."

"Meaning what?"

"There might be something down there."

"Spooky," Meat says, peering through the scope of his rifle at the expanse of the crater.

1.[["We should check it out."]]
2.[["Yeah, no, fuck that."]]
3. [[Wait in silence.]]

incoming: Stay silent and keep your hand over the tear in her suit.
text:
Above you you hear the roar of the Speedwell's thruster as the ship lands. The sound frightens the fungal crabs back into their home.

You and Meat help Markie to the ship's elevator. Meat enters a combination on the keypad and the door slides open.  Inside the elevator, as you ride up, all three of you remove your helmets. You notice for the first time that your face is drenched in sweat.

A ding. The door opens. Captain Jonas Salvucci, an older, muscular man with little patience of tomfoolery, awaits you—his hand wrapped around the pistol in his holster.
He takes his hand away from the gun when he sees there's no threat.

"Get her to sickbay."

You nod and help Markie through the hallway of the ship. She's delerious now, stumbling. Behind you, you can hear Salvucci interrogating Meat.

"What happened to Ryan?"

"I dunno. I think the blood on Markie's suit isn't all hers, though."

"Damn it, Travis. What did you find down there?"

When you get to sickbay, both Lenore Strauss, the doctor, and her geeky assistant Ben are prepping the examination table.

"Where's she wounded?" Lenore asks, as you help a woozy Markie out of her suit.  You glare at Ben as he gawks at her well-toned body. He smiles sheepishly and looks away, cheeks burning red with shame. Markie's drenched in sweat; she stares around wildly as Lenore straps her in. She examines the bite; it's just above the elbow, an inflamed bulging of the skin.

"And I was young and we were running," Markie rambles, "eyes bouncing up and down the shore  while the sun cooked the corpses of washed up jellyfish."

You turn to Lenore, who's prepping some kind of tool.

1. [["What the hell is she saying?"]]

"I found out what the first symptom is. It's fear. I woke up and I could feel the disease incubating in my body. I started to cry only to discover my tears were blood," she says, turning to face you. 

Her cheeks are red with the blood flowing from her eyes.

"I killed him out of fear, fear that you would all turn on me.  I was going to go back and do the same to you, and then to the others, but, well, what's the point? We're all gonna die in the end anyway," she says, sobbing. "God, we're all going to die. Slowly. Bleeding out of our orifices. I did Travis a favor really." She looks you directly in your eyes.

"Please kill me. I don't want to die like Markie did. Please."

She nods at your pistol.

1. [[Shoot her.]]
2.[["Do it yourself."]]

incoming: "Keep one bullet in the chamber for yourself...just in case."
text:
"Way to be an optimist, Julia," Meat says, clearly disapproving.

"No, it's okay," she says, nodding. "It's good advice." She walks out the door and stars running. She screams "Help!"

"Five minutes,"  Salvucci says. "That's all we give her."

Meat nods. Her footsteps (and screams) trail away.

After three minutes, Salvucci says "She's had enough time. Let's go."

The three of you run down the hall to sickbay. She's inside, screwing a hose into a black machine in the corner of the room. She looks up. "I told you to give me mor--"

She's interrupted by Markie's descent from the ventilation shaft onto the examination table. She growls at all of you. A giant purple claw has sprouted out of her missing arm. The other arm is rotting, like the rest of her body.

"Prettyprettyprettypretty."

Out of the corner of your eye, you see the cauterizing saw on the table next to the bed. 

1. [[Use the saw.]]
2. [[Use your gun.]]

You approach the table. Neil takes one of Meat's checkers.

They look up at you.

"Thought we'd see a lot of boring shit on this trip, didn't expect to run into a fucking alien," Meat says.

"Is it an alien, though? I mean, maybe it's just something that's been in the Earth the entire time?"

"Shut up, Neil. You know what I meant."

"Hey, I'm just saying that maybe we should be a little more careful about the terms we're throwing around, y'know, for science?"

"Just play the damn game. " He turns to you. "How are you holding up, Julia?"

1.[["I'm good."]]
2.[["Could be better."]]

incoming: "Well, out with it Mark. What is it?"
text:
"There are tunnels."

Ryan turns. "Come again?"

"Tunnels. In the crater. The last reconnaissance team didn't say anything about tunnels in their report."

"How long ago was that?"

"Seven years. Give or take a month."

"Erosion. Boom," Ryan says.

1.[["Someone dropped you on your head when you were an infant, didn't they?"]]
2.[["Uh..."]]

You pick up the walkie. Meat takes it.  "Neil, are you okay?"

"She's fucking here, guys. Oh Jesus, she reeks."

"Sit tight," Meat says. He nods at you. Both of you creep to the door. Meat pushes it open slightly and peers out. You look out as well.

Neil is backing into a wall, face red and dripping with perspiration. Several feet away is Markie. You can smell her from here, but that's not what's making you struggle not to gag. Her face is a jagged piece of flesh hanging from her skull, her sockets void of eyeballs.

"Stay away from me," Neil begs.

It lumbers toward the pilot, groaning. Several teeth fall to the ground in a mixture of salvia and blood.

"Now," Meat says.

The two of you emerge from the kitchen. Markie doesn't even have time to turn her head before machinegun fire rips the neck from her body and her head tumbles to the floor, smashing to the ground like a pumpkin.

Meat opens his mouth to let loose a witty remark, but vomit emerges. You're not far behind, the smell finally having gotten the best of you.  Luckily, there's not much for you and your partner to barf up.

"Oh godfuckingshit," Neil yells. "That was Markie."

Strauss emerges from the kitchen, a napkin over her mouth and nose. She takes one glance and then looks away.

"So, we like win now, right? They're all dead?"

"Yeah, I think—"

Meat is cut off by the sound of Markie's hand slapping the floor as the body convulses, pus and blood shooting from the decimated neck stump. He fires the rest of the clip into the corpse.

1. [[Shoot.]]
2. [[Run.]]

Salvucci nods. "That's a good idea.  You take doctor Strauss and do that. Travis and I will go check engineering. If it's wounded and looking for some place to hide, there's plenty of spots. Let's meet back here in an hour."

Strauss scoffs. "You're treating the beast like it's a wounded animal limping toward its doom. You're wrong. It showed no hesitation when it attacked. It's not afraid of us. It's waiting."

Salvucci wrinkles his nose as he is wont to do when someone says something that annoys him. "Regardless, we'll find the creature and put it down."

"Creatures," she says, correcting him. "There might be two of them now."

"Noted," Meat says, replacing the clip in his rifle. You realize now that he has the most powerful firearm on the ship.
"If you two run into it or them or whatever, don't try to fight. Just run. Come find us."

"We should stop talking and get on our way," Strauss says gruffly. "Before it eats that damnable pilot, which wouldn't be such a bad thing if we didn't need him to fly the ship."

"Now's not the time for jokes, Doctor," Salvucci says.

"Who says I was joking?" Strauss replies before leaving the room. You follow.

"Zoe," Meat calls right before you step into the hallway. You turn. "Be careful."

1.[["Don't worry about me, ya big softie."]]
2.[["Whatever."]]

incoming: "What else are we going to do?"
text:
"All right, let's get down to the hanger. Just...do me a favor. If we're about to get sucked into space, just fucking shoot me, okay?"

1.	[["Will do, partner."]]
2.	[["Happy thoughts, Meat. Happy thoughts."]]

Strauss shows up just as you finish. She smells like smoke.

"It's done."

She takes off her glasses and places them on a table nearby.

She looks at you, tears in her eyes, and says "I just want to sleep."

She gets into her pod without another word. The hatch closes over her. You get in yours and close your eyes as the hatch seals. Sleep follows.

When you awaken, you find yourself being assisted by a corporal. He takes you by the arm and guides you up from the pod. 

Both you and Strauss are transported to private rooms on the biggest military outpost in New Austin. You order steak and wine but find that you don't have an appetite. Some suits interview you and, after you answer every question, you're told that you'll be allowed to leave soon.

"Soon" turns out to be three days. You and Strauss meet on the base. She seems paler and thinner.

"Can we get a drink?" she asks. "I just want to go somewhere, anywhere but home first."

1.[["Sure, why not?"]]
2. [[Go on home.]]

"A keen observerer, you are." His voice is twangy. Maybe you're on Mars somehow.

"No," he says. "You're not on Mars. You fell into a rift and got yourself stuck between universes. To tell you the truth, I'm more impressed by your survival instinct than anything else. I thought I had patched all the holes."

1. [["Holes?"]]

incoming: We need to draw it out.
text:
"Okay, with what?" Neil asks.

There's a moment of silence as you, Meat, and Strauss turn to look at Neil. 

"Oh," he says, getting it. "Well fuck that."

1. [["Don't be a baby."]]
2. [["We could just knock you out."]]

incoming: "Are you two serious? This is insane!"
text:
"I already took one risk today, Zoe, and that got someone else killed. Superstitious or not, we're doing this. Now come on."

Salvucci leaves the room. You turn to look at Meat.

1.[["Don't get yourself killed."]]
2.[["You sick bastard."]]

"Yeah, let's."

The two of you walk back through the hallway leading to the hanger and then to the cockpit. The bodies of your crew are still there, including the headless corpse of Dr.Strauss.

"I was hoping she got away," he said sadly.

1.[["Ditto."]]
2.[["What happened, happened."]]

incoming: "That's better. Now, any idea on how we kill this thing?"
text:
"One, but we have to act quickly. Let's go to sickbay."

You follow her. When you get there, she tells you to lock both doors into the unit. You do so.

"How many rounds do you have left?" she asks as she pulls out a small brush and a flask of a yellow sticky substance."

You hand her the clip.

"Okay, good, there's enough here."

You watch her get to work. She ejects each bullet from the clip and then sticks her brush carefully inside the flask. Pulling the brush from the flask, she coats each bullet with some of the goo.

1.[["Explanation please."]]

incoming: "So if we can't melt it...what's the point?"
text: "I'm getting there. The viewport windows are bulletproof, but enough acid might penetrate all the layers. All it takes is one crack on the outside layer."\n\n1. [["We're gonna blow him into space?"]]
"You're right. You saved my life and I'm grateful for that. I just hope you did more than briefly delay my demise."\n\n1.[["That's better. Now, any idea on how we kill this thing?"]]

incoming: "She wants us to run out of resources."
text:
"She's doing a hell of a job of it, then. Played us like a fuckin' fiddl—"

"Julia! Neil! Anyone!" Your walkie comes to life; it's Strauss, her voice filled with panic.

You pull the walkie off your belt loop.

"Please help us!" Strauss cries. "The captain keeps shooting but it's not doin—oh god."

Neil looks at you in horror. You click the button on side the side of the talkie. You say:

1.	[["Hold on, Doc. We're coming!"]]
2.	[["Serves you right."]]
3.	[[Say nothing; give the walkie to Meat.]]

You fire several shots into the sea of creatures and even kill a few, but they still surge toward you.

"Come on!" Meat roars. "This isn't a fight we can win."

You both retreat. "Neil," he yells into the comm. "Bring the Speedwell to the LZ. We need some fucking help here."

"Coming as fast I can," you hear Neil say.

You run and run and run. You lose feelings in your legs but somehow manage to keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but you manage to stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way, you see Markie running by herself--her suit covered in what appears to be blood. Ryan is nowhere to be seen. You've covered half the distance to her when, looking up, you see the Speedwell beginning its descent.

When you reach her, you take her by the arm and look through her visor. Her eyes are wild, and she's sweating.

"Markie," Meat says, "where's Ryan?"

She stutters. "D...d..dead."

"Fuck!" He turns back to the hole you and he emerged from. The wave of crabs has reached the mouth of the cave. In the light, they're purple and fungal looking.

He fires some shots at them while you tend to Markie. Her arm is wounded.

1.	[["You alright?"]]
2.	[[Stay silent and keep your hand over the tear in her suit.]]

incoming: "You better watch your tone, Doc. I'm getting tired of your bullshit."
text:
Strauss says nothing.  You can't help but notice Neil's grin.

"When are they supposed to be back?"

"An hour from when we left," Strauss says.

"How long ago was that?"

"I don't know. I'm a doctor, not a timekeeper."

"Sheesh. Well, okay, so what should we do to pass the time?"

"Time's going to pass regardless of what we do with it."

"Right. So you're going to sulk over there in the corner. Fine."
He turns to you. "Julia?"

1.	[[Rock, Paper, Scissors]]
2.	[[Tic-Tac-Toe]]
3.	[[Also sulk in silence]]

You go for your gun, but someone beats you to the trigger. A shot tears off Ben's lower jaw, sending it flying into the wall. The second splits his forehead. The body falls back onto the floor and continues to gurgle.

You turn to see Strauss holding up the captain's pistol, tears in her eyes.

"Doc," Meat says, but she walks past him and continues to fire round after round into the corpse. Ben goes silent and still.

"Lenore," Salvucci says, reaching out to comfort her. 

"We have to burn him too," she says, no hint of emotion in her voice. "Don't touch him. Don't want to risk infection anymore than we possibly have."

"What about airborne infection?" Salvucci asks.

"What of it?" she says. "If it's airborne, we're dead anyway."

"I'll go get some oil then," say Meat.

"And I'll check on the console in the cockpit and hope to god Neil had enough time or selflessness to set up our autopilot. Julia, why don't you go get our cryopods ready?"

1. [[Set up the cryopods.]]

"With what? Pistol rounds ain't gonna put that motherfucker down, Z."

1.[["With fisticuffs."]]
2.[["The hanger. We can use the hanger."]]

incoming: "I know. Now let's make it count."
text:
"Yeah," he says, not meeting your eyes. "I guess so."

"He gave you a password, right?" Strauss says. "Maybe there's an autopilot sequence on his computer."

"Doesn't do us any good if that thing is still stomping around."

"Do you really think it survived that blast?"

"Is that a serious question?"

"Either way, we need to get the ship moving. Let's get to the cockpit and decide what to do there."

You make your way toward the cockpit. About halfway there, Meat speaks.

"What was it doing when it killed Neil?"

"Evolving," Strauss answers.

"Did you get a good look at it?" Meat asks.

1.[["I didn't."]]
2.[["It had a lot of tentacles."]]

Salvucci is talking when you head over. You can see that Strauss is smiling, but it's a sad smile.

"She was a strong individual," Salvucci says. "I've had her on four voyages. One time, three years back, we were all on Europa at the hanger and everyone was boarding, and this guy sets off the detector. He opens his shirt and reveals enough explosives to decimate every person in the hanger. Meat, Me, couple of others have got our guns trained on him, but Markie-–she talked him down. She saw what nobody else saw:just a stupid kid gripped in the thrall of some fundamentalist nonsense. She saved at least one life that day, probably more."

"She was a good soldier," Strauss says sadly.

1.[["She was."]]
2.[["That's funny coming from the person who was more than ready to put her down a couple of hours ago."]]

You shoot Neil as well. His corpse falls to the floor. His lifeless eyes look up at you in confusion.

What now?

1. [[Wait it out.]]
2. [[Kill yourself.]]

"I had to kill him, you understand?" she says. "He attacked me."

"That's fine, doctor. He wasn't Ben anymore," Salvucci says.

"Relax, doc," Meat adds, rifle aimed at her chest.

"He bit me," she says, holding up her arm to show the bite mark. "Shit, he bit me."

Meat narrows his eyes and holds the rifle steadily. No one says anything. Tears stream down Strauss' face.

"Maybe if I had more time I could...but I can feel it in me now, coursing through my body. There's blood in the back of my throat. Vision blurry. Minutes. That's how long this takes to change us."

She looks at the pistol, turns it over in her hand as though she's seeing something she's never seen before.

"Kill it," she says. "Don't let it reach Mars."

Before any of you can stop her, she's pressed the barrel under her chin and pulled the trigger. Red splashes the ceiling. Strauss falls foward, head smashing into the floor.

"Fuck," Meat yells.

Whatever color was left in Salvucci's face drains. Meat, in a moment of calculated rage, lifts his foot high over Ben's skull and stomps it several times. The insides of the boy's head ooze out like the innards of an old tomato. After he's done with Ben, he steps over to Strauss' body and aims his rifle down at her head.

He looks at the captain, who nods. He fires four shots and obliterates the top half of the woman's face.

"Shit shit shit," he groans, stepping away from the mutilated corpse.

1.[["We should check on the pilot."]]

incoming: "Do I look like a fucking scientist, cap?"
text:
"What killed Ryan?" Neil continues.

"Stop talking, Neil," Salvucci says with a raised voice before turning back to you. "Maybe Strauss was right."

"Captain, I have to insist. Ryan is a childhood buddy. I know his family. Somebody tell me what's going on."

"Ryan got killed by some fucking thing," Meat says. "Markie got bit by these crab things and she's infected with something. Up to speed, dipshit? Let the adults talk now."

Neil sinks back into his chair. "He's dead," he says in disbelief.

1.[["We're going to be that way too if we don't get our head in the game, Neil."]]
2.[["Suck it up, Neil. Cry later."]]

"Should we look for it?" Neil says.

"Fuck that!" Meat says, turning. He aims his assault rifle at the first speaker and dismembers it with a single shot. He takes the second, third speakers out of commission as well. The music is no longer overpowering, but you can hear its echoes in the hallway.

"Brutal but effective," Strauss comments.

Salvucci frowns. "You're footing the bill for that when we get back."

Neil raises his finger. "Guys, now that Julia is awake, I think we should talk strategy. I just finished with our travel projections," Neil says.

"And?" Strauss says, as though she knows what's coming next.

"Well, it's like you said, doc: not good. Two months to Mars."

"We could last that long," Salvucci says. "We ration food, ammo, go in groups to the rest of the ship when we need supplies."

"Captain, permission to speak?" Meat says.

Salvucci nods.

"That's a horrible idea. We've got guns. Why don't we use them? For all we know, that beastie thing could be growing. We need to hunt it down and kill it now."

"Travis, I put a gun against Markie's head and blew her brains all over the floor. Apparently the thing inside her shook it off and walked away. I don't think bullets are going to save us."

"Then we destroy the body completely," Meat suggests. "Shoot it, stomp it, burn it, and then jettison the motherfucker into space."

"Captain, I don't like either choice, but I think the more cautious one would be eliminating its presence from the ship," Strauss says slowly.

"Didn't you say something about it being airborne?" Salvucci asks. "Could killing it infect one of us?"

Strauss sighs, shrugs. "There's no way to be sure. I didn't get to run any tests on it. However, I'd rather take a chance on that possibility than risk us starving ourselves into easy prey."

Silence fills the common room. Then—

"What do you think, Julia?" Neil asks.

Everyone turns to you.

1.	[["Let's kill it."]]
2.	[["Let's wait it out."]]

incoming: Continue onward to the mess hall.
text:
You proceed into the mess hall.

"Check everything," Salvucci orders. You check around the tables and near the entertainment closest while Meat looks around the kitchen. Salvucci keeps his eyes on the door.

You find some of you soy raisin cookies and pocket them. No monsters, though.

Meat pokes his head out of the kitchen. "Nothing."

"Shit," Salvucci says. "I guess we should go to the ba--" A high-pitched scream cuts him off. Then, gunfire.

"Strauss," Salvucci says.

"Well, come on, let's go," Meat says, running out of the kitchen, rifle in hands.

All of you run out the door and down the hallway toward Neil's cockpit. You're halfway there when you spot a sticky mass of flesh and blonde hair on the ground.

"It's Ben," Meat says.

You're almost to the body when Strauss, hair a mess and her cheek dripping with blood, steps out from the corner. Her shaky hands are gripped around the captain's pistol, a gun aimed at all three of you.

1. [["Doc, put the gun down."]]

The groups go their separate ways; you hike down the cliff with Meat. It takes the larger portion of an hour to reach your tunnel. You step inside.

"Let's get our lights on."

You both tell your suits to turn your on your light attachments. You flickers for a moment before shooting a cone of light from your chest compartment.

The two of you proceed through the cave. On the Head-Up Display (HUD) of your suit, you can see the heartbeat monitors of everyone in your squad. You see that yours is going a little faster than normal and, knowing that everyone else can see that, you feel a little embarrassed.

You proceed through the cave.

"You know what I want?" Meat asks. He doesn't wait for you to answer. "I want a fucking taco. Beef. Cheese. Some guac on top. No more of this space bag food bullshit."

1.[["Pizza."]]
2.[["Space food's not so bad."]]

"Meet us at the center of the crater!" Markie yells over the comm.

You look at Ryan's heart monitor: he's about to flatline.
 
That's when you hear the roar from the black.

You have a single bullet left.

1. [[End Ryan's pain.]]
2. [[Shoot the monster.]]

incoming: "Yeah, well, let's make sure he died for something worth dying for."
text:
"Yeah," he says, not meeting your eyes. "I guess so."

"He gave you a password, right?" Strauss says. "Maybe there's an autopilot sequence on his computer."

"Doesn't do us any good if that thing is still stomping around."

"Do you really think it survived that blast?"

"Is that a serious question?"

"Either way, we need to get the ship moving. Let's get to the cockpit and decide what to do there."

You make your way toward the cockpit. About halfway there, Meat speaks.

"What was it doing when it killed Neil?"

"Evolving," Strauss answers.

"Did you get a good look at it?" Meat asks.

1.[["It wiggled a lot."]]
2.[["I did not. I was too busy running for my life."]]

"When I was asking for support, I didn't mean that kind of support."

"You'll be fine, son," Salvucci says.

"We'll cut that fucker down before it even gets close."

"Reassuring. Really. So can I at least have the knowledge of where I'm going to die before we get there?"

"Sickbay," Salvucci says. "Tight space, we'll wait on the outside."

"Sickbay," Neil repeats. "I'm going to die in sickbay."

"Just move it," Meat says. "The sooner we get there, the sooner we kill it."

You notice a trace of uneasiness in Meat's voice.

1.[[Onward to Sickbay.]]

"No," she says, turning away from you. "But it is."

You turn just in time to make out the tentacle that rends your head from your body.

The last sound you hear is the beast roaring with satisfaction.

The End

incoming: Pull out your pistol and fire blindly.
text:
Meat fires the rifle across the room, the gun's light chasing Markie's feet as she darts away. You raise your pistol and fire blindly in front of Meat's light, hoping to hit her with a lucky shot. Beside you, Neil screams in terror.

You hear the tell-tell click of the rifle as the clip goes dry. Meat swings the rifle around to point the flashlight at the door.

"Go!"

You all make a beeline for the door. Meat yanks on the handle and light bleeds into the darkness, as all three of you sprint into the hallway. You slam the door and then bend over to catch your breath. Luckily, you manage to pull back just in time to avoid the spew of vomit that erupts from Neil's mouth.

"That was Markie—our Markie?" he says, wiping the spittle from his lip.

"Yeah, it was," Meat answers, a tinge of sadness in his voice. He reloads the clip. "This is my last one."

"Why didn't she attack us?"

1.[["She wants us to run out of resources."]]
2.[["She's toying with us."]]

"Guess not," he says, seeing the expression on your face. 

"I'll just go over here and play with this tablet."

"Idiot," you hear Strauss mutter.

You take a seat on the examination table and look around the wrecked room. You're staring at the bloodstains left by Ben's corpse when the door opens and in walk Meat and Salvucci; both men wear dark expressions.

"I'm guessing your hunt was uneventful?" Strauss says.

"Yeah, go on and rub it then," Meat says, turning to rifle through the medical cabinets.

"What are you looking for?"

"Food."

"This is a medical facility. What makes you think there's food in here?"

Meat opens one of the lower cabinets and, after a moment, pulls out a large bag of apricot chips.

"Your assistant told me about his stash a while back."

"I'm glad you can eat his food while his blood is smeared all over the floor."

"Not like he's going to need them," Meat says with a shrug.

"Enough you two," Salvucci barks. "Pilot, you all right?"

"Yeah, I'm fine, captain. Thanks for asking."

"Did you three see anything?"

"No," Strauss says.

1.[["Where did you look?"]]
2.[["Did it leave any sort of trail?"]]

incoming: "We can't turn on each other, man."
text:
"Sorry," he says. "She's just getting on my nerves. I know she's had it rough. She and Ben were a thing, so she's on edge even more than usual, I guess."

The two of you enter the cafeteria and then, after taking a precautionary look around, you go into the kitchen and begin to stuff everything you can get your hands on into the two bags you brought from sickbay: fruit chips, soda, water bottles, pastries, canned soup.

When you've filled the bags, you leave the cafeteria and make your way to the common room. Strauss, Neil, and Salvucci are waiting. The common room is a circular room with a couch, several chairs, and a large wall-mounted monitor connected a server archive of countless movies, shows, and documentaries.  

On the back wall, there are portholes—just like on the ships of old that sailed the waters of Earth—where you can gaze into the dark of space.

"Run into any trouble?" Salvucci asks as you hand him the bag.

"Didn't see a damn thing," Meat says.

"I'm telling you," Strauss says, rubbing her bandaged arm, "we won't see it until it wants us to see it."

Meat grumbles something about paranoia and then heads over to the table, where Neil is setting up a checkers board.

"How's your arm, doctor?" Salvucci asks.

"Fine, captain. Thank you."

You're a bit tired.

What should you do?

1.[[Talk to Neil and Meat.]]
2.[[Take a nap.]]

You go four rounds. Neil wins two of them (rock over scissors each time). You with the other two times, with paper over rock.

You're about to start the fifth round when the second door to sickbay opens, and Meat and Salvucci step inside; both men were dark expressions.

"I'm guessing your hunt was uneventful?" Strauss says.

"Yeah, go on and rub it then," Meat says, turning to rifle through the medical cabinets.

"What are you looking for?"

"Food."

"This is a medical facility. What makes you think there's food in here?"

Meat opens one of the lower cabinets and, after a moment, pulls out a large bag of apricot chips.

"Your assistant told me about his stash a while back."

"I'm glad you can eat his food while his blood is smeared all over the floor."

"Not like he's going to need them," Meat says with a shrug.

"Enough you two," Salvucci barks. "Pilot, you all right?"

"Yeah, I'm fine, captain. Thanks for asking."

"Did you three see anything?"

"No," Strauss says.

1.	[["Where did you look?"]]
2.	[["Did it leave any sort of trail?"]]

You push Neil to the side and ram the butt of the pistol into Markie's face. Flesh and pus and blood splash your arm; the revolting stench gets in your nostrils. You hit Markie in the face again and again. Her blood's on your face now, in your eyes, in your mouth.

The body goes limp. You stop. And then, finally having a chance to smell what you're covered in, you vomit.

"Julia?" Neil says tapping you on the shoulder.

You respond by throwing up some more. You're lightheaded and swaying.

Neil says your name again, but you can barely hear it over the screams, a woman hollering inside your head so loud it cracks the walls of you skull and sets your synapses aflame.

It's Markie. "Mine," she shrieks. "Mine!"

You're falling. You succumb to the dark. But in that darkness, she talks to you. Her voice mingling with a deeper one, the voice of the monster. Of the thing that killed her and Ryan and Strauss.

You are mine, it says, but you're stronger than those who have come before you. I cannot break your will so easily, so I offer you an opportunity: allow what's happening to you to happen and we can achieve the destiny of my race together. You will be a legend. If you do not, we will find another way regardless. We've slept in the chambers of your planet for your species' entire existence, waiting. The stars are our destiny--not yours. Your struggle is inevitable. Join us for infamy or sacrifice yourself for nothing.

1. [[Join it.]]
2. [[Sacrifice yourself for humanity.]]

incoming: "I am so close to shoving that saw up your ass."
text:
She doesn't turn to look at you. "Yes, yes, you're very frightening, Zoe. Now go away."

You leave before your anger gets the best of you.

1.[[Go eat something.]]

Markie's nametag, covered in grime.

"So, she's like dead, right?" Neil says, picking gunk out of his hair. "We're safe now."

"Why did she die, though? And why like that?" Salvucci asks.

"Travis," Strauss says. "What did you say earlier?"

"What?"

"You said something a minute ago. What was it?"

1.[["He said it was a bomb."]]

incoming: "She wants us to run out of ammo."
text:
"She's doing a hell of a job of it, then. Played us like a fuckin' fiddl—"

"Zoe! Neil! Anyone!" Your walkie comes to life; it's Strauss, her voice filled with panic.

You pull the walkie off your belt loop.

"Please help us!" Strauss cries. "The captain keeps shooting but it's not doin—oh god."

Neil looks at you in horror. You click the button on side the side of the walkie. You say:

1.[["Hang on! We're on the way."]]
2.[["That's what you get."]]

"I already took one risk today, Julia, and that got someone else killed. Superstitious or not, we're doing this. Now come on."

Salvucci leaves the room. You turn to look at Meat. He's pale.

1.[["Good luck."]]
2.[["Be careful."]]
3.[["You sick fuck."]]

incoming: "Whatever it is, we've got enough firepower to put it down."
text:
Salvucci's furrows his brow. "Not a comforting answer."

"What killed Ryan?" Neil continues.

"Stop talking, Neil," Salvucci says with a raised voice before turning back to you. "Maybe Strauss was right."

"Captain, I have to insist. Ryan is a childhood buddy. I know his family. Somebody tell me what's going on."

"Ryan got killed by some fucking thing," Meat says. "Almost got us too. Up to speed, dipshit? Let the adults talk now."

Neil sinks back into his chair. "He's dead," he says in disbelief.

1.[["We're going to be that way too if we don't get our head in the game, Neil."]]
2.[["Suck it up, Neil. Cry later."]]

"I...I had to," she stutters. Everyone watches as you pick up your pistol and stick the barrel against her chest.

"Do it," Meat growls.

"Zoe, let's think about this," Neil says, sweating.

"There wasn't any other way, please, Zoe. He would have killed us."

The first shot sends her reeling, clutching the wound with her hands.

"Stop!" Neil yells.

Meat points his pistol at her as well.

"Guys, guys stop," Neil screams.

"Burn," Meat tells her. He fires a shot into her chest. She gasps and falls to the ground.

You aim at her head and squeeze the trigger one last time. She goes still.

Meat leans over and spits on her body.

Neil moans in horror. "Travis..."

"She would have killed us, man; the moment she saw any of us as a threat, she would have killed us without a thought, just to save her sorry hide. Good riddance."

Meat lights up his molotov and throws it atop Ben and the captain's corpses.

"So, uh, what do we do now?" Neil says, watching the bodies burn.

"We're not done hunting, Neil."

"With what? You saw what bullets did to Ben: took a whole damn clip and then some."

"We'll have to improvise, won't we? I don't know about you, but I sure as fuck don't plan on being some monster's dinner."

1.[["We draw it out."]]

"Shit. I'm sure you did what you had to. Make your way back to the hall."

You do so. Meat and Salvucci are below you, waiting. Meat looks away from you.

"Are you sure it's dead?" the captain asks.

1.[["It's not getting back up."]]
2.[["I think so...but I couldn't tell for sure."]]

"You're right. You saved my life and I'm grateful for that. I just hope you did more than briefly delay my demise."\n\n1.[["Any ideas how to beat that thing?"]]

incoming: "Come on. Let's get out of here."
text:
"Yeah, let's."

The two of you walk back through the hallway leading to the hanger and then to the cockpit. The bodies of your crew are still there. Meat stares at them.

"Do you think if we had made different choices, they'd still be alive?"

1.[["I really don't know."]]
2.[["Does it matter?"]]

"No," she says, turning away from you. "But it is."

You turn just in time to make out the tentacle that rends your head from your body.

The last sound you hear is the beast roaring with satisfaction.

The End

"I'm fine. The hole isn't that big."

"What happened to Ryan?" Meat shouts over the roar of Speedwell's engine as the ship lands.

1.[["Fucking thing ate him."]]
2.[["It happened so fast."]]

"You too, princess."

He gets in position. A second later, the door bursts open and flies across the hanger. In steps the monster, eyes looking about wildly.

It takes a step toward you.

"Over here, motherfucker!" Meat shouts through his suit's comm.

It growls and moves toward him. Its footsteps leave imprints in the steel floor.

Meat backs away from the droids until his back is pressed against the wall. He grabs onto a wall-railing.
The monster steps in front of the line of droids.

"Do it, do it now."

You take aim at the switch on the far wall. You fire.
The shot slams into the switch, and the alarms blare. Meat slowly pulls himself along the rail until he's behind the droids.

The hanger door opens and air swooshes out. You grip the railing beside you.

"Hold on!"

The beast begins to backslide toward the hanger door, its feet dragging. It tries to throw a tentacle at Meat, but they're pulled as well. Seconds later they snap off and go flying into the black.  

Meat, clinging to the railing, kicks the droids. It takes a second for them to detach from their holders and tumble down into the behemoth. The first one knocks it back a couple of feet. The second droid seals the monster's fate, knocking it off both of its feet and sending it careening into the stars.

"Eat shit and die, you fuck!" Meat screams through the comm. You can't help but grin as the monster spins out of sight.

The alarms in the hanger continue to yell for a couple of seconds, and then the emergency seal protocol activates, and the hanger door slowly slides to a close again.

"We did it," Meat says. "We fucking did it."

He walks over to you and hugs you tightly. You both laugh. 

"We're alive!"

1.[["Come on. Let's get out of here."]]

"Yeah, well this is officially plan Z. There is no other plan."

The door behind you clangs.

"Shit," Strauss says, coating the last bullet. "At least we don't have to bait it now.

A louder bang now. A tentacle penetrates the door.

"Come on, let's go!"

You leave through the other sickbay door. In the hallway, she hands you your pistol. You find the viewport. It's a spacious square of glass that takes up half the wall. Behind you, there is the sound of giant, reveberating footsteps.

"He's coming. You get near the switch. I'll jump back after you shoot the window." Strauss positions herself near the window; you stand next to the switch. 

The creature approaches. It growls as it lumbers toward the doctor. Both the monster and Strauss are close to the window now.

1. [[Shoot the window.]]
2. [[Shoot Strauss first.]]

He stops punching the wall. Blood drips from his fingers. He breathes heavily.

"He's dead because of us."

1.[["Yeah, well, let's make sure he died for something worth dying for."]]
2.[["Get your head in the fucking game."]]

You all laugh. You see a smile creep onto Salvucci's face.

"You're the reason we're alive. You can expect great things when we get back."

Both Meat and Neil help you into your pod. 

"Don't worry, you won't be the only human popsicle. We're just going to make sure the ship's clean before we all go to sleep. Rest easy."

1.[["Yeah, yeah, get on with it."]]
2.[["When I wake up, I expect to have kickass robo-limbs."]]

"It doesn't work like that, Ryan. I'm reading at least seven tunnels, carved out exactly the same size."

"Meaning what?"

"There might be something down there."

"Spooky," Meat says, peering at the expanse of the crater.

For a moment no one says anything.

1.[["We should check it out, right?"]]
2.[["Let's check it out."]]
3.[["I feel like nobody really wants to go down there, and that no one is going to say otherwise if we leave out some details out of our report. Sound good to everybody else? Good."]]
4. [[Absentmindedly kick rocks while you wait for someone to answer.]]

It's a hard choice, but in the end, you get to your feet and sprint past the monster as it slaughters Strauss and Meat. You can hear their screams as you run down the hall. Soon things are mercifully silent. 

You climb up into the ventilation and decide to make your base of operations there. You're a survivor, you tell yourself. All you have to do is stay alive two months. That's all.

You go, day by day, into the ship in search of supplies. You often go to the mess hall to stock up on food and bring it back to the vents. You run into the creature twice. Each time it's grown bigger, nastier. The first time, you get away without a scratch.

The second time, a tentacle pierces your ankle. You still manage to hop away, but you can't climb into the vent because of your injury. You seek refuge in the darkness of the barracks. Soon every breath brings pain. You refuse to accept the hand you've been dealt, even when Strauss, half her head missing, sits down beside you to have a chat.

"You had a good run, idiot," she says. You stare at her ravaged face. 

1.[["You're not real."]]

"Yeah," he says, his smile fading. "Except for them."

Neither of you says a word for a moment. Meat breaks the silence. "I'm gonna go tell them you're awake and we'll get your pod ready."

He leaves and comes back a couple minutes later, grabbing a wheelchair from the corner of the room. "All right, let's get you in. Just don't look at your foot."

He helps you into the chair.

1. [[Look at your foot.]]
2. [[Don't look at your foot.]]

Meat takes the walkie. "Neil?"

"She's fucking here, guys. She reeks."

"Sit tight," Meat says. He nods at you. Both of you creep to the door. Meat pushes it open slightly and peers out. You look out as well.

Neil is backing into a wall, face red and dripping with perspiration. Several feet away is Markie. You can smell her from here, but that's not what's making you struggle not to gag. Her face is a jagged piece of flesh hanging from her skull, her sockets void of eyeballs.

"Stay away from me," Neil begs.

It lumbers toward the pilot, groaning. Several teeth fall to the ground in a mixture of salvia and blood.

"Now," Meat says.

The two of you emerge from the kitchen. Markie doesn't even have time to turn her head before rifle fire rips the neck from her body and her head tumbles to the floor, smashing to the ground like a pumpkin.

Meat opens his mouth to let loose a witty remark, but vomit emerges. You're not far behind, the smell finally having gotten the best of you. Luckily, there's not much for you and your partner to barf up.

"Oh godfuckingshit," Neil yells. "That was Markie."

He takes a step closer to the body.

"So, we like win now, right? They're all dead?"

"Yeah, I think—"

Meat is cut off by the sound of Markie's hand slapping the floor as the body convulses, pus and blood shooting from the decimated neck stump. He fires the rest of the clip into the corpse.

1. [[Shoot it!]]
2. [[Dart into the kitchen.]]

No sense in delaying the inevitable.

You press the gun against your temple. You pull the trigger. You lifeless body collapses onto the floor to join the others.

Your ship drifts through space for nearly a decade until it finally collides with an asteroid and explodes, vaporizing your corpses.

The End

You take out the immiediate threat first, blowing Salvucci's mind out the back of his skull. The captain slumps.

Neil puts his hand up to block the next round but the bullet tears through his palm and into his chest. He takes a step backward. You fire another shot. He falls back onto the console.

Good child, the voice says. Now set a course for the human world.

You approach the console, pushing Neil's corpse out of the way. Neil was logged in, luckily. You play around with the settings until you find the autopilot and set a course for Mars.

The voice tells you it's proud of you and that great things await. It tells you to wait, so you do. Later on, your body seizes and you flop to the ground like a fish. You watch with a mixture of horror and fascination as your arm explodes, spraying blood, skin, and bone everywhere, to reveal a purple jagged claw.

Now, the voice says, your work truly begins. You follow its instructions and penetrate the chest cavities of Meat, Neil, and Salvucci with your claw. An hour later they've all risen. Of course, they're not really the people you knew. They're walking cocoons, dead flesh nuturing future soldiers.

It strikes you as odd that you should feel no guilt, but you chalk it up to how quickly you're evolving. Maybe guilt was, after all, a weakness that needed to be culled. The closer you get to Mars, the more changes your body undergoes. 

First, another claw sprouts. Next, in your sleep, you lose your skin and find it replaced with a hard shell-like body. You teeth fall from your mouth and are replaced with the kind of teeth monsters in fairy tales have.

When you're a day away from the red planet, your soldiers hatch. They look like smaller versions of you.

They are to obey your every command, the voice says. Do not disappoint us, child.
 
Soon you have forgotten your human life and have not only come to terms with what you are, but you look forward to your duties. The descendents of your new species will sing songs of your exploits and worship the very ground you have tread.

Mars looms and with it, your future.

The End

incoming: "Don't you say a goddamn word to me."
text:
"I guess I shouldn't expect kindness from any of you, though I only did what had to be done."

Meat lights the rag and then tosses the bottle at the corpses. Ben goes up in flames quickly. The captain isn't far behind.

"Come on, let's go," Neil says.

"Yes," Strauss says. "Anywhere but here."

"Sure you don't want to watch your boyfriend barbecue?" Meat says.

Strauss gives him a look of pure malice and then walks around the corner.

Neil waits until she's out of sight. "What now?"

Meat looks at him. "We're not done hunting."

"Did either of you get the captain's pistol?"

"Yeah, it didn't have any ammo in it, though. That's not good. Man is...was a crackshot. That thing probably soaked up all those bullets like a sponge."

"We'll have to improvise."

The three of you leave. You don't look back at the bodies, but you can hear the flesh crackling.

Strauss is waiting for you down the hallway, arms folded, the stony quality of her face fully returned. "What now?" she says.

"We find the other one and kill it."

"Yes, but how precisely? What's our strategy?"

1.[["We need someone up in the vents."]]

incoming: "I really should have let him kill you."

1.[["We need someone up in the vents."]]

You both retreat.

"Neil," he yells into the comm. "Bring the Speedwell to the LZ. We need some fucking help here."

"Coming as fast I can," Neil replies.

You run and run and run. You lose feeling in your legs but somehow manage to keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but you eventually stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way, you see Markie running by herself--her suit covered in what appears to be blood. Ryan is nowhere to be seen. You've covered half the distance to her when, looking up, you see the Speedwell beginning its descent.

When you reach her, you take her by the arm and look through her visor. Her eyes are wild and she's sweating.

"Markie," Meat says, "where's Ryan?"

She stutters. "D...d..dead."

"Fuck!" He turns back to the hole you and he emerged from. The wave of crabs has reached the mouth of the cave. In the light, they're purple and fungal looking.

He fires some shots at them while you tend to Markie. Her arm is wounded.

1.[["Are you okay?"]]
2. [[Remain silent and keep your hand over the tear in her suit.]]

incoming: "Look, all I know is that whatever we found on Earth wasn't human."
text:
"What killed Ryan?" Neil continues.

"Stop talking, Neil," Salvucci says with a raised voice before turning back to you. "Maybe Strauss was right."

"Captain, I have to insist. Ryan is a childhood buddy. I know his family. Somebody tell me what's going on."

"Ryan got killed by some fucking thing," Meat says. "Markie got bit by something else and is infected with a disease. Up to speed, dipshit? Let the adults talk now."

Neil sinks back into his chair. "He's dead," he says in disbelief.

1. [[Give him a comfort pat and offer your condolences.]]
2. [[Refrain from doing anything.]]

incoming: "I should have let him kill you."

"Yeah, it didn't have any ammo in it, though. That's not good. Man is...was a crackshot. That thing probably soaked up all those bullets like a sponge."

"We'll have to improvise."

1.[["We need someone in the air ducts."]]

"Oh no no no no," Strauss says. She sticks her fingers in her mouth.

"What the hell are you doing, doctor?"

She retches and pulls her fingers out. "What does it look like? We could be infected. Shit, we shouldn't even fucking be here right now. Get out!"

She gets up and makes a dash for the door. The rest of you follow her into the hallway. "Showers," she yells.  She leads you to the shower stalls.

"Shouldn't we be using the one in your lab?" Meat asks, taking his shirt off.

"Not enough time," she says, ripping off her shirt and bra, not bothering to cover her breasts. "Hurry!" She rushes into one of the stall.

You disrobe and disappear into a stall of your own. Hot water washes over you, cleansing you of the gunk on your body.

"Wash your hair! Make sure every bit of you is clean!" Strauss screams.

You shampoo and rinse your hair. You spend half an hour scrubbing yourself. When you step out, Meat thrusts a towel in your hands--his eyes closed--so you can cover yourself. You wrap yourself up and go to your locker to fetch your spare uniform. A couple of minutes later, you're dressed. You step back into the shower room to see Meat putting on his boots. Salvucci, Strauss, and Neil are there as well wearing their uniforms.

1.[["Everybody cool?"]]

incoming: "Listen to me: this is not on you."
text:
"Yeah," he says, not meeting your eyes. "Whatever. We need...we need to get this thing moving again. He gave you a password, right? Let's hope that console has autopilot or some shit. Worry about that motherfucker then."

The two of you make your way toward the cockpit.

A few minutes later you reach the cockpit door. Ben's body is still there, as are the burnt remains of the captain.

"Well, that's good, all things considered," says Meat. You step into the cockpit. The door slides shut behind you.

"Here's the computer."

You step over to the main console. A password screen greets you. You type in "KONAMI."

The screen changes to a selection of menus.

"Here we go: autopilot" says Meat. He touches the screen and selects NEW AUSTIN. You head for the door.

"All right, good. We're set. Let's get the hell out of her--"
A tentacle sweeps through the door as soon as it opens and brushes both of you aside with a mighty swing. 

You slam into the viewport, cracking the glass, and then fall to the floor. Looking up, you see the thing step into view: it's monstrous, with a muscular human abdomen.

The thing's face is distinctly unhuman with countless, slitted eyes glaring at you. The monster's mouth is a vortex of meat and sharp teeth. Four tentacles protrude from its back, each one moving like a rattle snake.

You turn to look at Meat. He's being lifted into the air by one of the tentacles. His face turns red; he's slowly being choked to death.

You reach for your pistol.

1. [[Risk your life to save Meat.]]
2. [[Leave Meat to die and save yourself.]]

incoming: "She was infected. She killed Meat out of cowardice."
text:
"God," Salvucci says.

"And then there were three," Neil says.

"We're probably infected too," Salvucci says quietfully.

"But there's been no symptoms yet."

"What if they never show up until years later? When we're back on Mars."

"Then a doctor could take care of us or something, man."

You see Salvucci slowly reach for his pistol again. "I can't take that risk. If our survival puts humanity at risk..."

"Cap," Neil says, backing into the wall. "Think straight here."

"I'm sorry, pilot. I'm sure Zoe agrees."

1. [[Let Salvucci kill you.]]
2. [[Kill him first.]]

Before the words can leave your mouth, there's a whooshing sound followed by a giant spike tearing through Ryan's chest, splattering the cave with red. Ryan's pistol drops to the floor. He moans. 

You cast your light on the protruding spike and realize, as your comrade is slowly being lifted in the air, that it's a limb of some sort.

Markie's voice barks over the comm. "Julia! What's happening? Ryan's vitals are dropping." You fire several shots into the darkness. One of them slaps into Ryan's arm; his blue eyes gaze at you in shock.

Meat now: "Julia? Answer us, girl. What the hell is going on?"

1.[["Get the Speedwell here now!"]]
2.[["We've got to go!"]]
3.[["Something's got Ryan!"]]

"Ryan, let Captain Salvucci know what we've found. Let's try and get a pick-up at the LZ in two hours."

"Aye."

"That thing loaded, Meat?"

"Duh."

"Okay, I'm thinking we should split up to cover more ground. How should we do this?"

1.[["I'm with Ryan."]]
2.[["I'm with Markie."]]
3.[["I'm with Meat."]]

incoming: "Oh good, that means your ass is useless in a fight."
text:
"Yes," she says. "I guess it does, doesn't it?"

The two of you proceed down the main hallway. The silence is heavy, and Strauss seems to be deep in her own thoughts.

1.[["What's waiting for you back on Mars?"]]
2.[["What's up with you and Meat?"]]

You put two rounds each into both of them. They're both dead before they hit the floor.

What now?

1. [[Wait it out.]]
2. [[Kill yourself.]]

"Right? She's a total asshole. No doubt about it."

The two of you enter the cafeteria and then, after taking a precautionary look around, you go into the kitchen and begin to stuff everything you can get your hands on into the two bags you brought from sickbay: fruit chips, soda, water bottles, pastries, canned soup.

When you've filled the bags, you leave the cafeteria and make your way to the common room. Strauss, Neil, and Salvucci are waiting. The common room is a circular room with a couch, several chairs, and a large wall-mounted monitor connected a server archive of countless movies, shows, and documentaries.  

On the back wall, there are portholes—just like on the ships of old that sailed the waters of Earth—where you can gaze into the dark of space.

"Run into any trouble?" Salvucci asks as you hand him the bag.

"Didn't see a damn thing," Meat says.

"I'm telling you," Strauss says, rubbing her bandaged arm, "we won't see it until it wants us to see it."

Meat grumbles something about paranoia and then heads over to the table, where Neil is setting up a checkers board.

"How's your arm, doctor?" Salvucci asks.

"Fine, captain. Thank you."

You're a bit tired.

What should you do?

1. [[Talk to Neil and Meat.]]
2. [[Take a nap.]]

You hear him call your name as you turn and begin your sprint down the hall.

Idiot, it says. I offered you evolution, wretch.

Blood drips from your nose. There's a pain in your stomach. You have to hurry.

You reach the hanger within a minute and seal the door behind you. There's a wetness on your lips now. You taste nickles.

You approach the hanger door and place your hand over the release button. Your legs go numb and you fall to the floor, hand still held against the button. You press it and close your eyes. There's a whoosing sound as air is sucked past you, stinging your cheeks.

The first thing you feel is the cold. You open your eyes to see the Speedwell in all its glory as you drift away. The thing in your brain screams in anger and despair, but another voice cuts through. "Just let go," Markie says, her voice free of malice and madness.

You turn away from your ship and peer out across the ocean of [[stars]] to gaze at the sun in the far distance. It's quite pleasant from afar.

You take her advice.

The End

"Either way, we'll burn the corpses. Travis, take care of it."

"On it," Meat says, leaving you two alone.

"Come on, we'll head to the cockpit. See if we can figure out how to fly this thing."

If only it were that easy. You and Salvucci discover Neil's console locked.

"Did he ever tell you his password?"

1.[["He didn't."]]

But he doesn't. "Doctor Strauss left me here, and...and Markie chased her into the hallway. I can't believe she did that."

He turns to you, eyes welling with tears. 

1. [[Move to comfort him]]
2. [[Don't touch him]]

"Will try," she says and then takes off running and screaming, "Help!"

"Five minutes,"  Salvucci says. "That's all we give her."

Meat nods. Her footsteps (and screams) trail away.

After three minutes, Salvucci says "She's had enough time. Let's go."

The three of you run down the hall to sickbay. She's inside, screwing a hose into a black machine in the corner of the room. She looks up. "I told you to give me mor--"

She's interrupted by Markie's descent from the ventilation shaft onto the examination table. She growls at all of you. A giant purple claw has sprouted out of her missing arm. The other arm is rotting, like the rest of her body.

"Prettyprettyprettypretty."

Out of the corner of your eye, you see the cauterizing saw on the table next to the bed. 

1. [[Use the saw.]]
2. [[Use your gun.]]
Javy Gwaltney

Meat lights the rag and then tosses the bottle at the corpses. Ben goes up in flames quickly. The captain isn't far behind.

"Come on, let's go," Neil says.

"Yes," Strauss says. "Anywhere but here."

"Sure you don't want to watch your boyfriend barbecue?"

Strauss gives him a look of pure malice and then walks around the corner.

Neil waits until she's out of sight. "What now?"

Meat looks at him. "We're not done hunting."

"Did either of you get the captain's pistol?"

"Yeah, it didn't have any ammo in it, though. That's not good. Man is...was a crackshot. That thing probably soaked up all those bullets like a sponge."

"We'll have to improvise."

The three of you leave. You don't look back at the bodies, but you can hear the flesh crackling.

Strauss is waiting for you down the hallway, arms folded, the stony quality of her face fully returned. "What now?" she says.

"We find the other one and kill it."

"Yes, but how, precisely? What's our strategy?"

1.[["We need someone in the air ducts."]]

"Those three people were under my command. Their lives were in my hands. At the very least I made a decision that cost that boy his life. He wasn't even twenty years old yet."

You hear his voice break.

1.[["I would have made the same choice."]]
2.[["Bear the weight later. There are still lives in danger here."]]

"Listen, I know this sucks but look at it this way: you get a cool robo foot now! And some fingers too! And we're all gonna get citations after this at the very least."

1.[["Except for the dead."]]
2.[["I better get a lot more than a citation for my goddamn foot."]]

Salvucci pulls out pistol and puts a round through Neil's forehead.

You close your eyes as he points the gun at you. You never open them again.

The End

"Right. I understand." She doesn't meet your eyes.

The cabbie drops you off first at your home in the suburbs.

"Julia," Strauss says as you get out of the car. "Take care, okay?"

1. [["Thanks, doc."]]
2. [["I will."]]

"Hanger it is then," Meat says.

"One of us needs to lead it there," Strauss says. "Play wounded. Beg for help. The others have to hang back otherwise it won't fall for the trick."

"I don't like this," Salvucci says.

"Me neither, but she ain't wrong," Meat says grimly. "Somebody's got to be ready to put it all on the line for this."

"I'll go," Strauss says.

Meat can't hide his shock. "What?"

"I think we've already established I'm pretty helpless, which means that thing has too. It'll come running."

"This is fucking crazy. Cap, we can't send her out there.I'll go," Meat says.

"You're the biggest of us. It won't go after you, not until it's killed everyone else off. It has to be me."

Salvucci furrows his brow. He unholsters his pistol and hands it to Strauss. "I want my gun back, doctor. Be careful."

"Yes sir."

"Five minutes and then we're coming after you," Meat says.

She nods.

1.[["You finally turn out to be useful."]]
2.[["Don't let it eat you."]]

Neil grabs a tablet from the counter and opens the Tic-Tac-Toe program that comes installed on every device by that developer. You play seven times and tie each time.

"This game is pretty dumb," he says.

You're about to start the eighth round when the second door to sickbay opens, and Meat and Salvucci step inside; both men wear dark expressions.

"I'm guessing your hunt was uneventful?" Strauss says.

"Yeah, go on and rub it then," Meat says, turning to rifle through the medical cabinets.

"What are you looking for?"

"Food."

"This is a medical facility. What makes you think there's food in here?"

Meat opens one of the lower cabinets and, after a moment, pulls out a large bag of apricot chips.

"Your assistant told me about his stash a while back."

"I'm glad you can eat his food while his blood is smeared all over the floor."

"Not like he's going to need them," Meat says with a shrug.

"Enough you two," Salvucci barks. "Pilot, you all right?"

"Yeah, I'm fine, captain. Thanks for asking."

"Did you three see anything?"

"No," Strauss says.

1.	[["Where did you look?"]]
2.	[["Did it leave any sort of trail?"]]

"Good. Give me your gun and turn the gas on before you leave."

"There's no way out except through the front."

"Vent," he says, pointing at a vent near one of the stoves. "...Gotta crawl fast. I'll give you as much time as I can."

A clanging at the door. Whatever was inside Markie, was now trying to get in the kitchen.

"This ain't fucking right, man. It's not right at all."

"Just give me your damn gun, dude." He coughs. Meat, with reluctance, takes the pistol from his holster and sticks it in Neil's hand. 

Strauss quickly turns on all the gas stoves in the room.

Another bang at the door. The tip of a tentacle pierces the door and writhes wildly about, slapping a nearby wall.

"Go," Neil says, fighting to stay conscious.

1.[["I'm sorry."]]
2. [[Leave.]]

Shit. We can't set this to autopilot or send out a distress beacon without access to that console."

"What's the trouble, cap?" Meat says, stepping through the door.

"Neil had a password. Do you know it?"

Meat shakes his head.

"Okay, what did we know about him?"

"He liked video games," Meat offers, approaching the console.
Salvucci slowly inputs "FLAPPY BIRD XXXXXXI."

ACCESS DENIED, the screen reads.

"Worth a shot."

You all spend an hour typing various game titles, but none of them work. Eventually you give up and retire to the mess hall where Salvucci cooks steak for you both. Both men sit away from you when it's time to eat.

You eat quietly.

The next day you all try again with various game titles to no avail. 

"To think everything hinges on a goddamn video game," Meat says.

For days it goes like this, your ship still drifting in space. Eventually you run out of food. You all try for hours in desperation to magically conjure up the password, but it's no good. The three of you realize that at that point you're just making up titles that sound like video games: Masher Nasher, The Adventures of Wallaby Dingo.

You all make your way to the mess hall and sit quietly, removed from one another. You think of your home back on Mars. You're glad you didn't get a pet. You wonder if anyone besides your parents will mourn your passing. Will they ever even know? You stare out one of the hall's viewports into space, you grave. There are worse ways to die, you say to yourself, than floating among the stars. 

It's hardly a comfort for you in the days to come. 

One day, Salvucci takes his life, a gunshot ringing out on the far side of the ship, away from the mess hall, away from you and Meat.

"You know," Meat tells you a week later. "I thought about eating you."

1.[["Why did you decide not to?"]]

Meat fires the rifle across the room, the gun's light chasing Markie's feet as she darts away. You make a run for where you think the door is. Behind you, Neil screams in terror.

You hear the tell-tell click of the rifle as the clip goes dry. Meat swings the rifle around to point the flashlight at the door.
"Go!"

In the dark, you find the handle and yank on it. Light bleeds into the darkness, as all three of you sprint into the hallway. You slam the door and then bend over to catch your breath. Luckily, you manage to pull back just in time to avoid the spew of vomit that erupts from Neil's mouth.

"That was Markie—our Markie?" he says, wiping the spittle from his lip.

"Yeah, it was," Meat answers, a tinge of sadness in his voice. He reloads the clip. "This is my last one."

"Why didn't she attack us?"

1.	[["She wants us to run out of resources."]]
2.	[["She's toying with us."]]

He nods. "Yeah. I mean, it's probably running around the ship, growing stronger by the minute, y'know?"

No one answers him. 

He takes a breath. "Okay, well, how are we going to do this?"

"We'll go to the cafeteria—big, open space."

You all make your way to the cafeteria, eyes watching the walls and vents. The journey is a safe one. 

All of you step into the cafeteria.

Neil looks out across the tables like a man looking at his own grave.

"I always thought lunchrooms were kind of scary when I was a kids, ‘cause of the bullies and all. Never thought I'd die in one, though."

"You'll be fine," Meat says. "We'll be in the other room. You're gonna stay in here and use your walkie."

"To do what?"

"Beg for help," Strauss says. "Cry. Be bait."

"How's it gonna hear that?"

"Marki—what used to be Markie has a walkie clipped to her belt."

"And if she thinks it's a trap?"

"Then we come up with another plan. It's animalistic though. I doubt it'll pass up a wounded animal."

"Gee thanks."

You, Meat, and Strauss step into the kitchen and move away from the door. He turns to you. "Make sure you have your gun ready, okay? I don't want Neil to get eaten because we ran dry."

You check your pistol to make sure it has a full clip and nod. You all sit silently and listen to Neil in the other room. "Please help me," you hear him beg. "I can't find you guys."

This goes on for 20 whole minutes, Neil's acting growing steadily worse. "I fucking hurt my leg," he whimpers.

"A thespian, he is not," Strauss says.

"Just let the boy work," Meat replies, though it's clear he's getting tired of this as well.

"Oh fuck," Neil says. You can tell he's not acting.

1. [[Pick up the walkie]]

"Shit. I'm sure you did what you had to. Make your way back to the hall."

You do so. Meat and Salvucci are below you, waiting. Meat looks away from you.

"Are you sure it's dead?"

1.[["It's not getting back up."]]

It's as though no time passes between the moment the darkness falls over you to when you open your eyes again to see ten soldiers standing over you, peering down, each of them equipped with assault rifles.

"Come on, lieutenant," one of them says, lifting you to your feet. You see Meat being held up by two soldiers. He's grinning like a fool.

"We did it," his eyes say.

The troops escort you both to your own personal rooms where you're served cheap steak and soda pop. It tastes superb. Later, you and Meat are interviewed about the incident aboard the Speedwell. Security footage corroborates your testimonies. 

You stay in your room for a week, feeling shackled and hoping that the military doesn't eliminate you because of secrets you shouldn't know. You and Meat are then taken to meet a general and his staff. You tell them your story. The old man nods and thanks you for your bravery.

Another day goes by, and you are released by the staff into the world. The familiar citscape of New Austin is a welcome sight.

"What now?" Meat asks, turning to you.

1. [[Get drinks with Meat.]]
2. [[Go home and get some sleep.]]

incoming: Nudge Markie and give her a wink of gratitude.
text:
"No problem, sweetie," she says.

"What was that?" Ryan asks.

"We're coming up on that big-ass hole," Markie says. "You big bad men got your willy compensators charged?"

"Ha. Ha. Ha," Ryan says.

"Oh you bet, baby," Meat says, showing off the rifle in his hands. "32 round clip, full metal jacket. Enough stopping power to put down a rhinoceros."

"A rhywhat?"

"Didn't you pay attention in school at all? A rhinoceros, man. It's a huge fucking lizard that ruled over all the other dinosaurs."

1. [[Say nothing.]]

3.[["You're talking about a jackalope, Meat, jeez."]]

"Well, if I had to make a guess, I'd say a giant-ass earth worm...you know what an earth worm is, right?"

1.[["Yes, Markie I know what an earthworm is."]]
2.[["Uh...yes, totally."]]

You reach the cryogenics room and flip on the pods. You set three of the pods to prepare for a trip to Mars. Each one slides open. 

You wait. An hour later Meat and Salvucci return. Each covered in sweat. "Found Ben creeping around. Put him down and burned him. Glad the doc wasn't around for that."

"Two months," Salvucci says, staring down into his pod. "It's gonna feel instantaneous."

"Gonna wake up to a bunch of disbelieving suits asking why most of our crew's dead," Meat says, putting his rifle aside. "I for one cannot wait for that."

You get into your pod. You look at your companions.

1.[["Sleep well."]]
2.[["See you on Mars."]]

"She'll be honored when we get back, along with Sergeant Benson."

"And Ben," Strauss says suddenly, sharply.

"Yes," Salvucci answers. "And Ben."

The two of them descend into uncomfortable silence; Strauss looking at her feet, Salvucci at the viewport. You feel awkward standing there, so you wander away.
