1. [[Answer Neil.]]

"There are tunnels."

Ryan turns. "Come again?"

"Tunnels. In the crater. The last reconnaissance team didn't say anything about tunnels in their report."

"How long ago was that?"

"Seven years. Give or take a month."

"Erosion. Boom."

1.[["Shut up, Ryan."]]
2.[["Erosion...right."]]

incoming: "Get your head in the fucking game."
text:
"Yeah," he says, not meeting your eyes. "Okay."

"He gave you a password, right?" Strauss says. "Maybe there's an autopilot sequence on his computer."

"Doesn't do us any good if that thing is still stomping around."

"Do you really think it survived that blast?"

"Is that a serious question?"

"Either way, we need to get the ship moving. Let's get to the cockpit and decide what to do there."

You make your way toward the cockpit. About halfway there, Meat speaks.

"What was it doing when it killed Neil?"

"Evolving," Strauss answers.

"Did you get a good look at it?" Meat asks.

1.[["It wiggled a lot."]]
2.[["I did not. I was too busy running for my life."]]

You walk over to the bar and take a lie down. It feels like it's been years since you've slept, but you're afraid to go to sleep, uncertain of whether you'll relive the horrific deaths of your crewmates in your dreams. Terror is not enough to keep you from closing your eyes, though. You'll need your strength if you're to survive the rest of the voyage.

Sleep comes easier than you expected. There are no dreams. At least, you don't see anything. However, there are sounds. Clapping, to be precise.

The common room abruptly comes into view as Meat shakes you awake. The sound of clapping is engulfing the room. Getting to your feet, you see Strauss has her ears covered. A guitar now. Music playing.

"Tequila!" the ceiling speakers shout. 

You turn to Meat.

1.[["What's going on?"]]

"What kind of question is that? Here and now? You've never made the effort bef—oh, I see. You're just trying to make conversation. Well, fine then: I have nothing waiting for me. How does that sound? Nothing. Not a lover, not a child, not even a pet. This was my life and now it's gone to shit.  Well now I feel good about myself. How about you?  Any boys waiting for you?"

1.	[["No."]]
2.	[["A woman, actually."]]

incoming: "Strauss is taking her freakin' arm off."
text: Meat makes a face. "Fucking Nazi. It's a tiny bite. Can't they just disinfect it? It was bad enough losing somebody; we don't have to maim her."\n\n1.[["It's straight up bullshit."]]

incoming: "We need to draw it out into the open."
text:
"Okay, with what bait?" Neil asks.

You and Meat look at Neil.

"Oh," he says, getting it. "Well fuck that."

1.[["Don't be a pussy."]]

You open your mouth to speak, but you're cut off by a familiar voice. "Well, captain, I guess it's too much to hope for some confidence in my abilities."

Out from a supply closet steps Strauss. Sweat is dripping off her face and there's blood on her lab coat.

"Doctor, are you hurt?"

"No," she says. "It broke through the glass and grabbed me, but Ben pushed it off. I ran and didn't look back. I heard him scream behind me."

Salvucci looks at you nervously.

1.[["Your boyfriend's toast."]]

"Oh yes! I've forgot about hot dogs. Man, I want chili and cheese and--"

You hear a sound.

Meat whips out his rifle and aims it down the line.

"What the fuck was that?"

1. [["Just a rock or something."]]
2. [[Unholster your weapon.]]

incoming: "It's covering any sound it could be making."
text:
"Well, we're about to put an end to that shit," Meat says as you approach the crew's quarters. You see large cables running through the doorway; they lead up the wall and into the ceiling.

Neil reaches up and runs his hand along the cables. He quickly pulls it back. "Augh! Fuck!"

"What is it?" Meat barks.

"Nothing," Neil says, regaining his composure. "Just fucking slime. Oh god, gag a maggot," he says. "This shit reeks." He holds his hand up to the light to reveal a goopy, transparent liquid.

"Hey, that looks a little bit like—"

"Don't you fucking say it, Travis."

You examine the cables without touching them.

Meat takes a look as well. "Seems like a complicated operation."

"What, turning on the computer, starting a program, and plugging in some cables?"

Meat turns. "You didn't see how feral this thing was—not to mention she's missing a goddamn arm."

1.[["It might be Ben."]]

"Believe me, Zoe, I'm all for a long, relaxed, and rational conversation, but we can't afford that luxury. She could expire and change at any moment."

"This is a bad horror movie," Ben moans, staring into the glass while Markie gazes at her own cauterized stump. She's drooling now and has a nosebleed. You can see black veins popping beneath the skin on her forehead. It is like a bad horror movie.

"Enough," Salvucci says at last. "We're not killing anyone on my ship—we're not savages."

Meat is relieved. "Thanks boss."

"This is a mistake," Strauss says.

"Maybe," he says, "but it's my mistake to make, not yours. Do what you can to keep her alive and prep her for cryo sleep."

"Again, a mistake."

"Doctor Strauss, unless you want to be brought before a military tribunal for insubordination, I suggest you do as I say.

"Yes, captain," she says, voice calm, but there's a fire in her eyes. "Ben, lower the temperature to 15 degrees Fahrenheit. We'll try to freeze her."

Markie looks up at you all. A smile breaks out over her face and then she leans over and pukes.

"Disgusting creature," Strauss mutters.

"Travis, Zoe, to the cockpit," Salvucci says.

1.[[Head to the cockpit.]]

"Easy for you to say, Miss I-snuck-my-favorite-snack-onboard."
He's talking about your soy oatmeal cookies.

"I don't blame you though. Wish I had been clever enough to get some chip--"

You hear a sound.

Meat whips out his rifle and aims it down the line.

"What the fuck was that?"

1.[["Probably just a rock falling."]]
2.[[Take out your weapon]]

"You too, princess."

He gets in position. A second later, the door bursts open and flies across the hanger. In steps the monster, mouth stained with blood, eyes looking about wildly.

It takes a step toward you.

"Over here, motherfucker!" Meat shouts through his suit's comm.

It growls and moves toward him. Its footsteps leave imprints in the steel floor.

Meat backs away from the droids until his back is pressed against the wall. He grabs onto a wall-railing.

The monster steps in front of the line of droids.

"Do it, do it now."

You take aim at the switch on the far wall. You fire.
The shot slams into the switch, and the alarms blare. Meat slowly pulls himself along the rail until he's behind the droids.

The hanger door opens and air swooshes out. You grip the railing beside you.

"Hold on!"

The beast begins to backslide toward the hanger door, its feet dragging. It tries to throw a tentacle at Meat, but they're pulled as well. A moment later they snap off and go flying into the black.  Meat, clinging to the railing, kicks the droids. It takes a second for them to detach from their holders and tumble down into the behemoth. The first one knocks it back a couple of feet. The second droid seals the monster's fate, knocking it off both of its feet and sending it careening into the stars.

"Eat shit and die, you fuck!" Meat screams through the comm. You can't help but grin as the monster spins out of sight.

The alarms in the hanger continue to yell for a couple of seconds, and then the emergency seal protocol activates, and the hanger door slowly slides to a close again.

"We did it," Meat says. "We fucking did it."

He walks over to you and hugs you tightly. You both laugh.

"We're alive!"

1.[["Let's get the fuck home, eh?"]]

Strauss says nothing.  You can't help but notice Neil's grin.

"When are they supposed to be back?"

"An hour from when we left," Strauss says.

"How long ago was that?"

"I don't know. I'm not your timekeeper."

"Sheesh. Well, okay, so what should we do to pass the time?"

"Time's going to pass regardless of what we do with it."

"Right. So you're going to sulk over there in the corner. Fine."

He turns to you. "Zoe?"

1.[[Play Rock, Paper, Scissors.]]
2.[[Play Tic-Tac-Toe.]]
3.[[Sulk in silence.]]

"Hey, fuck you. I've been cooped up in that room this whole time. Forgive me for being a little curious about why everything around me is going to hell."

The three of you say nothing for the rest of the walk, but you can't shake the feeling that Neil is angry at you.

When you reach the sickbay, it's deserted.

"I suppose they're still out looking for it—or they're dead."

"Jesus," Neil says, approaching the puddle of gore in the center of the room. He stands there, gazing down at it. 

You lean against the wall and take a seat, but your pistol remains in your hand. 

"Meat and the captain aren't really dead, are they?"

1.[["No, they're tough fuckers."]]
2.[["Yeah, they're chum."]]

He and Meat laugh. You see a smile creep onto Salvucci's face.

"Thanks, Julia" he says. "You're the reason we're alive. You can expect great things when we get back."

Both Meat and Neil help you into your pod. 

"Don't worry, you won't be the only human popsicle. We're just going to make sure the ship's clean before we all go to sleep. Rest easy."

1.[["Yeah, yeah, get on with it."]]
2.[["When I wake up, I expect to have kickass robo-limbs."]]

"Ah, she's funny, Meat! I forgot how funny she was!" he yells. Meat, grinning, shushes him.

"Oh, am I too loud?"

Salvucci soon arrives. Everyone, including you, buys each other rounds until you're all bloated and sick and green.

Outside, you vomit in the street while you wait for a cab.

"I'll...I'll get my car later," Meat says.

Somehow you all manage to tell the cabbie your respective addresses. You stumble out of the cab at your house and tell the others you'll call them later.

"Bionic woman!" Neil shrieks as the cab takes off.

Your house, it turns out, looks the same as it did before you left on your mission. You take two steps into the living room and fall onto the couch. You grip the cushions with your fingers and, face pressed into them, laugh.

You are home. You are alive and you are home. You wake up the next morning, mouth dry and head pounding. You take a shower and then call that doctor.

"Jessica," she tells you. "That's my name."

You ask her out for coffee. You meet her at a coffee shop and both you order terrible tasting drinks. It's clear you both like each other. She invites you back to her place, a nice apartment with windows that face the belly of the Valles Marineris. You make love; it's nice.

Soon you're dating. You agree to an open relationship but, within a month, you're dating exclusively.

The outpost in New Ausin has given you an analyst position. While you resent the military's decision that your disability keeps you from being combat ready, part of you is relieved to be away from danger (the raise is nice, too).

Your life is quiet, peaceful. You still meet up with Salvucci, Neil, and Meat from time to time at the bar. They like Jessica, though Neil is a bit too flirty with you for Jessica's liking.

One night Meat takes you aside. "They're nuking earth."

1.[["They're doing what?"]]

Meat's there when you wake up. You're lying under a sheet on the examination table in sickbay and can't move."

"Goddamn, you're lucky Salvucci was a medic back in the day."

1.[["Where's Markie?"]]

You both take a breath.

"What happens now?"

1.[["We kill it."]]
2.[["I've got at least two rounds left."]]

You both retreat. "Neil," Meat yells over the comm. "Bring the Speedwell to the LZ. We need some fucking help here."

"Coming as fast I can," you hear the pilot say.

You run and run and run. You surge ahead of Markie and lose feeling in your legs, but somehow you keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but you eventually stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way you see Meat running. Ryan is nowhere to be found. You've covered half the distance to Meat when, looking up, you see the Speedwell beginning its descent.

You're almost to him when you hear Markie scream. Turning, you watch her fling one of the crab creatures across the ground.

"Fuck!" she yells.

Meat blasts the creature into pieces. The two of you rush over to her. She's holding her arm.

"It got me," she says; there's fear in her voice. She turns to Meat. "Where's Ryan?"

"Goddamn fucking thing ate him. It ATE him."

Meat's answer fills you with dread. No one that close to you has ever died before. Your vision becomes unfocused. A slap on the arm brings you back.

"We've got company, Zoe. I need you here and now," Meat says, nodding at the mouth of the cave where the crab creatures are gathering. There must be thousands of them. Luckily, behind you, you hear the Speedwell land.

Meat fires several shots at the crabs, but they don't seem to be leaving the cave anyway.

You and Meat help Markie to the ship's elevator. Meat enters a combination on the keypad and the door slides open. Inside the elevator, as you ride up, all three of you remove your helmets. You notice for the first time that your face is drenched in sweat.

A ding. The door opens. Captain Jonas Salvucci, an older, muscular man with little patience of tomfoolery, awaits you, his hand wrapped around the pistol in his holster. He takes his hand away from the gun when he sees there's no threat.

"Get her to sickbay."

You nod and help Markie through the hallway of the ship. Behind you, you can hear Salvucci interrogating Meat.

"What happened to Ryan?"

"He's dead, cap. Something got him."

"Hell, Travis. What did you find down there?"

When you get to sickbay, both Lenore Strauss, the doctor, and her geeky assistant Ben are prepping the examination table.

"Where's she wounded?" Lenore asks, as you help a woozy Markie out of her suit.  You glare at Ben as he gawks at her well-toned body. He smiles sheepishly and looks away, cheeks burning red with shame. Markie's drenched in sweat; she stares around wildly as Lenore straps her in. She examines the bite: it's just above the elbow, an inflamed bulging of the skin.

"And I was young and we were running," Markie rambles, "eyes bouncing up and down the shore  while the sun cooked the corpses of washed up jellyfish."

You turn to Lenore, who's prepping some kind of tool.

1.[["What the hell is she saying?"]]

"While I appreciate your clever literary reference, that is not in fact the password."

Strauss slams the fist of her unwounded arm against the door.

"Listen here, you little shit. You open this door right now or so help me I'll put you to sleep, slather whatever honey we have left in the cafeteria on your testicles, and we'll use you as bait."

The door slides open. Neil's face, boyish as ever, awaits you and Strauss. He is unharmed.

"It eats honey?"

"I don't think I'll ever be able to fathom the depths of your stupidity, pilot."

Neil frowns; he seems genuinely hurt by the remark.

1.[["Let's just go."]]
2.[[" Doctor Strauss is right; stop dicking around, Neil."]]
3.[["Take it easy on him."]]

You and Meat follow the captain to cockpit. Neil, the ship's pilot, sits at the controls. He smiles when the three of you enter--he has a thing for you.

"Hello darling."

"Cut the shit, Neil," the captain barks.

"Yes, captain," he says, deflated.

"Meat take over the co-pilot controls for Markie."
 
Meat nods, takes a seat. Neil looks over at him. "You're a bit pale, big boy. Something happen?"

"Shut the fuck up, Neil. Just do your job."

"Sheesh."

Salvucci turns to you. "Okay, I need you to be straight with me: what are we dealing with? Do you think she's going to turn into whatever killed Ryan?"

"Woah, shit," Neil says, turning in his seat. "Ryan's dead? What happened?"

"Leave it alone," Meat says.

"Julia?" Salvucci says.

1.[["Look, all I know is that whatever we found on Earth wasn't human."]]
2.[["We've got guns;we can handle her if shit goes down."]]

The words aren't out of your mouth when you hear it again: scuttling, and then something else--a high pitched whine that sends a shiver down your spine.

"We're not alone," Meat says, voice low.

"What's that?" you hear Ryan say over your comm.

"There's something in here with us. We're turning back."

He nods at you and you both slowly back away. You pull out your pistol.

"What do you see, Meat?" Markie asks.

"Dunno. Sounds like a wolf. Don't like it whatever it is."
The whine again. You focus your eyes and see something moving in the dark.

Meat sees it, too. He fires at it. As muzzle fire fills the cave with flashes of light you see that the creature isn't one thing: but many things, with feelers and sharp teeth.

They rush toward you, hundreds of them.

"Let's get out of here," Meat yells.

1. [[Blast 'em.]]
2. [[Get out of there.]]

She looks at you coldly. "I answered his question."

The three of you say nothing for the rest of the walk, but you can't shake the feeling that Neil is angry at you.

When you reach the sickbay, it's deserted.

"I suppose those fools are still out looking for it—or they're dead."

"Holy shit," Neil says, approaching the puddle of gore in the center of the room. He stands there, gazing down at it. 

You lean against the wall and take a seat, but your pistol remains in your hand. 

"Meat and the captain aren't really dead, are they?"

1.[["No. Of course not."]]
2.[["Who knows?"]]
3.[["Yeah, they're food."]]

"What the fuck, Julia?"

He turns to Strauss. "When are they supposed to be back?"

"An hour from when we left," Strauss says.

"How long ago was that?"

"I don't know. I'm not your timekeeper."

"Sheesh. Well, okay, so what should we do to pass the time?"

"Time's going to pass regardless of what we do with it."

"Right. So you're going to sulk over there in the corner. Fine."

He turns to you. "Julia?"

1. [[Rock, Paper, Scissors]]
2. [[Tic-Tac-Toe]]
3. [[Also sulk in silence]]

"What's that? Oh, you're making a joke, aren't you? Hardly the time, Zoe." He says, giving you a sharp look of disapproval. He sighs.

"Maybe Strauss will know what it is—if she's still alive."

1.[["Don't talk like that, cap."]]
2.[["She's meat."]]

You walk over to the bar and take a lie down. It feels like it's been years since you've slept, but you're afraid to go to sleep, uncertain of whether you'll relive the horrific deaths of your crewmates in your dreams. Terror is not enough to keep you from closing your eyes, though. You'll need your strength if you're to survive the rest of the voyage.

Sleep comes easier than you expected. There are no dreams. At least, you don't see anything. However, there are sounds. Clapping, to be precise.

The common room abruptly comes into view as Meat shakes you awake. The sound of clapping is engulfing the room. Getting to your feet, you see Strauss has her ears covered. A guitar now. Music playing.

"Tequila!" the ceiling speakers shout. 

You turn to Meat.

1.[["What's with the racket?"]]

"I guess. There's just something about Strauss, though, y' know? She really sets me on edge. I think she enjoys hurting people."

1.[["You're still angry about that time she reset your broken finger, you big baby."]]
2.[["I get that vibe, too."]]

Salvucci pulls out pistol and puts a round through Neil's forehead.

You close your eyes as he points the gun at you. You never open them again.

The End

incoming: "Did it leave any sort of trail?"
text:
"Not a damn trace" Meat says before swallowing a chip. "Not in engineering, the cafeteria, the cryo room. We checked every nook and cranny. My guess is they're in the vents."

"This is some fucked up shit," Neil says.

"Eloquent as always, pilot."

"We should move shop," Meat says after a moment. "This facility has two doors. I don't like that. Captain and I were talking; the common room is more safe and it's closer to the cafeteria. We can make supply runs."

"...while we, what? Wait for the creature to die?" Strauss asks.

"That's the plan. We stay safe, let it starve."

"And what if it can wait longer than us? What if that's part of the thing's plan? Wait till we get sick and hungry enough for it to overpower us? Did you even bother thinking about the logistics of that move, you dunce? Cryosleep is part of the ship's travel. We don't have enough food on board to support us until we reach Mars. We have maybe a month at the most before we run out. Then what?"

"I don't know, okay? I hear a lot of criticism but I don't hear you contributing anything else, doctor."

Strauss scowls. "That's because I'm trying to prevent you from leading us into a disaster."

"Can it, the both of you," Salvucci commands. "Meat's right as far as safety precautions go. The common room will be easier to fortify and protect than this place. We can worry about long term plans once we get set up there. Doc, you and Neil grab whatever supplies you think we might need from in here. Travis, you and Julia make a trip to the cafeteria, bag some grub, meet us in the common room. Be. Careful."

"Yeah, boss. Got it," Meat says. "Come on, Julia."

The two of you leave as Strauss, Neil, and Salvucci retrieve medical supplies.	

"You and the captain should have put a round in her when you found her," Meat says as you walk toward the cafeteria.

1.[["Not funny."]]
2.[["Your bickering is going to get us killed."]]
3.[["It was tempting."]]

"Guess it isn't much use wondering about it, huh?" He turns away from them, though you notice his eyes lingering on Strauss' corpse for a moment.

"God, I just want some sleep."

1.[["Come on. Let's sleep, then."]]

You open your mouth to speak, but you're cut off by a familiar voice. "Well, captain, I guess it's too much to hope for some confidence in my abilities."

Out from a supply closet steps Strauss. Sweat is dripping off her face and there's blood on her lab coat.

"Doctor, are you hurt?"

"No," she says. "It broke through the glass and grabbed me, but Ben pushed it off. I ran and didn't look back. I heard him scream behind me."

Salvucci looks at you nervously.

1.[["Your boyfriend's toast."]]

"What happpened? You can tell me," Salvucci says.

The barrel is cold beneath your chin. The thing screams, cursing your spinlessness.

The pistol erupts, silencing the voice and sending you careening into quiet, peaceful oblivion.

The End

incoming: "I don't know, Meat. I don't want to know."
text:
He sighs. "I want to believe you, but...nevermind. What now?"

"Damn it. Can't do anything about it now but, fuck, they're dead. And they don't have to be."

He runs his hand over his face to calm himself. "What should we do now?"

1.[["We sleep."]]

"That makes one of us, at least. Level with me though. You think we got a chance against this thing? Whatever it is."

Neil leans in as well, clearly interested in your response.

1.[["Of course. We just need to flush it out and kill it...somehow."]]
2.[["No idea."]]
3.[["We're screwed, fellas."]]

incoming: "We've got guns;we can handle her if shit goes down."
text:
Salvucci furrows his brow. "Not a comforting answer."

"What killed Ryan?" Neil continues.

"Stop talking, Neil," Salvucci says with a raised voice before turning back to you. "Maybe Strauss was right."

"Captain, I have to insist. Ryan is a childhood buddy. I know his family. Somebody tell me what's going on."

"Ryan got killed by some fucking thing," Meat says. "Almost got us too. Up to speed, dipshit? Let the adults talk now."

Neil sinks back into his chair. "He's dead," he says in disbelief.

1. [[Give him a comfort pat and offer your condolences.]]
2. [[Refrain from doing anything.]]

"Everyone keep your wits about you, and let's meet back here in an hour. You guys see if you can shut down that racket."

The captain bends down and grabs something from the floor and tosses it in your direction. You barely catch the object: it's a walke-talkie. 

"If you run into it, let us know."

When all of you get to where the hallways branch off, your group goes to the left. You take one last look at Strauss and Salvucci before they disappear around the bend. The walkie-talkie feels heavy hanging from your belt clip. 

"Scarborough Fair" plays loudly as the three of you carefully walk down the hallway. Meat has his assault rifle out, pointed dead ahead. Every now and then he'll look to each side, though the hallway is really too narrow for anything else to fit alongside the rest of you.

Parsley, Sage, Rosemary and Thyme
Remember me to the one who lives there...

"You've got a weird taste in music, Neil."

"Don't knock Lani Hall, dude."

"Why do you think it's fucking with the music anyway?"

1.[["It's trying to scare us."]]
2.[["It's covering its own noises."]]

You unload your clip into the window. On the fourth shot you hear a sucking sound. 

Bingo.

The doctor leaps back behind the door. You smash the button and the emergency door comes down between you and the beast. It wastes no time in striking at the door with its tentacles. You watch through the glass in the door as the viewport's glass cracks, shatters, and is sucked into space. The beast, though it tries to cling to the inside of the ship with its appendages, is sucked out shortly after.

"We did it," Strauss says, relieved. The alarms blare for a few minutes until the emergency panel comes down and covers where the viewport was.

The door in front of you lifts, giving you access to the rest of the ship again.

"I guess we should burn the other bodies. Just to be sure. I'll go to the lab and make some molotovs. You go get our cryopods ready."

1. [[Initiate you and Strauss' cryopods.]]

"He might come back, y'know?" Meat says. "Like a zombie."

"Stop talking," Salvucci says. "We need to find Strauss."

"If she isn't dead," Meat says grimly, eyes set on what's left of Ben's face.

1.[["Ben said she was chased into the hallway."]]

"What makes you so sure?" Strauss sneers.

1.[["Watch your tone, Strauss. Getting real tired of your shit."]]
2.[["Because I know what I'm talking about."]]
3.[["Step off, cunt."]]

He sighs. "Figured as much."

The PA clicks on: "All officers report to sickbay," Salvucci says.

Meat gobbles up the rest of his bowl and grabs the rifle leaning upright against the table. You realize that you're out of ammo, so you take one of the clips from your belt and reload the pistol.

You and Meat exchange no words on the way to sickbay. The door is open when you get there. Salvucci, Lenore, and Ben are standing around a bloody examination bed. You look to the right: Markie, one arm missing, is sequestered in a see-through quarantine cube. She's looking around wildly.

You smell gunsmoke. Ben has both of his hands wrapped around his pistol.

1.[["What happened?"]]

"Complete gibbersh, sounds like," Lenore says with cold detachment. "Move." 

She scoots past you and turns on the device in her hand. A hot laser point darts out about three inches from the top port of the device. Another line escapes the bottom port and swings upward to connect to the top beam.

"Cauterizing saw," she explains. "You might want to leave this to the professionals, girlie. It's going to get a little messy."

1.[["Are you really going to take her arm off?"]]
2.[["What the fuck is wrong with you?"]]
3. [[Say nothing; leave.]]

"That's a joke, right? You're joking."

Meat slaps Neil on the shoulder. "We won't let you get eaten. Now stop being a pussy. You're the tiniest one—the easiest prey, see?"

"You're not making this any more appealing."

"We can't make him do this," Strauss interjects, finally saying something.

"When the fuck did you grow a conscience? "Meat growls.

"I did what I did for the sake of survival. There were no other options. There are other options here. We just need to think rationally."

"Well," Meat says. "I'm waiting, doctor."

"No," Neil says. "I'll do it."

You turn to Neil.

1.[["You're certain?"]]
2.[["Damn right you will."]]

Both groups go in a separate directions; you hike down the cliff with Ryan. It takes the larger portion of an hour to reach your tunnel. You step inside.

"Flashlights," Ryan says. You tell the computer to turn on the light attachment in your suit. It flickers for a moment before shooting a cone of light from your chest compartment.

"Let's do this," he says, pulling out his pistol. You do the same.

The two of you proceed through the cave. On the Head Up Display (HUD) of your helmet you can see the heartbeat monitors of everyone in your squad. Yours is going a little faster than normal and, knowing that everyone else can see that, you feel a little embarrassed.

"Ten bucks we find caveman drawings."

1.[["Sure, Ryan."]]

incoming: "Save a round for yourself...just in case."
text:
"Way to be an optimist, Zoe," Meat says, clearly disapproving.

"No, it's okay," she says, nodding. "It's good advice." She walks out the door and starts running, screaming her head off.

"Five minutes,"  Salvucci says. "That's all we give her."

Meat nods. Her footsteps (and screams) trail away.

After three minutes Salvucci says "She's had enough time. Let's go."

The three of you run down the hall to sickbay. She's inside, screwing a hose onto a black machine of some sort. She looks up. "I told you to give me mor--"

She's interrupted by Markie's descent from the ventilation shaft onto the examination table. She growls at all of you. A giant purple claw has sprouted out of her missing arm. The other arm is rotting, like the rest of her body.

"Prettyprettyprettypretty."

Out of the corner of your eye, you see the cauterizing saw on the table next to the bed. 

1.[[Attack with the saw.]]
2.[[Attack with your gun.]]

"She'll be honored when we get back, along with Sergeant Benson."

"And Ben," Strauss says suddenly, sharply.

"Yes," Salvucci answers. "And Ben."

The two of them descend into uncomfortable silence; Strauss looking at her feet, Salvucci at the viewport. You feel awkward standing there, so you wander away.

1. [[Go to sleep.]]

You take Meat's pistol and proceed down the hall until you reach the cockpit. The door is unlocked. You step through.

Both Neil and Salvucci are there peering over the main console. They turn when they hear you enter.

"Julia?" Neil says, his eyes staring at the blood on your uniform.

1. [[Kill them both.]]
2. [[Take a bullet to the brain.]]

"Quite right. Let's go," Strauss says, turning to leave.

"What a bitch," Neil mutters.

"If you have something to say to me, you should say it aloud, pilot."

"Um...I said ‘What's going on?' Can somebody bring me up to speed?"

1.[["Ben's dead too."]]

"Yeah, he might stick his head out after all that noise. Damn it, why don't we have walkies?"

"We'll get them after we get Neil," Salvucci says.

The three of you leave behind the bodies of your comrades and make your way to the cockpit.

You breathe a sigh of relief when you see the door's still shut. Meat knocks on the door.

From within: "Password?"

"Come on, Neil. Knock that shit off."

Again, louder: "Password?"

Meat sighs. "Ocelot."

The door slides open, and Neil's boyish face is there to greet you. "Heard gunshots. You guys killin' things out here?"

Salvucci cuts to the chase. "Doctor Strauss, Ben, and Markie are dead. Whatever killed them is still on the ship, dressed in Markie's skin."

Neil looks at you all from left to right. "You guys are fucking with me, right?"

"Does it look like we're yanking your chain, Neil?" Meat growls, pointing to his gore-covered boot.

He gulps. "No, I guess not. So what happens now?"

"We fucking kill it," Meat says.

"Well, yeah, but how?"

1.[["We search the vents."]]
2. [["We lure it out into the open."]]

It's as though no time passes between the moment the darkness falls over you to when you open your eyes again and see ten soldiers standing over you, peering down, each of them equipped with assault rifles.

"Come on, lieutenant," one of them says, lifting you to your feet. You see Meat being held up by two soldiers. He's grinning like a fool.

"We did it," his eyes say.

The troops escort you both to your own personal rooms where you're served cheap steak and soda pop. It all tastes superb.

Later, you and Meat are interviewed about the incident aboard the Speedwell. Security footage corroborates your testimonies. 

You stay in your room for a week, feeling shackled and hoping that the military doesn't eliminate you because of secrets you shouldn't know. You and Meat are then taken to meet a general and his staff. You tell them your story. The old man nods and thanks you for your bravery.

Another day goes by and then, finally, you are released by the staff into the world. The familiar cityscape of New Austin is a welcome sight.

"What now?" Meat asks, turning to you.

1.[["Get a drink."]]
2.[[Go home.]]

The groups go their separate ways; you hike down the cliff with Markie. It takes the larger portion of an hour to reach your tunnel. You step inside.

"Let's turn our lights on," Markie says quietly.

You both tell your suits to turn on your light attachments. Yours flickers for a moment before shooting a cone of light from your chest compartment.

On the Head Up Display (HUD) of your helmet, you can see the heartbeat monitors of everyone in your squad. Yours is going a little faster than normal and, knowing that everyone else can see that, you feel a little embarrassed.

You proceed through the cave.

"These caverns are massive. This one seems to just go on and on."

1.[["What made them?"]]

incoming: "Don't strain yourself; I don't want to be scooping you off the ground while I'm trying to shoot something."
text:
"Don't worry about me, Zoe. I can take care of myself," she snaps.

The two of you proceed down the main hallway. The silence is heavy, and Strauss seems to be deep in her own thoughts.

1.[["What's waiting for you back on Mars?"]]
2.[["What's up with you and Meat?"]]

incoming: "Shhh. I got it, Neil. Just rest."
text:
"Good. Give me your gun and turn the gas on before you leave."

"There's no way out except through the front."

"Vent," he says, pointing at a vent near one of the stoves. "...Gotta crawl fast. I'll give you as much time as I can."

A clanging at the door. Whatever was inside Markie, was now trying to get in the kitchen.

"This ain't fucking right, man. It's not right at all."

"Just give me your damn gun, dude." He coughs. Meat, with reluctance, takes the pistol from his holster and sticks it in Neil's hand. He then goes from stove to stove, turning on the gas.

Another bang at the door. The tip of a tentacle pierces the door and writhes wildly about, slapping a nearby wall.

"Go," Neil says, fighting to stay conscious.

1.[["God damn it. I'm so sorry, Neil."]]
2. [[Say nothing to him.]]

"I hear that!"

The two of you travel by cab to the nearest bar and order your weight in whiskey shots. You laugh as you reminisce about good times with the crew, then you cry as you mourn the tragedy of their deaths. And then comes the silence where you both sit, staring at the table, saying nothing, just drinking as you come to grips with the fact that you're both alive.

"I should get home," Meat says. "Rhonda's waiting. Give me a call if you need anything, okay?"

1.[["You do as well."]]

incoming: "Where on the ship did you look?"

The two of you leave as Strauss, Neil, and Salvucci retrieve medical supplies.	

"You and the captain should have put a round in her when you found her," Meat says as you walk toward the cafeteria.

1.[["We can't turn on each other, man."]]
2.[["You and her are gonna get us all killed if you keep bickering."]]
3.[["Tempting. It was very, very tempting."]]

"Even better," Meat says grimly.

"Let's just shut down the computer," Neil says.

"It's your computer. After you, your majesty."

"Oh no, you've got the gun. You go first. Please, I insist."

Meat grumbles as he steps past Neil and peers into the room. You see him flip on the light attached to the rifle.

"See anything?"

"No, but it's dark. There's shattered glass on the floor—probably the lights." He creeps into the room slowly. 

You and Neil follow.

Remember me to the one who lives there...
 
The room is pitch black except for the light coming from the computer terminal next to Neil's bed. The computer, a custom built powerhouse, sits on the floor and is connected to an obnoxiously large, wall-mounted flat screen. On the screen, you see a music library. Meat flashes his light across the floor. There's at least 11 or 12 footsteps separating you and the terminal, a no-man's land of shattered glass and possible traps.

"Well," Neil says after a moment. "I guess one of us should cross—"

Gunfire cuts Neil's sentence off as Meat fires three rounds into the terminal. The music dies abruptly.

"Are you fucking kidding me?!"  Neil erupts. "That was two months worth of pay! It was like, the ultimate fucking entertainment system, dude."

You can't make out Meat's expression in the dark but you can tell he's not in the mood to deal with Neil's shit. "Listen, if we get out of this alive, I'll buy you a new toy, okay?"

"It was brand new!"

"Shut up. Did you hear that?"

You listen. You hear nothing, not the crackling of glass, or an insidious snicker. Nada.

"Let's go," says Meat. You all turn, and, of course, there she is, standing next to the door.

Neil gasps in horror. Markie smiles at all of you, the hallway light shining on her face to reveal rotting flesh and a dangling eyeball. Her arm stump oozes yellow.

Meat raises his rifle, but he's too slow. She slams the door.
You're locked in here with her.

1. [[Fire your pistol blindly.]]
2. [[Run. Like. Hell.]]

"Right. Sorry. Dumb question," he says sheepishly. "Kind of awkward to put you in that position anyway. I was just—"

A blur of blue darts across your light. You raise your pistol.

Ryan looks over his back and then turns to you.

"What is it?"

1.[["Something over there."]]
2.[["Get out of the way!"]]
3.[["MOVE MORON!"]]
"With what? Pistol rounds ain't gonna put that motherfucker down, J."\n\n1.[["The hanger. We'll use the hanger."]]

"Right, well, can one of you humorless assholes bring me up to speed at least?"

1.[["Ben's dead too."]]

"With what? Pistol rounds ain't gonna put that motherfucker down, J."

1.[["We'll kill it without bullets.]]

incoming: "Yes. I know what a goddamn earthworm is."
text:
"All right! Just checking. Creatures of the homeworld aren't exactly common knowled...did you hear something?"

You did.

Markie slowly pulls out her pistol. "Just in case."

Suddenly you hear a a high-pitched whine from the darkness that sends a shiver down your spine. "Guys, we're not alone," Markie says into her comm.

"What's that?" you hear Ryan say over your comm.

"There's something in here with us."

She nods at you and you both slowly back away. You pull out your weapon.

"What is it?" Meat asks.

"No idea. Whatever it is, we're in its territory. I'm inclined to think we should leave it alone. Let's head back to the ship."

The whine again. You focus your eyes and see something moving in the dark.

Markie sees it as well."There's too many of them. Fall back!"

She fires a single shot. The flash of light reveals that the creature isn't one thing, but many things, with feelers and sharp teeth.

They rush toward you, hundreds of them.

1. [[Blast the little bastards.]]
2. [[Run. Now.]]

incoming: "Because I know what I'm talking about."
text:
"Then that makes you an even bigger idiot than I thought you already were."

"When are they supposed to be back?" Neil asks before you can reply to Strauss.

"An hour from when we left," Strauss says.

"How long ago was that?"

"I don't know. I'm a doctor, not a timekeeper."

"Sheesh. Well, okay, so what should we do to pass the time?"

"Time's going to pass regardless of what we do with it."

"Right. So you're going to sulk over there in the corner. Fine."
He turns to you. Zoe?"

1.[[Play Rock, Paper, Scissors.]]
2.[[Play Tic-Tac-Toe.]]
3.[[Sulk in silence.]]

incoming: "Ben said Markie chased her into the hallway. She's probably dead."
text:
"What a loss," Meat mutters.

"Cut that shit out," Salvucci snaps. "We need to find 
her. Travis, you go check on Neil. Julia and I are going to look for her."

"What should we do about them?" he asks, nodding in the direction of Markie and Ben's bodies. "They might, y'know, come back."

"Knock that horror movie shit off, Travis."

"Captain, with all due respect, I think we're pretty well entrenched in horror movie territory right about now, oh with the crazy alien woman and dead crew members. Is it too much to humor me when I ask for a little reassurance?"

Salvucci frowns. "What are you suggesting?"

Meat looks down at the corpses. "I need oil. We can use the lab's emergency coolant system to control the blaze."

Salvucci nods solemnly. "Run to engineering. Grab what you need. Burn the bodies."

1.[["You can't be serious."]]
2.[["Captain..."]]
3. [[Let ‘em burn.]]

"I tell you; I don't even think she qualifies as a human."

The intercom clicks on before you can say anything. "All officers report to sickbay," Salvucci says.

Meat gobbles up the rest of his bowl and grabs the rifle leaning upright against the table. You realize that you're out of ammo, so you take one of the clips from your belt and reload the pistol.

You and Meat exchange no words on the way to sickbay. The door is open when you get there. Salvucci, Lenore, and Ben are standing around a bloody examination bed. You look to the right: Markie, one arm missing, is sequestered in a see-through quarantine cube.  She's looking around wildly.

You smell gunsmoke. Ben has both of his hands wrapped around his pistol.

1.[["What happened?"]]

He nods. "Yeah. I mean, it's probably running around the ship, growing stronger by the minute, y' know?"

No one answers him. 

He takes a breath. "Okay, well, how are we going to do this?"
"We'll go to the cafeteria—big, open space."

You all make your way to the cafeteria, eyes watching the walls and vents. The journey is a safe one. 

All of you step into the cafeteria.

Neil looks out across the tables like a man looking at his own grave.

"I always thought lunchrooms were kind of scary when I was a kids, ‘cause of the bullies and all. Never thought I'd die in one, though."

"You'll be fine," Meat says. "We'll be in the other room. You're gonna stay in here and use your walkie."

"To do what?"

"Beg for help," Strauss says. "Cry. Be bait."

"How's it gonna hear that?"

"Marki—what used to be Markie has a walkie clipped to her belt."

"And if she thinks it's a trap?"

"Then we come up with another plan. It's animalistic though. I doubt it'll pass up a wounded animal."

"Gee thanks."

You, Meat, and Strauss step into the kitchen and move away from the door. He turns to you. "Make sure you have your gun ready, okay? I don't want Neil to get eaten because we ran dry."

You check your pistol to make sure it has a full clip and nod. You all sit silently and listen to Neil in the other room. "Please help me," you hear him beg. "I can't find you guys."

This goes on for 20 whole minutes, Neil's acting growing steadily worse. "I fucking hurt my leg," he whimpers.

"A thespian, he is not," Strauss says.

"Just let the boy work," Meat replies, though it's clear he's getting tired of this as well.

"Oh fuck," Neil says. You can tell he's not acting.

1.	[[Pick up the walkie]]

He nods.

"Space. You want to jettison the fucker. That's insane. Not like we have a better option though, and he's slow, so maybe we won't die. Maybe." He sighs. "Well, if we're gonna do this, let's do it."

You both retreat to the hanger.

"Shit," he says as the door slides shut behind you. "I thought this thing was bigger."

He's right: it's not much, and half the room is cramped by the reconnaissance droids.

"Loosen the holding clamps on those. I'll get our suits. Hurry, it can't be far behind us."

You deactivate the locks on the droids and catch the suit that Meat throws you. You're just about to put the helmet on when you hear the clanging at the door.

"Damn. It's here. When it gets in front of the droids, shoot the hanger switch, okay? And for fuck's sake, hold on to something."

1.[["Don't get yourself killed, asshole."]]

"Everyone keep your wits about you, and let's meet back here in an hour. You guys see if you can shut down that racket."

He bends down and grabs something for the floor and tosses it in your direction. You barely catch the object: it's a walke-talkie. 

"If you run into it, let us know."

Everyone heads out the door. When all of you get to where the hallways branch off, your group goes to the left. You take one last look at Strauss and Salvucci before they disappear around the bend. The walkie-talkie feels heavy hanging from your belt clip. 

"Scarborough Fair" plays loudly as the three of you carefully walk down the hallway. Meat has his assault rifle out, pointed dead ahead. Every now and then, he'll look to each side, though the hallway is really too narrow for anything else to fit beside any of you.

Parsley, Sage, Rosemary and Thyme
Remember me to the one who lives there...

"You've got a weird fucking taste in music, Neil."

"Don't knock Lani Hall, dude."

"Why do you think it's fucking with the music anyway?"

1.[["Probably to put us on edge."]]
2.[["It's covering any sound it could be making."]]

You're on your feet when you see Markie twisting the knife in Ben's skull; the boy convulses.

You dart across the room and tackle her. She topples over the upturned table. You're ready to charge again but Salvucci beats you to it. He places his pistol against Markie's temple. He fires. Brain, skull bits, and strands of hair blast across the light and onto the floor. The thing that was Markie convulses, blood spewing out of her nose and mouth as she giggles.

The red eyes roll around in her head like in a slot machine before settling on you.

"Buy two hypostims, get three free. Just come on down to the Couponia at Rylock's junction this Saturday—"

Salvucci puts another bullet in its face. Markie jerks, and then stops moving completely.

Meat examines Ben's corpse. "He's dead." The boy's face is a sea of blood and torn flesh. Half his eyeball has been pushed up through the socket.

A moment passes. Meat raises his gun and puts a round through Ben's head. You leap back in surprise.

1.[["What the shit, Travis?"]]

"Oh no no no no," Strauss says. She sticks her fingers in her mouth.

"What the hell are you doing, doctor?"

She retches and pulls her fingers out. "What does it look like? We could be infected. Shit, we shouldn't even fucking be here right now. Get out!"

She gets up and makes a dash for the door. The rest of you follow her into the hallway. "Showers," she yells.  She leads you to the shower stalls.

"Shouldn't we be using the one in your lab?" Meat asks, taking his shirt off.

"Not enough fucking time," she says, ripping off her shirt and bra, not bothering to cover her breasts. "Hurry!" She rushes into one of the stalls.

You disrobe and disappear into a stall of your own. Hot water washes over you, cleansing you of the gunk on your body.

"Wash your hair! Make sure every bit of you is clean!" Strauss screams.

You shampoo and rinse your hair. You spend half an hour scrubbing yourself. When you step out, Meat thrusts a towel in your hands--his eyes closed--so you can cover yourself. You wrap yourself up and go to your locker to fetch your spare uniform. A couple of minutes later, you're dressed. You step back into the shower room to see Meat putting on his boots. Salvucci, Strauss, and Neil are there as well, wearing their uniforms.

1.[["Everyone okay?"]]
2. [[Wait for someone to say something.]]

"That's a joke, right? You're joking."

Meat slaps Neil on the shoulder. "We won't let you get eaten. You gotta do this. You're the tiniest one—the easiest prey, see?"

"You're not making this any more appealing."

"We can't make him do this," Strauss interjects, finally saying something.

"When the fuck did you grow a conscience? "Meat growls.

"I did what I did for the sake of survival. There were no other options. There are other options here. We just need to think rationally."

"Well," Meat says. "I'm waiting, Doctor."

"No," Neil says. "I'll do it."

You turn to Neil.

1.[["You sure?"]]
2.[["Atta boy."]]

incoming: "I've got a bad feeling about this."
text:
"Everything will be fine," Markie says. The groups go their separate ways; you hike down the cliff with Ryan. It takes the larger portion of an hour to reach your tunnel. You step inside.

"Flashlights," Ryan says.

You tell the computer to turn on the light attachment in your suit. It flickers for a moment before shooting a cone of light from your chest compartment.

"Let's do this," he says, pulling out his pistol.

The two of you proceed through the cave. On the Head-Up Display (HUD) of your suit, you can see the heartbeat monitors of everyone in your squad. You see that yours is going a little faster than normal and, knowing that everyone else can see that, you feel a little embarrassed.

"Ten bucks we find caveman drawings."

1.[["Deal."]]

incoming: "Maybe, maybe not. Either way, we don't have much to work with and we're running out of time."
text:
"All right, let's get down to the hanger. Just...do me a favor. If we're about to get sucked into space, just fucking shoot me, okay?"

1.[["More than happy to oblige."]]
2.[["How about we plan on not dying?"]]

incoming: "You're talking about a jackalope, Meat, jeez."
text:
"Huh, no shit?"

The four of you trek on in silence until you reach the crater. You approach the edge and look down into the abyss. The area of impact stretches for miles.

"I don't even see a fucking twig, man," Meat says.

"It's been over a hundred years since the impact. I think all you're going find is dirt down there," Markie replies.

"Don't forget the radiation," Ryan says, kicking a pebble over the edge.

"That too."

Markie peers down. "Zoom," she says. You hear the computer inside her helmet respond in affirmation to the command.

"You gonna get that girl of yours a rock from the surface?" Ryan teases Meat. "I hear people used to go crazy over moon rocks after the Apollo landings. Might make a punny engagement ring, y'know? Girls go for that sort of thing."

Meat grunts. "Not my woman. She's endowed, but it ain't with brains. The humor would, uh, escape her."

"And the radiation," Markie points out, again.

"Stupid radiation. Ruining everything," Ryan says.

Hmm. That's interesting," Markie says—it's almost a whisper.

1.[["What is it?"]]

"I was worried you'd say something like that." Meat sighs. "Yeah, I guess I should focus some of my mental energy on figuring out how to kill it instead of wasting it on fucking checkers, huh?"

"Make your move already, dude," says Neil, growing impatient.

"Fine. Zoe, we can talk strategy in a bit."

You walk away.

1.[[Talk to Strauss and Salvucci.]]
2.[[Take a nap.]]

You both take a breath.

"What happens now?"

1.[["Kill or be killed."]]
2.[["I've got at least two bullets left."]]

The four of you proceed carefully through the hallways of the ship.

"Hey, should we be worried about Neil?" Meat says as you near the mess hall.

"He has a steel door protecting him. As long as he doesn't leave the cockpit he'll be fine," the captain says.

"Yeah, but does he know not to leave?" Strauss asks.

"He never leaves the cockpit."

"Do you really want to risk his life on that confidence?"

"Since when did you start to care so much about people who wer--"

"Don't finish that sentence, Travis," the captain barks.

1. [[Send somebody to check on Neil.]]
2. [[Keep on going toward the mess hall.]]

The lights are off in sickbay. As you step inside a rotten smell hits you in the face. It takes all your strength not to lean over and barf.

"What the hell is that?" Meat says.

"Doctor Strauss? Ben?" Salvucci calls.

The three of you inch forward. Meat turns on the flashlight attached to his rifle. There's a giant blood smear on the wall.

He gently moves the rifle around, illuminating different areas in the room.

"What do you think happened?" Meat asks.

Before you can answer, you step on something. Something squishy. Meat casts his light on it.

1. [[Peer down.]]
Without another word, you step into the hallway. You realize, now that you're away from the antiseptic stench of sickbay, you're hungry.\n\n1. [[Go eat.]]

The homeworld is nothing like you thought it would be. The landscape is black as tar and the temperature readings make you thankful for the air conditioning in your suit.

The crater, the reason for your journey, is dead ahead, a half mile in the distance. You don't mind the trek; this is a far cry from the 35 million miles you and your crew had to traverse for two months.

What a long way you've come, you muse. But what is an ending but the beginning of another journey, wrote...who wrote that? You wrack your brain for an answer. The answer is just outside the limits of your consciousness, floating. You reach for it, grasp its tail, and then—

Sergeant Ryan Benson turns around to look at you.

1.[["Julia," he says.]]
2.[["Zoe," he says.]]

incoming: "I would have made the same choice."
text:
"What do you think it is you found on Earth?" Salvucci says, changing the subject. Your reassurance seems to have made him more focused.

1.[["Yog-Sothoth?"]]
2.[["Not a damn clue."]]

"I guess so. Come on. Let's go...let's go see Neil. Just to be sure."

In the kitchen, you find the charred corpse of Neil. Meat stands over him and retrieves the broken pistol fragments from his hand.

"You think we could have saved him—saved all of them? If we had made difference choices?"

1.[["We're alive."]]
2.[["Yeah."]]
3.[["I don't think so, Meat."]]
Without another word you step into the hallway. You realize, now that you're away from the antiseptic stench of sickbay, that you're hungry.\n\n1. [[Go eat something.]]

incoming: "We're going to be that way too if we don't get our head in the game, Neil."
text:
"Fuck. Guys, I have to tell his parents."

"Worry about that later," says Salvucci. "Right now we need to—"

The alarm wails through the halls. Salvucci turns to Meat. What's left of the color in Meat's face drains as he gazes at the control panel.

"Contamination in sickbay. Quarantine square's been broken."

"What's going on?" Neil says.

Salvucci is quick. "Neil, you stay here. We'll lock you in so you're protected. You two come with me. Arm yourselves."

Meat grabs his rifle, and the three of you are out of the cockpit. Right before the metallic door slides shut, you hear Neil say "protected from what?"

1. [[Head to sickbay.]]

You head to the cryogenic room and prepare the four pods. Strauss is the first to make it in. She's pale.

"Are they almost ready? Good. I am so ready to be asleep."

1.[["What are you going to do when we get back?"]]

"Ugh. You too?" Meat groans.

"We're going to regret this," Strauss says.

Salvucci shakes his head. "We'll be fine. Strength in numbers. As long as we stick together, we won't lose anymore people."

The four of you decide to stick it out in the mess hall. Meat, you, and Salvucci take turns keeping an eye on the door for Markie. Strauss rations the food that comes out of the pantry...including your soy cookies. You try not to hold it against her.

A week passes. No sign of the creature yet.

"Nice beard you've got going on there, Neil," Meat tells the pilot, who's been cultivating uneven patches of facial hair.

"Bite me, big man."

You're in the middle of biting into the last half of your final soy cookie when you hear the sound in the vent--something squishy.

"You heard it too?" Meat says, standing up and pointing his rifle at the vent.

Something starts to hammer at the vent cover.

"It's her!" Salvucci yells. "Fire!"

The three of you unload your clips into the vent. The destroyed cover falls to the floor. And then something else: A giant, bulbous, leaky sack that explodes when it hits the ground. Blood and pus fly everywhere. 

You black out.

When you come to, Meat's helping you up. He, like you and everyone else, is covered in gore.

"Everyone alright?" Salvucci asks.

"Yeah, ugh this is so nast--" Meat is interrupted by Strauss leaning over and vomiting on the floor.

"Couldn't have said it better myself, doc. What was that? A bomb?"

"It's...oh god," Strauss spits. "It's what left of her."  She points at something on the ground.

1. [[Look where she's pointing.]]

incoming: "Screaming isn't going to get us anywhere, Neil."
text:
"You're right. Let's, uh, let's go to the cockpit. Set a course for Mars."

You follow Neil to the cockpit. Halfway there he stumbles and nearly falls. "I'm okay!" he says. "I'm okay."

In the cockpit, Neil nearly trips when he gets to the console, curses; he turns to you and his face pales.

"You're bleeding...from your eyes."

You feel the wetness on your cheek. You put a finger to the wetness and come away with a red smattering. You look at Neil and see that he's bleeding from his nose. After a second, he notices too.

"I guess we're both infected now. Shit."

1. [["Fuck. Guess the old man was right."]]

You shoot her in the face. Her corpse falls back onto the floor and is still.

Moments later both Neil and Salvucci burst through the door. Salvucci's gun is in his hand. They see the body.

Neil speaks first: "What happened?"

1.[["She was infected; she killed Meat."]]
2. [[Shoot the both of them.]]

Meat turns away without a word. He leaves through the other sickbay door.

You step outside to find Salvucci unholstering his pistol.
"Better to be safe than sorry. Do you have your pistol?"

You nod.

"Good. Hopefully we won't need them."

The two of you walk down the hallway. Salvucci appears to be deep in thought, distracted from his surroundings.

1.[["It's not your fault, y' know."]]
2.[["You okay, cap?"]]

incoming: "So, doc, what are you going to do when we get back?"
text:
She smiles sadly. "I don't even care at this point. Maybe retire? I have enough money.I don't know. Just no more space for me."

"I hear that," Meat says as he and Salvucci enter the room. "No more fucking space EVER."

"Command is going to decide that, I'm afraid," Salvucci says, stepping in front of his pod.

"If command thinks they're getting my ass back on a boat like this, they can go fuck themselves. Violently."

"I'll pass along the message when we get back." He turns to Strauss. "Are you okay, doctor?"

"Yes, I'll be fine. Just ready for this to all be over."

"Well, let's get on our way then."

You get in your pod and lay down. "Sweet dreams everyone," you hear Meat say right before your chamber shuts itself. 

Soon it's dark. You close your eyes. The world gets even darker.

When you awaken, you find yourself being assisted by a corporal. He takes you by the arm and guides you up from the pod.

From there, you, the captain, Meat, and Strauss are transported to the military outpost in New Austin. You are all given private rooms and access to nearly anything you could want. You order a steak on the first night and it's delicious.

Men in suits come and interview you about your experiences on the Speedwell. You answer their questions in as much detail as you can. They thank you for your time and promise you will be released soon.

"Soon" turns out to be three days later. You, Meat, Salvucci, and Strauss meet on the base and request a transport to the nearest bar. There, you all drink in merriment, celebrating your survival, though you allow yourselves to mournfully drink a round and say small eulogies for the dead: Ben, Markie, Neil, Ryan.

When you're all finished, you share a cab that drops you off at your respective addresses. You're the first. Your comrades tell you to call them soon just to check in. Inside your small house in the suburbs, you finally allow yourself a good cry. Not for the dead. Not for any reason at all, in particular, except that it's been inside you for so long, struggling to get out.

A week passes. You're relocated to an analyst position on the military base. You hear that Strauss is working at a research facility in New Memphis. You never talk to her, really, but Salvucci and Meat send you emails all the time. Both of them have been reassigned to on-base positions; Meat's an instructor, and Salvucci can't tell you what he does. You imagine it has something to do with what you found on earth.

Years pass. You never marry or have children, but you're never alone. Boys come and go, at a rate of about one every five years. You become attached to them all and break down in sobs when each one leaves. You never tell any of your lovers about your experience aboard the Speedwell.

You and Meat become close. You meet twice a week for lunch. On Wednesdays, you watch sitcoms; on Fridays, there's salsa night downtown. You get a dog. This is your existence and it proceeds one day after another.

You grow old; it's inevitable. Salvucci dies first. You and Meat attend his funeral. You both take bets on who's next; turns out it's you.

You pass away one night in your sleep, your dog curled up behind you with his snout against your back, the hound peacefully unaware of your endless slumber.

The End

incoming: Save yourself; leave him to die.
text:
It's a hard choice, but in the end, you get to your feet and sprint past the monster as it slaughters Meat. You can hear his screams as you run down the hall. Soon things are mercifully silent. 

You climb up into the ventilation and decide to make your base of operations there. You're a survivor, you tell yourself. All you have to do is stay alive two months. That's all.

You go, day by day, into the ship in search of supplies. You often go to the mess hall to stock up on food and bring it back to the vents. You run into creature twice. Each time it's grown bigger, nastier. The first time, you get away without a scratch.

The second time, a tentacle pierces your ankle. You still manage to hop away, but you can't climb into the vent because of your injury. You seek refuge in the darkness of the barracks. Soon every breath brings pain. You refuse to accept the hand you've been dealt, even when Strauss, a bullet hole in her forehead, sits down beside you to have a chat.

"You had a good run, idiot," she says. 

1.[["You aren't real."]]

Markie slaps your arm. "Don't be such a pussy, Zoe."

She turns to the others."Ryan, let Captain Salvucci know what we've found. Let's try and get a pick-up at the LZ in two hours."

"Aye."

"That thing loaded, Meat?"

"Duh."

"Okay, I'm thinking we should split up to cover more ground. How should do this?"

1. [[Pair off with Ryan.]]
2. [[Pair off with Markie.]]
3. [[Pair off with Meat.]]

incoming: "Grow some balls and ask her yourself."
text:
"Ouch! Yeah, you're right. Sorry. Dumb question," he says sheepishly. "Kind of awkward to put you in that position anyway. I was just—"

A blur of blue darts across your light. You raise your pistol. Ryan looks over his back and then at you.

"What is it?"

1.[["I saw something."]]
2.[["Get out of the way."]]
3.[["MOVE!"]]

You both retreat. "Neil," he yells into the comm. "Bring the Speedwell to the LZ. We need some fucking help here."

"Coming as fast I can," you hear Neil say.

You run and run and run. You lose feeling in your legs but somehow keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but you manage to stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way, you see Markie running by herself--her suit covered in what appears to be blood. Ryan is nowhere to be seen. You've covered half the distance to her when, looking up, you see the Speedwell beginning its descent.

When you reach her, you take her by the arm and look through her visor. Her eyes are wild, and she's sweating.

"Markie," Meat says, "where's Ryan?"

She stutters. "D...d..dead."

"Fuck!" He turns back to the hole you and he emerged from. The wave of crabs has reached the mouth of the cave. In the light, they're purple and fungal looking.

He fires some shots at them while you tend to Markie. Her arm is wounded.

1.[["You alright?"]]
2.[[Stay silent and keep your hand over the tear in her suit.]]

incoming: You go to the mess hall for a bite to eat.
text:
The mess hall is rather small: two tables next to an enclosed kitchen. You find Meat sitting by himself, shoveling ramen into his mouth. A plastic cup filled with cheap whiskey is next to his arm. You grab your favorite snack, a box of soy oatmeal cookies, and take a seat.

Meat looks up at you, eyes red, a weary expression.

"Hell of a day, huh? Poor Ryan. How's Markie?"

1.[["Strauss is removing her arm."]]
2.[["Not great."]]

"Shit. We can't set this to autopilot or send out a distress beacon without access to that console."

"What's the trouble, cap?" Meat says, stepping through the door.

"Neil had a password. Do you know it?"

Meat shakes his head.

"Okay, what did we know about him?"

"He liked video games," Meat offers, approaching the console.

Salvucci slowly inputs "FLAPPY BIRD XXXXXI."

ACCESS DENIED, the screen reads.

"Worth a shot."

You all spend an hour typing various game titles, but none of them work. Eventually you give up and retire to the mess hall where Salvucci cooks hamburger meat for you both. 

You eat quietly.

The next day you all try again with various game titles to no avail. 

"To think everything hinges on a goddamn video game," Meat says.

For days it goes like this, your ship still drifting in space. Eventually you run out of food. You all try for hours in desperation to magically conjure up the password, but it's no good. The three of you realize that at that point you're just making up titles that sound like video games: Masher Nasher, The Adventures of Wallaby Dingo.

You all make your way to the mess hall and sit quietly, removed from one another. You think of your home back on Mars. You're glad you didn't get a pet. You wonder if anyone besides your parents will mourn your passing. Will they ever even know? You stare out one of the hall's viewports into space, your grave. There are worse ways to die, you say to yourself, than floating among the stars. 

It's hardly a comfort for you in the days to come. Eventually Salvucci takes his life, a gunshot ringing out on the far side of the ship, away from the mess hall, away from you and Meat.

"You know," Meat says one day. "I thought about eating you."

1.[["Why didn't you?"]]
2.[["Not much to eat."]]

incoming: Keep on going toward the mess hall.
text:
"See," Meat says. "Zoe says he'll be fine too. He's a big boy."

The four of you make your way to the mess hall. 

"Check everything," Salvucci orders. You look around the tables and near the entertainment closest while Meat looks around the kitchen. Salvucci keeps his eyes on the door. Strauss sits at a table away from everyone.

You find a small bag of chips and pocket them. No monsters, though.

Meat pokes his head out of the kitchen. "Nothing." He looks at all of you and shrugs his shoulders. "What now?"

As if to answer him, a loud shriek erupts from the vent hanging over you all.

"A GIFFTTTTT," Markie screams from the vent.

"Oh god," Strauss says, backing into the wall.

"Kill it," Salvucci says, raising his pistol. You, Meat, and Salvucci fire into the vent.

"Don't waste your ammo. Just a few shots," Meat yells.

You fire half of your clip and lower your weapon. The vent cover drops to the floor. Meat and Salvucci lower their guns as well.

"We got her, right?" Meat says.

"agiftagiftagiftagift," Markie answers from the vent.

"Fuck me."

"agiftagiftagiftAGIFTAGIFTAGIFT," she screams. At first, you're not sure what falls from the vent.You see a small, almost circular object dropping through the air. When it hits the ground with a splat, you know what it is, but you can't bring yourself to look.

Strauss' screams confirm your fears. You finally look down; it's Neil's head. Both his eyes have been gouged out and there's a jagged line of flesh and muscle where he was decapitated.

"A GIFT!" Markie yells once more before you hear her scamper away further into the ducts.

"I told you," Strauss, the first to speak, says. "We should have sent someone to look after him.

Meat kicks over a table.

"I told you!" Strauss screams at him.

"Doctor, quiet," Salvucci barks. He lowers his voice. "We'll mourn later."

"If we fucking live that long," Meat says.

"We have to trap it," Strauss says suddenly.

"Go on, doctor," says Salvucci, still eyeing Neil's head.

"I think it's pretty clear bullets aren't effective. We need to either space her or trap her in a tightly contained space and burn her."

"Risky options," Salvucci says.

"For once, I'm in agreement with the good doctor. This thing is shrugging off bullets like their bug bites. Question is: burn it or space it?"

1. [[Burn that motherfucker.]]
2. [[Space that motherfucker.]]

incoming: "Yeah? Well, let's make it fucking count."
text:
He doesn't meet your eyes. "Whatever. We need...we need to get this boat moving again. He gave you a password, right? Let's hope that console has autopilot or some shit. Worry about that motherfucker then."

The two of you make your way toward the cockpit.

A few minutes later you reach the cockpit door. Ben's body is still there, as are the burnt remains of the captain.
"Well, that's good, all things considered," says Meat. You step into the cockpit. The door slides shut behind you.

"Here's the computer."

You step over to the main console. A password screen greets you. You type in "KONAMI."

The screen changes to a selection of menus.

"Here we go: autopilot" says Meat. He touches the screen and selects NEW AUSTIN. You head for the door.

"All right, good. We're set. Let's get the hell out of her--"
A tentacle sweeps through the door as soon as it opens and brushes both of you aside with a mighty swing. 

You slam into the viewport, cracking the glass, and then fall to the floor. Looking up, you see the thing step into view: it's monstrous, with a muscular human abdomen. The thing's face is distinctly unhuman with countless, slitted eyes glaring at you. The monster's mouth is a vortex of meat and sharp teeth. Four tentacles protrude from its back, each one moving like a rattle snake.

You turn to look at Meat. He's being lifted into the air by one of the tentacles. His face turns red; he's slowly being choked to death.

You reach for your pistol.

1. [[Save Meat's life.]]
2. [[Save yourself; leave him to die.]]

Each group goes in a separate direction; you hike down the cliff with Ryan. It takes the larger portion of an hour to reach your tunnel. You step inside.

"Flashlights," Ryan says. 

You tell the computer to turn on the light attachment in your suit. It flickers for a moment before shooting a cone of light from your chest compartment.

"Let's do this," he says, pulling out his pistol.

The two of you proceed through the cave. On the Head-Up Display (HUD) of your suit, you can see the heartbeat monitors of everyone in your squad. You see that yours is going a little faster than normal and, knowing that everyone else can see that as well, you feel a little embarrassed.

"Ten bucks we find caveman drawings."

1.[["Deal."]]
The Terror Aboard The Speedwell

The man seems doubtful of your lie, but he has no evidence to contradict it.

Within three days, you're free to leave the military base. 

You return to your home in the suburbs and pour yourself a drink from the unopened bottle of whiskey in your cabinet. In spite of recent events, you feel...good. 

Not only did you survive horrific setup ripped from a bad horror movie...you killed someone and got away it. You feel a buzz.

You got away with murder.

And thus begins your reign as Mars' most renowned serial killer. Drunks staggering away from the bar and the homeless are your victims. Your weapon of choice? A scalpel. Each kill fills you with a kind of energy you've never known. The news says you're doing it because you're religious or you play video games or you have sexual fantasies about your mother.

You have no delusions. You just like killing people. 

The cops finally get you on the sixteenth murder. Turns out the poor bum you stabbed was undercover. You see the flash of red and blue as soon as you penetrate the poor officer's throat. You run, not even bothering to retrieve the scalpel jutting from his trachea.

You don't get very far. The sniper's bullet shatters your sternum, sending bone fragments into your heart. You're already dying when you hit the ground.

As police officers gather to get a good look at you, all you can do is wonder what they'll say about you on the morning news.

The End

You hear him call your name as you turn and sprint down the hall.

Fool, it says. I offered you evolution, wretch.

Blood drips from your nose. There's a pain in your stomach. You have to hurry.

You reach the hanger within a minute and seal the door behind you. 

You approach the hanger door and place your hand over the release button. Your legs go numb and you fall to the floor, hand still held against the button. You press it and close your eyes. There's a whoosing sound as air is sucked past you, stinging your cheeks.

The first thing you feel is the cold. You open your eyes to see the Speedwell in all its glory as you drift away. The thing in your brain screams in anger and despair, but another voice cuts through. "Just let go," Markie says, her voice free of malice and madness.

You turn away from your ship and peer out across the ocean of stars to gaze at what you think is the sun in the far distance. It's quite pleasant from afar.

You take her advice.

The End

incoming: "It's pretty funny, you saying that, when you were ready to pull her down a couple of hours ago. Just sayin'"

You see hurt flash across Strauss' eyes.

"Zoe," Salvucci says sharply.

"No, it's okay," Strauss says. "They were friends, except your friend's dead, Zoe. That thing out there isn't Markie anymore. I just hope you realize that and don't get us killed," she says turning away from you.

The two of them descend into uncomfortable silence; Strauss looking at her feet, Salvucci at the viewport. You feel awkward standing there, so you wander away.

The alarm wails through the halls. Salvucci turns to Meat. What's left of the color in Meat's face drains as he gazes at the control panel.

"Contamination in sickbay. Quarantine square's been broken."

"What's going on?"

Salvucci is quick. "Neil, you stay here. We'll lock you in so you're protected. You two come with me. Arm yourselves."

Meat grabs his rifle, and the three of you are out of the cockpit. Right before the metallic door slides shut, you hear Neil say "protected from what?"
