He sighs. "I want to believe you, but...nevermind. What now?"\n\n1.[["We sleep."]]

"They're all dead because of me," he says quietly. "I've never had people die under my command before. It's a strange feeling."

1.[["Ben isn't on you."]]
2.[["Let it go. I need you here and focused. We all do."]]

You follow Salvucci as he leaves the room. Before you step out you turn to Meat. His face is pale.

1.[["Good luck."]]
2.[["Be careful."]]
3.[["You sick fuck."]]

You fire several shots into the sea of creatures and even kill a few, but they still surge toward you.

"What are you doing? Run!"

You both retreat. "Neil," Meat yells over the comm. "Bring the Speedwell to the LZ. We need some fucking help here."

"Coming as fast I can," you hear Neil say.

You run and run and run. You surge ahead of Markie and lose feeling in your legs, but somehow you keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but eventually you stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way, you see Meat running. Ryan is nowhere to be found. You've covered half the distance to Meat when, looking up, you see the Speedwell beginning its descent.

You're almost to him when you hear Markie scream. Turning, you watch her fling one of the crab creatures across the ground.

"Fuck!" she yells.

Meat blasts the creature into pieces.The two of you rush over to her. She's holding her arm.

"It got me," she says; you detect fear in her voice. She turns to Meat.

"Where's Ryan?"

"Goddamn fucking thing ate him. It ATE him."

Meat's answer fills you with dread. No one that close to you has ever died before. Your vision becomes unfocused. A slap on the arm brings you back.

"We've got company, Zoe. I need you here and now," Meat says, nodding at the mouth of the cave where the crab creatures are gathering. There must be thousands of them. Luckily, behind you, you hear the Speedwell land.

Meat fires several shots at the crabs, but they don't seem to be leaving the cave anyway.

You and Meat help Markie to the ship's elevator. Meat enters a combination on the keypad and the door slides open. Inside the elevator, as you ride up, all three of you remove your helmets. You notice for the first time that your face is drenched in sweat.

A ding. The door opens. Captain Jonas Salvucci, an older, muscular man with little patience of tomfoolery, awaits you—-his hand wrapped around the pistol in his holster. He takes his hand away from the gun when he sees there's no threat.

"Get her to sickbay."

You nod and help Markie through the hallway of the ship. Behind you, you can hear Salvucci interrogating Meat.

"What happened to Ryan?"

"He's dead, cap. Something got him."

"Hell, Travis. What did you find down there?"

When you get to sickbay, both Lenore Strauss, the doctor, and her geeky assistant Ben are prepping the examination table.

"Where's she wounded?" Lenore asks, as you help a woozy Markie out of her suit. You glare at Ben as he gawks at her well-toned body. He smiles sheepishly and looks away, cheeks burning red with shame. Markie's drenched in sweat; she stares around wildly while Lenore straps her in. She examines the bite: it's just above the elbow, an inflamed bulging of the skin.

"And I was young and we were running," Markie rambles, "eyes bouncing up and down the shore while the sun cooked the corpses of washed up jellyfish."

You turn to Lenore, who's prepping some kind of tool.

1.[["What the hell is she saying?"]]

He looks away sheepishly. "Sorry."

"Stop trying to hit that, Ryan. It's not gonna happen," says Markie, the Speedwell's science officer.

Ryan waves his hands dismissively. The enforcer of the group, Meat, chuckles. "She told you."

1. [[Wink at Markie in appreciation.]]

incoming: "Move past it or more people are going to die."
text:
He nods. "You're right. Need to focus on the task at hand. What do you think it is you found on earth?"  

1.[["Cthulhu?"]]
2.[["No clue."]]

You take your knife and slowly cut up Meat's body. It's messy work, dividing the flesh and muscle from the bone. You store the body in various bags that are then stuffed into the freezer.

You stay alive another week, but the ships never come. The will to live finally leaves you; you lay down on the floor and close your eyes. You would cry if you had the strength.

The last thing you feel is the cold of the metal floor leaving your cheek.

The End

"Right? She's awful. No doubt about it."

The two of you enter the cafeteria and then, after taking a precautionary look around, you go into the kitchen and begin to stuff everything you can get your hands on into the two bags you brought from sickbay: fruit chips, soda, water bottles, pastries, canned soup.

When you've filled the bags, you leave the cafeteria and make your way to the common room. Strauss, Neil, and Salvucci are waiting. The common room is a circular room with a couch, several chairs, and a large wall-mounted monitor connected a server archive of countless movies, shows, and documentaries.  

On the back wall, there are portholes—just like on the ships of old that sailed the waters—where you can gaze into the dark of space.

"Run into any trouble?" Salvucci asks as you hand him the bag.

"Didn't see a damn thing," Meat says.

"I'm telling you," Strauss says, rubbing her bandaged arm, "we won't see it until it wants us to see it."

Meat grumbles something about paranoia and then heads over to the table, where Neil is setting up a checkers board.

"How's your arm, doctor?" Salvucci asks.

"Fine, captain. Thank you."

You feel tired.

What should you do?

1. [[Talk to Meat and Neil]]
2. [[Go to sleep.]]

incoming: "Nothing to be done about it, I guess."
text:
He shrugs his shoulders. "I guess so."

You both return to your group of friends to find that Neil is mooning the barkeep.

Weeks pass. One day you see a report about Earth destructing. "An issue with the core," says the handsome anchor. No one mentions monsters. No mentions nukes or fleets of war crusiers. It stirkes you that no one will ever know the sacrifices of you or your crew. You weep and Jessica asks what's wrong.

You lie. Just as you do when she asks you about the augmentations--the very ones she installed. "Accident in the cryotube," you tell her. You're so wracked with guilt over these lies that you make it a priority to never lie to her about anything. For the most part, your relationship is one built on trust.

Three years after your return to Mars you're married. It's a simple ceremony. Your parents show up, as do the surviving members of your crew. You eat cake. You kiss.

You move in with Jessica even though her apartment is smaller than yours. You just love the view of the Martian landscape and Jessica, quite content not to move anything, is more than happy to oblige you.

One day you catch a glimpse of light reflecting off the glass window of the balcony. You step onto the balcony and look out across the red canyons of your planet just to take in the beauty of it all. This is your new life, you tell youself. You've earned every second of it.
             
The End

You make your way to the vent where Meat has just finished prying off the cover. The gas is thick in the air, making you slightly dizzy.

"Tight fit," he says. "I'll go first so I can remove the next cover."

You look back to see that multiple tentacles have penetrated the door. Neil is pointing the pistol in the air and is breathing hard.

You force down the feeling of despair in your stomach and crawl through the vent. When you catch up to Meat, he's already kicking a cover.

"Almost got it!" With one last kick, the cover comes free. You emerge into the hallway just in time to feel the ship shake violently.

Meat slams his fist into the wall over and over. 

1. [[Put your hand on his shoulder.]]
2. [[Don't.]]

"Right?  What a horrible thing to do."

You both return to your group of friends to find that Neil is mooning the barkeep.

Weeks pass. One day you see a report about Earth mysteriously self-destructing ."An issue with the core,"  says the handsome anchor. No one mentions monsters. No mentions of nukes or fleets of war crusiers. It stirkes you that no one will ever know the sacrifices of you or your crew. You weep and Michelle asks what's wrong.

You lie. Just as you do when she asks you about the augmentations. Accident in the cryotube, you tell her. You're so wracked with guilt over these lies that you make it a priority to never lie to her about anything else. For the most part, your relationship is one built on trust.

Three years after your return to Mars you're married. It's a simple ceremony. Your parents show up, as do the surviving members of your crew. You eat cake. You kiss.

Michelle moves in with you. You live a comfortable life together. She starts talking about children and you make efforts to put off that conversation for as long as possible.

One day, the two of you take a trip to the recently terraformed beach. There's a moment where you're looking out across the manufactured ocean of Mars, wondering what lies ahead for you.

You know the ocean is fake, but you can't help but admire its beauty. This is your new life, you tell youself. It's one you've made for yourself, and you've earned every second of it.
             
The End

Salvucci nods. "That's a good idea.  You take doctor Strauss and do that. Travis and I will go check engineering. If it's wounded and looking for some place to hide, there's plenty of spots. Let's meet back here in an hour."

Strauss scoffs. "You're treating the beast like it's a wounded animal. You're wrong. It showed no hesitation when it attacked. It's not afraid of us. It's waiting."

Salvucci wrinkles his nose as he is wont to do when someone said something that annoyed him. "Regardless, we'll find the creature and put it down."

"Creatures," she says, correcting him. "There might be two of them now."

"Noted," Meat says, replacing the clip in his rifle.  You realize now that he has the most powerful firearm on the ship.

"If you two run into it or them or whatever, don't try to fight. Just run. Come find us."

"We should stop talking and get on our way," Strauss says gruffly. "Before it eats that damnable pilot, which wouldn't be such a bad thing if we didn't need him to fly the ship."

"Now's not the time for jokes, doctor," Salvucci says.

"Who says I was joking?" Strauss replies before leaving the room. 

You follow.

"Julia," Meat calls right before you step into the hallway. You turn. "Be careful."

Strauss is waiting for you when you step outside. She's holding her arm. There's a patch of red coming through the white sleeve right above the elbow.

"It's not a bite," she says, noticing your stare. "I fell when I was running and my arm took the fall."

text:
She glares at you and her lip quivers. You think she's holding back tears. "You don't think I know that?" 

For a moment you think she's going to lunge at you.

"Doctor, calm down!" Salvucci says, grabbing her arm. "And you," he says, looking dead at you. "What the fuck's gotten into you?"

Strauss looks up, her face void of emotion. "Forget it. What about the creature?"

"Meat's burning the bodies."

"Why the everliving hell is that lumbering mountain of idiocy doing such a thing?"

"He thinks they might come back."

"That fucking idiot! We don't know how that infection works. It could be twice as deadly as an airborne virus. I need those bodies intact. Call him! Stop him!"

Salvucci's face goes pale. "I don't have a walkie."

"Run," she says.

And you do. As fast as you can. Inside sickbay, you find Meat, sitting down on the floor, staring at where the bodies should be, but instead there's only a lot of blood and some meaty chunks.

An oil can, a bottle, and a rag are next to him.

"Where are they?"  Strauss demands. "The bodies? Where are they?"

"Oh good. You're alive," Meat says. You can feel the force of his eyeroll from here.

"Where are the bodies? Did you burn them?"

"No, doctor. As you would have gathered from the lack of smoke if you weren't a nutjob, I have not burned a damn thing. I came back and they were gone."

Strauss approaches Meat, gets in his face. "Well did they just fucking get up and walk off?"

He yells back. "I don't know! You're supposed to be the doctor here."

"Everyone relax," Salvucci says, voice raised.  Meat and Strauss calm down, each refusing to look at the other, each saying nothing.

"We've got two missing bodies, possibly infected and mutated into hostile lifeforms." Salvucci rubs his forehead. "I need thoughts, suggestions, anything. Where should we go from here?"  He turns to you first. 

1.[["We should check on Neil."]]
2.[["Let's go hunting."]]

"So you're just as lonely and pathetic as I am. Well, misery, company and all that, I suppose."

The two of you approach the cockpit. You knock on the door.
Neil's muffled voice comes from beyond the door: "Password?"

Neil reaches up and runs his hand along the cables. He quickly pulls it back. "Augh! Fuck!"

"What is it?" Meat barks.

"Nothing," Neil says, regaining his composure. "Just fucking slime. Oh god, gag a maggot," he says. "This shit reeks." He holds his hand up to the light to reveal a goopy, transparent liquid.

"Hey, that looks a little bit like—"

You examine the cables without touching them.

Meat takes a look as well. "Seems like a complicated operation."

Meat turns. "You didn't see how feral this thing was—not to mention she's missing a goddamn arm."

You reach and grab the saw. Markie's about to leap atop you when you swing the heated blades into her right foot, removing it from the rest of her body. She topples back as the leg stump turns into a geyesr of black blood. You throw the saw at her face, blinding her with heat.

"Put her in the chamber!" Strauss roars, pointing with her free hand at the cryochamber in the corner of the room. Meat and the captain are quick, grabbing the creature while it flails about. They pull it by the rotting arm to the chamber quickly. The pod hisses as it opens. Markie snaps at them, tries to attack with her claw but she can't get a shot in. She shrieks as Meat and Salvucci heave her into the pod.

You smash the control panel with your fist and the chamber closes. You can hear Markie's muffeled screams from within. She starts to smack the door with her claw; cracks appear in the glass.

"Whatever you're doing do it fast, doc." Meat says, aiming his rifle at the pod.

"Put your gun down and take this," she says, passing off the hose from the machine. Meat takes it. "Now, plug it into the port at the bottom of the pod. Hurry! And make sure it's plugged in tight."

Another crack in the glass. Meat takes the hose and screws it into the pod's port.

"Let go!"

Meat backs away from the metal hose. Strauss presses several buttons on the machine.

"What is that?" Salvucci says.

"It's the incinerator," she says, slamming her palm down on one last button. You hear the roar of the flames as they pass through the hose and into the chamber itself.The inside of the pod lights up as Markie's screams become even louder. 

It beats against the glass harder with her claw, but it's useless. Within minutes the monster's been vaporized.

For a moment, no one says anything. And then, just as you're all about to take a breath, in stumbles what was once Ben. The creature, missing both its eyeballs, gurgles as it reaches out toward you with rotting hands.

He nods at you and you both slowly back away. You pull out your pistol.

"What is it?" Meat asks.

"No idea. Whatever it is, we're in its territory. I'm inclined to think we should leave it alone. Let's head back to the ship."

The whine again. You focus your eyes and see something moving in the dark.

Markie sees it as well. "There's too many of them. Fall back!"

She fires a single shot. The flash of light reveals that the creature isn't one thing,but many things, with feelers and sharp teeth.

They rush toward you, hundreds of them.

1.[[Shoot the creatures.]]
2.[[Retreat with Markie.]]

"No," she says, turning away from you. "But it is."

You turn just in time to make out the tentacle that rends your head from your body.

The last sound you hear is the beast grunting with satisfaction.

The End

"That's exactly what we're going to do. Hallway A has a section with a viewport enclosed by two doors. We get it there, you shoot the window, and then we close it in."\n\n1. [["This is ridiculously dangerous. Count me in."]]

You fire your last shot in the dark. The monster roars again and then you catch a glimpse of the monster's hideous, reptilian face as it darts out and closes its jaws around Ryan's head. 

Like fingers plucking a grape from a vine, the beast rips off your squadmate's head, leaving a bloody and spewing stump behind. The squad vital monitor shrieks at you.

You flee.

Looking over your shoulder, you watch as what's left of Ryan is pulled out of sight.

You run and run and run. You lose feeling in your legs but somehow manage to keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but you manage to stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way, you can see Meat assisting a limping Markie. Behind them, you glimpse small purple mushroom shapes scuttling across the sand. You run toward your squadmates.  You've covered half the distance when, looking up, you see the Speedwell beginning its descent.

When you reach them, Meat hands Markie off to you and turns to fires several rounds at the crab creatures. He tags all of them except for one. 

You watch helplessly as the little bastard leaps through the air and, with tentacles shooting out from its underbelly, wraps itself around Markie's arm.

She screams in pain. You whip out your empty pistol and bash the monster's dome inward. The creature lets go of her arm and falls to the ground, legs squiggling. Its agony is short-lived, as Meat puts three rounds into the soft underbelly.

"Fucking fuck." He kicks the crab.

You turn to Markie, who's holding her arm. 

1.[["Is your suit ripped?"]]

incoming: "Why weren't we invited to the party?"
text:
Meat nudges you. "Not funny, Zoe."

"The infection spread," Strauss explains.

"What fucking infection?" Meat interjects.

Strauss turns her cold gaze onto him. "I don't know precisely what is in her body, Travis. What I do know is that once I amputated her arm, it lunged at my throat."

"Bullshit."

"No, it's...it's...true," Ben stammers. "It's over there. Look."

He's right, of course. There, lying on the ground, is an arm with shriveled fingers caked in yellow ooze. You can barely make out three bullet holes.

"Lenore says that Ben saved her life by putting it down," Salvucci explains.

1.[["What about Markie?"]]
2.[["Nice job, shrimp. Didn't think you had it in you."]]

incoming: "How about we plan on not dying?"
text:
"Come on. Let's get this over with." 

You both retreat to the hanger.

"Shit," he says as the door slides shut behind you. "I thought this place was bigger."

He's right: it's not much, and half the room is cramped by the reconnaissance droids.

"Loosen the holding clamps on those. I'll get our suits. Hurry, it can't be far behind us."

You deactivate the locks on the droids and catch the suit that Meat throws you. You're just about to put the helmet on when you hear the clanging at the door.

"It's here. When it gets in front of the droids, shoot the hanger switch, okay? And for fuck's sake, hold on to something."

The door bursts open and flies across the hanger. In steps the monster, mouth stained with blood, eyes looking about wildly.

It takes a step toward you.

"Over here, motherfucker!" Meat shouts through his suit's comm.

It growls and moves toward Meat. Its footsteps leave imprints in the steel floor.

Meat backs away from the droids until his back is pressed against the wall. He grabs onto a wall-railing.

The monster steps in front of the line of droids.

"Do it, do it now."

You take aim at the switch on the far wall. You fire.
The shot slams into the switch, and the alarms blare. Meat slowly pulls himself along the rail until he's behind the droids.

The hanger door opens and air swooshes out. You grip the railing beside you.

"Hold on!"

The beast begins to backslide toward the hanger door, its feet dragging. It tries to throw a tentacle at Meat, but they're pulled as well.  

A moment later they snap off and go flying into the black.  Meat, clinging to the railing, kicks the droids. It takes a second for them to detach from their holders and tumble down into the behemoth. The first one knocks it back a couple of feet. The second droid seals the monster's fate, knocking it off both of its feet and sending it careening into the stars.

"Eat shit and die, you fuck!" Meat screams through the comm. You can't help but grin as the monster spins out of sight.

The alarms in the hanger continue to yell for a couple of seconds, and then the emergency seal protocol activates, and the hanger door slowly slides to a close again.

"We did it," Meat says. "We fucking did it."

He walks over to you and hugs you tightly. You both laugh.

"We're alive!"

1. [["Home. Let's get the fuck home."]]

He smiles. The cab pulls away and you walk past your box—you'll get the mail later—and inside your home.

The door slides shut. And that's when you fall apart. You crumble to the floor and bawl yourself to sleep. You wake hours later only to cry yourself asleep again.

When you wake up again, you want to believe it's a new day but you can still feel the weight of the dead on your shoulders. It's a weight you never learn to completely shake, but you grow accustomed to it: the night terrors, the sudden flashes of Neil's sacrifice.

Meat's friendship and an ungodly amount of therapy helps you get through the trauma, as does Jack, the man who becomes your husband. The military sticks you with an analyst position, something you're quite fine with, though it is boring work.

You grow older. You and Jack talk about having kids.

1. [[You have kids.]]
2. [[You don't have kids.]]

"I tell you; I don't even think she qualifies as a human."

The intercom clicks on before you can say anything. "All officers report to sickbay," Salvucci says.

Meat gobbles up the rest of his bowl and grabs the rifle leaning upright against the table. You realize that you're out of ammo, so you take one of the clips from your belt and reload the pistol.

You and Meat exchange no words on the way to sickbay. The door is open when you get there. Salvucci, Lenore, and Ben are standing around a bloody examination bed. You look to the right: Markie, one arm missing, is sequestered in a see-through quarantine cube. She's looking around wildly.

You smell gunsmoke. Ben has both of his hands wrapped around his pistol.

1.[["What happened?"]]

Before the words can leave your mouth, there's a whooshing sound, followed by a giant spike tearing through Ryan's chest, splattering the cave with red. Ryan's pistol drops to the floor. He moans. 

You cast your light on the protruding spike and realize, as your comrade is slowly being lifted in the air, that it's a limb of some sort.

Markie's voice barks over the comm. "Zoe! What's happening!? Ryan's vitals are dropping." You fire several shots into the darkness. One of them slaps into Ryan's arm; his blue eyes gaze at you in shock.

Meat now: "Zoe? Answer us, girl. What the fuck is going on?"

1.[["We need to go. Now!"]]
2.[["Ryan's chum."]]

Meat makes a face. "Fucking nazi. It's a tiny bite. Can't they just disinfect it? It was bad enough losing somebody; we don't have to maim her."

1.[["It might be for the best."]]
2.[["Yeah. It's bullshit."]]

incoming: Give Meat a chance to explain.
text:
"He might come back, y'know?" Meat says. "Like a zombie."

"Stop talking," Salvucci says. "We need to find Strauss."

"If she isn't dead," Meat says grimly, eyes set on what's left of Ben's face.

1.[["He said Markie chased her into the hall."]]
2.[["Ben said Markie chased her into the hallway. She's probably dead."]]

Neil nods at you one last time. You make your way to the vent where Meat has just finished prying off the cover. The gas is thick in the air, making you slightly dizzy.

"Tight fit," he says. "I'll go first so I can remove the next cover."

You look back to see that multiple tentacles have penetrated the door. Neil is pointing the pistol in the air and is breathing hard.

You force down the feeling of despair in your stomach and crawl through the vent. When you catch up to Meat, he's already kicking a cover.

"Almost got it!" With one last kick, the cover comes free. You emerge into the hallway just in time to feel the ship shake violently.

Meat slams his fist into the wall over and over. 

1. [[Put your hand on his shoulder.]]
2. [[Don't.]]

"You look better. Neil's already at the bar. Salvucci will be along soon."

Sure enough, the little man is already getting his drink on when you step through the door.

"Holyyyy shit," he says, the margarita he just sipped through his straw spraying everywhere. "It's the bionic woman! Barkeep! I'm buying all this lady's drinks tonight."

You take a seat next to him at the table. Meat sits next to you and nearly takes up your whole side of the booth.

You turn to Neil, who's bright red in the face.

1.[["What, no foam finger for me?"]]

You fire a single shot. Strauss' head goes back and her limbs go limp. Markie turns to see all of you. She growls and drops Strauss.

That's when Meat fires at the control panel. Upon impact, the door dividing the hanger from the rest of the ship comes down, seperating you from the hanger. Alarms blare. You watch from the door's window as both Strauss' corpse and the creature are sucked out into space. You watch the two forms drift away until they're dots, inseparable from distant stars.

None of you give a cheer or breathe a sigh of relief, however. There's a sense of shame that hangs over all of you, an awareness of your cowardice. You played it safe so that one of your crewmates could sacrafice herself.

The auto-close kicks in and the hanger door shuts itself. The alarms cease their cries.

"We should go check Neil's console," Meat says.

The three of you silently make your way to the cockpit. Inside, you find the autopilot already engaged. The console is covered in blood; the pilot's corpse is behind it.

"He knew he wasn't going to make it," Meat says bitterly. 
"Setting the autopilot must have been the last thing he did. Another goddamn hero."

"Everyone who died here will be honored when we get home," Salvucci says. 

"Oh good, because medals were really what I was concerned about," Meat says. "I'm gonna go check the rest of the ship make sure nothing will snack on us while we sleep."

"I'll go with you," Salvucci says. "Julia, go make sure the cryopods are ready."

1. [[Ready the cryopods.]]

"I already took one risk today, Julia, and that got someone else killed. Superstitious or not, we're doing this. Now come on."

Salvucci leaves the room. You turn to look at Meat. He's pale.

1.[["Good luck."]]
2.[["Be careful."]]
3.[["You sick fuck."]]

"So you're just as lonely and pathetic as I am. Well, misery, company and all that, I suppose."

The two of you approach the cockpit. You knock on the door.
Neil's muffled voice comes from beyond the door: "Password?"

1.[["Open the door, numbnuts."]]
2.[["Oedipa."]]

Meat nods. "Better than waiting around to die, I suppose."

Salvucci's demeanor doesn't shift. "If we're going to do this, we need to have a plan. How many guns do we have?"

You all lay your firearms on one of the tables: one assault rifle with two clips, three pistols with 18 rounds each. In total, you have 94 rounds. You also have a Molotov cocktail, courtesy of Meat.

"Is that it?" says Salvucci.

Meat can't hide his annoyance. "What do you mean ‘is that it?' We have enough here to kill that thing fifty times over. Sorry, captain," he adds quickly.

Salvucci doesn't bother acknowledging the insubordination. "All right, tactics time. Everyone knows the layout of the ship, correct?"

"Two main hallways. Left connects to crew quarters, common room, cafeteria, engineering, cryoroom, and bathrooms. The other leads to sickbay, cockpit, and the hanger," Strauss says quickly.

"Pfft. Hanger, if you can call it that," Neil says. "It's barely big enough to fit our droids."

"Is that really appropriate right now?" Strauss says.

"I'm just sayin'."

"The big question, then, is how we're dividing teams."

"I'm with Meat," Neil says quickly, eyeing the assault rifle.
Strauss rolls her eyes.

"What? I called dibs."

"Okay, so that puts Meat and Neil together. Zoe, you go with them too. Doctor Strauss and I will take the right hallway."

1. [[Follow Meat and Neil.]]

"In that case, I'm with Meat. Both groups will hike down the wall and take their respective tunnels. We've got the third one on the right," she says, pointing. "You guys take the one over there."

1.[["I've got a bad feeling about this."]]
2.[["Roger that."]]

You take out the immiediate threat first, blowing Salvucci's mind out the back of his skull. The captain slumps.

Neil puts his hand up to block the next round but the bullet tears through his palm and into his chest. He takes a step backward. You fire another shot. He falls back onto the console.

Good child, the voice says. Now set a course for the human world.

You approach the console, pushing Neil's corpse out of the way. Neil was logged in, luckily. You play around with the settings until you find the autopilot and set a course for Mars.

The voice tells you it's proud of you and that great things await. It tells you to wait, so you do.

Later on, your body seizes and you flop to the ground like a dying fish. You watch with a mixture of horror and fascination as your arm explodes, spraying blood, skin, and bits of bone everywhere, to reveal a purple jagged claw.

Now, the voice says, your work truly begins. You follow its instructions and penetrate the chest cavities of Meat, Neil, and Salvucci with your claw. An hour later they've all risen. Of course, they're not really the people you knew. They're walking cocoons, dead flesh nuturing future soldiers.

It strikes you as odd that you should feel no guilt, but you chalk it up to how quickly you're evolving. Maybe guilt was, after all, a human weakness that needed to be culled. The closer you get to Mars, the more changes your body undergoes.

First, another claw sprouts. Next, in your sleep, you lose your skin and find it replaced with a hard shell-like body. Your teeth fall from your mouth and are replaced with the kind of teeth monsters in fairy tales have.

When you're a day away from the red planet, your soldiers hatch. They look like smaller versions of you.

They are to obey your every command, the voice says. Do not disappoint us, child.
 
Soon you have forgotten your human life and have not only come to terms with what you are, but you look forward to your duties. The descendents of your new species will sing songs of your exploits and worship the very ground you have tread.

Mars looms and with it, your future.

                      The End

incoming: "We need someone up in the vents."
text:
Meat raises an eyebrow. "The ducts?"

Strauss gets it. "Of course. That's how it could be traveling."

"Not good survival odds though, if someone finds her up there," Neil says, eyes toward the ducts. "That close proximity? With bullets that don't do shit? Yeah, I'm not gonna volunteer for that."

"Shit bird's right," Meat says. "If it is hiding up there, we need to figure out how to draw it out. If we go into the vent, we're fucking toast."

"What kind of insult is ‘shit bird?'" Neil mutters.

1.[[Draw the monster out.]]

"In any other situation, your reaction would be troubling."

The door behind you clangs.

"Shit," Strauss says, coating the last bullet. "At least we don't have to bait it now.

A louder bang now. A tentacle penetrates the door.

"Come on, let's go!"

You leave through the other sickbay door. In the hallway, she hands you your pistol. You find the viewport. It's a spacious square of glass that takes up half the wall. Behind you, there is the sound of giant, reveberating footsteps.

"He's coming. You get near the switch. I'll jump back after you shoot the window." Strauss positions herself near the window; you stand next to the switch. 

The creature approaches. It growls as it lumbers toward the doctor. Both the monster and Strauss are close to the window now.

1. [[Shoot the window.]]
2. [[Shoot Strauss first.]]

You grab the pistol from your holster. Too slow. Markie's atop of you, her semi-human hand wrapped around neck before you can even pull it up to chest level.

You aim upward and fire a shot into her chest. She looks down at you and smiles. The claw is surprisingly quick as it rips open your throat.

"Zoe!" Meat cries, but you know you're a goner. You watch helplessy as Salvucci and Meat both tackle her. Strauss is screaming about the cryopod. Your vision is becoming blurry. 

You hope your crewmates make it out OK and that they have nice words to say about you at your funeral.

Most of all, though, you wish you had gone for the goddamn saw. You were so close to getting out of here.

The End

"This, right here, is preserved acid. Right now it's completely safe but once the tempature is high enough, it does what acid does. Unfortunately, we can't really use it as a weapon against the beast itself. It's just not that acidic and I can't coat each bullet with enough of it to make a difference."\n\n1.[["So if we can't melt it...what's the point?"]]

"I had to kill him, you understand?" she says. "He attacked me."

"That's fine, doctor. He wasn't Ben anymore," Salvucci says.

"Relax, doc," Meat adds, rifle aimed at her chest.

"He bit me," she says, holding up her arm to show the bite mark. "Shit, he bit me."

Meat narrows his eyes and holds the rifle steadily. No one says anything. Tears begin to stream down Strauss' face.

"Maybe if I had more time I could come up with a cure or a way to fight the virus, but I can feel it in me now, coursing through my body. There's blood in the back of my throat. Vision blurry. Minutes. That's how long this takes to change us."

She looks at the pistol, turns it over in her hand as though she's seeing something she's never seen before.

"Kill it," she says. "Don't let it reach Mars."

Before any of you can stop her, she's pressed the barrel under her chin and pulled the trigger. Red splashes the ceiling. Strauss falls forward, head smashing into the floor.

"Jesus fuck," Meat yells.

Whatever color was left in Salvucci's face drains. Meat, in a moment of calculated rage, lifts his foot high over Ben's skull and stomps it several times. The innards of the boy's head ooze out like the insides of a old tomato. After he's done with Ben, he steps over to Strauss' body and aims his rifle down at her head.

He looks at the captain, who nods. He fires four shots and obliterates the top half of the woman's face.

"Shit shit shit," he groans, stepping away from the mutilated corpse.

1.[["We should get to Neil."]]

"I'll go with Sergeant Can't Keep It In His Pants, then."

"Hey!"

"We'll hike down the wall and take our respective tunnels. You guys have that one on the right over there. See it?" she asks, pointing.

"Yeah," Meat says. "On it."

1.[["I'm not crazy about this plan."]]
2.[["Got it."]]

incoming: "This is kind of a shitty idea."
text:
"Everything will be fine," Markie says. You go your separate ways, hiking down the cliff with Ryan. It takes the larger portion of an hour to reach your tunnel. You step inside.

"Flashlights," Ryan says. You tell the computer to turn on the light attachment in your suit. It flickers for a moment before shooting a cone of light from your chest compartment.

"Let's do this," he says, pulling out his pistol. You do the same.

The two of you proceed through the cave. On the Head Up Display (HUD) of your helmet you can see the heartbeat monitors of everyone in your squad. Yours is going a little faster than normal and, knowing that everyone else can see that, you feel a little embarrassed.

"Ten bucks we find caveman drawings."

1.[["Sure, Ryan."]]

incoming: "Where the fuck did she go, Ben? Talk to me."
text:
"She chased the doctor into the hallway. Can't believe Doctor Strauss left me here."

Before you can say a word, something SLAMS into you, knocking you across the floor. You look up. Markie sits atop of Ben, a scalpel in her hand. You can only see the side of her face but you know that your friend is gone. Blood and grime are dripping off her body, and her skin is peeling.

As if to remove all trace of doubt the creature inside your friend speaks. "Now now teacher's pet, no one likes a suck-up!"

"The hell?!" Meat roars.

The thing slams the scalpel into Ben's face, sinking the blade into his right eyeball.

1. [[Rush her.]]
2. [[Scream in terror.]]

Strauss narrows her eyes at you. "I shouldn't have to take it easy on him. He should realize the gravity of the situation and man the fuck up."

"Well maybe I'd understand the aforementioned gravity if someone would tell me what the hell was going on."

1.[["Ben's dead now."]]
2.[["There are one, possibly two monsters crawling around the ship."]]

He wheels you down to the cryo room where Neil and Salvucci are waiting.

"There's captain kickass herself!" the pilot says. "Oh don't look so put out, I'll buy you a foam finger when we get back to Mars."

1. [["Fuck. You."]]
2. [[Laugh.]]

Meat fires the rifle across the room, the gun's light chasing Markie's feet as she darts away. You raise your pistol and fire blindly in front of Meat's light, hoping to hit her with a lucky shot. Beside you, Neil screams in terror.

You hear the tell-tell click of the rifle as the clip goes dry. Meat swings the rifle around to point the flashlight at the door.

"Go!"

You all make a beeline for the door. Meat yanks on the handle and light bleeds into the darkness as you all sprint into the hallway. You slam the door and then bend over to catch your breath. Luckily, you manage to pull back just in time to avoid the spew of vomit that erupts from Neil's mouth.

"That was Markie—our Markie?" he says, wiping the spittle from his lip.

"Yeah, it was," Meat answers, a tinge of sadness in his voice. He reloads the clip. "This is my last one."

"Why didn't she attack us?"

1.[["She wants us to run out of ammo."]]
2.[["She's jerking us around."]]
"Hah. Yeah, no."\n\n1.\t[["The hanger. We can use the hanger."]]

It's Ben. There's a giant slash across his cheek and his eyes are wide with fear, but he's alive. You lean down to help him to his feet. You tug but he doesn't get up. He whimpers in pain. Meat shines the light down where his feet should be; the upturned examination table has pinned his legs.

"Travis, help me with this," Salvucci says, leaning down to grab the table.

"Hang on, son," Meat says, handing you the rifle so that he can give Salvucci a hand.

"She broke free..." Ben says. "Attacked me. Turn..turned the table on me."

1.[["Where did she go?"]]
2.[["Hush now."]]

You fire a single shot. Strauss' head goes back and her limbs go limp. Markie turns to see all of you. She growls and drops Strauss.

That's when Meat fires at the control panel. Upon impact, the door dividing the hanger from the rest of the ship comes down, dividing you from the hanger. Alarms blare.

You watch from the door's window as both Strauss' corpse and the creature are sucked out into space. The two forms drift away until they're dots, inseparable from distant stars.

None of you give a cheer or breathe a sigh of relief, however. There's a sense of shame that hangs over all of you, an awareness of your cowardice. You played it safe so that one of your crewmates could sacrafice herself.

The auto-close kicks in and the hanger door shuts itself. The alarms cease their cries.

"We should go check Neil's console," Meat says.

The three of you silently make your way to the cockpit. Inside, you find the autopilot already engaged. The console is covered in blood; the pilot's headless corpse is behind it.

"He knew he wasn't going to make it," Meat says bitterly. "Setting the autopilot must have been the last thing he did. Another goddamn hero."

"Everyone who died here will be honored when we get home," Salvucci says. 

"Oh good, because medals were really what I was concerned about," Meat says. "I'm gonna go check the rest of the ship make sure nothing will snack on us while we sleep."

"I'll go with you," Salvucci says. "Zoe, go make sure the cryopods are ready."

1. [[Go ready the pods.]]

You awaken in sickbay. Meat is standing over you, a relieved expression on his face. You realize your holster's empty; your pistol is gone.

He's armed.

You feel the warmth of your own body. Something's happening inside.

"You okay, Julia?"

1. [[Fake cry.]]
2. [[Go for his gun.]]

incoming: "I did not. I was too busy running for my life."
text:
"Great. If it's not dead, we're fucked. All we got left is your pistol. I'm guessing you're down to two clips."

You pop the clip out of your pistol to show him it's the last one.

"Shit."

"We don't know if it's alive. If it is, we'll improvise."

"Great, I wonder who'll die next time thanks to our improvisation."

Strauss says nothing. 

A few minutes later you reach the cockpit door. Ben's body is still there, as are the burnt remains of the captain.

"Well, that's good, all things considered," says Meat. You notice that Strauss is deliberately looking away from Ben's smashed skull.

The three of you step into the cockpit. You slam the door behind you.

"Here's the computer."

You step over to the main console. A password screen greets you. You type in "KONAMI."

The screen changes to a selection of menus.

"There's the autopilot," says Strauss. She touches the screen and selects NEW AUSTIN."

"We done?" Meat asks.

"Yeah, I think we're set."

"Good."

All of you approach the door.

"Now let's get out of here before that fucking thing corn—" 

A tentacle sweeps through the door as soon as it opens and brushes all of you aside with a mighty swing. You all going flying across the room. You slam into the viewport, cracking the glass, and then fall to the floor. Looking up, you see the thing step into view: it's monstrous, with a greekly perfect human abdomen. 

The thing's face is distinctly unhuman with countless, slitted eyes glaring at you. The monster's mouth is a vortex of meat and sharp teeth. Four tentacles protrude from its back, each one moving like a rattle snake.

"No!" you hear Strauss scream as one of the tentacles darts out and wraps itself around her neck.  It lifts her into the air and pulls her toward its master. You turn to look at Meat who's paralyzed with fear, watching one of the tentacles dance above him.

You reach for your pistol.

1. [[Help Meat.]]
2. [[Help Strauss.]]
3. [[Leave them to die.]]

You unholster your pistol. You hear it again: scuttling, and then something else--a high pitched whine that sends a shiver down your spine.

"We're not alone," Meat says, voice low.

"What's that?" you hear Ryan say over your comm.

"There's something in here with us. We're turning back."

He nods at you and you both slowly back away.

"What do you see, Meat?" Markie asks.

"Dunno. Don't like it whatever it is."

The whine again. You focus your eyes and see something moving in the dark.

Meat sees it, too. He fires at it. As muzzle fire fills the cave with flashes of light you see that the creature isn't one thing: but many things, with feelers and sharp teeth.

They rush toward you, hundreds of them.

"Let's get out of here," Meat yells.

1. [[Blast 'em.]]
2. [[Get out of there.]]

incoming: "Let it go. I need you here and focused. We all do."
text:
He nods. "You're right. Need to focus on the task at hand. What do you think it is you found on Earth?"  

1.[["Yog-Sothoth?"]]
2.[["Not a damn clue."]]

Before you can answer, Strauss slams the fist of her unwounded arm against the door.

"Listen here, you little shit. You open this door right now or so help me I'll put you to sleep, slather whatever honey we have left in the cafeteria on your testicles, and we'll use you as bait."

The door slides open. Neil's face, boyish as ever, awaits you and Strauss. He is unharmed.

"It eats honey?"

"I don't think I'll ever be able to fathom the depths of your stupidity, pilot."

Neil frowns; he seems genuinely hurt by the remark.

1.[["Let's just go."]]
2.[[" Doctor Strauss is right; stop dicking around, Neil."]]
3.[["Take it easy on him."]]

incoming: "You made the sensible choice. It just wasn't the right one. Don't let it get to you."
text:
"What do you think it is you found on earth?" Salvucci says, changing the subject. Your reassurance seems to have made him more focused.

1.[["Cthulhu?"]]
2.[["No clue."]]

incoming: "Don't be a wuss. This is your chance to be a man."
text:
"Easy for you to say, Zoe. You're not the one who's being served up as dinner."

Meat slaps Neil on the shoulder. "We won't let you get eaten. Now stop being a pussy. You're the tiniest one—the easiest prey, see?"

"You're not making this any more appealing."

"We can't make him do this," Strauss interjects.

"When the fuck did you grow a conscience? "Meat growls.

"I did what I did for the sake of survival. There were no other options. There are other options here. We just need to think rationally."

"Well," Meat says. "I'm waiting, doctor."

"No," Neil says. "I'll do it."

You turn to Neil.

1.[["You're certain?"]]
2.[["Damn right you will."]]

[img[TTATScover]]
[[Begin]]

[[Credits]]

incoming: "We lure it out into the open."
text:
"With what?" Neil asks.

Salvucci gets it. "One of us."

"Oh that's fucking rich. Who's gonna volunteer for that?" Neil says.

"Uh, you are, little man," Meat says, slapping Neil on the back.

"Fuuccccccck that."

"Oh don't be such a baby."

"You're not the one being strung up, you gargantuan motherfucker. Why don't you be the bait?"

"Because I don't look like bait."

Neil looks to you. "Julia, you gotta take my side on this."

1.[["Well, you are ideal bait..."]]

You put down the rifle and lean over to hug him and reassure him when something large SLAMS into you, knocking you and Meat's rifle across the floor. You look up. The rifle's light shines on Markie as she sits atop of Ben, a scalpel in her hand. You can only see the side of her face but you know that your friend is gone. Blood and grime are dripping off her body, and her skin is peeling.

As if to remove all trace of doubt the creature inside your friend speaks. "Now now teacher's pet, no one likes a suck-up!"

"The hell?!" Meat roars, whirling around. Too late.

She slams the scalpel into Ben's face, sinking the blade into his right eyeball.

1. [[Go for the gun.]]
2. [[Scream helplessly.]]

incoming: "There are one, possibly two monsters crawling around the ship."
text:
"Wait, there's two of them now?"

"If you must know," Strauss says, turning her head to glare at Neil, "Ben saved me and I left him to die. He's now become one of those things."

The surprise and indignation in Neil's voice fades. "Oh."

"Yes. Now can we please just get back to sickbay?"

"Sure. Sorry."

1.[["Dude, stop talking."]]
2.[["That was a bit harsh, Doc."]]

He smiles. The cab pulls away and you walk past your box—you'll get the mail later—and inside your home.

The door slides shut. And that's when you fall apart. You crumble to the floor and bawl yourself to sleep. You wake hours later only to cry yourself asleep again.

When you wake up, you want to believe it's a new day but you can still feel the weight of the dead on your shoulders. It's a weight you never learn to completely shake, but you grow accustomed to it: the night terrors, the sudden flashes of the captain's dead eyes.

Meat's friendship and an ungodly amount of therapy helps you get through the trauma, as does Melissa, the lovely barista who becomes your wife. The military sticks you with an analyst position, something you're quite fine with, though it is boring work.

You grow older. Melissa talks about having kids.

1. [[Have kids.]]
2. [[Don't have kids.]]

You open your mouth to speak, but you're cut off by a familiar voice. "Well, captain, I guess it's too much to hope for some confidence in my abilities."

Out from a supply closet steps Strauss. Sweat is dripping off her face; there's blood on her lab coat.

"Doctor, are you hurt?"

"No," she says. "It broke through the glass and grabbed me, but Ben pushed it off. I ran and didn't look back. I heard him scream behind me."

Salvucci looks at you nervously.

1.[["Ben's dead."]]
2.[["You left him to die, you bitch."]]

"Zoe, everything okay? You've got that look in your eyes."

Ryan constantly feels some odd need to ask whether or not you're all right. Either out of attraction or big-brotherly concern, you're not sure which. However, you are certain that it annoys the shit out of you.

1. [["Leave me alone."]]
2. [["I'm fine. Stop asking."]]

incoming: "Your bickering is going to get us killed."
text:
"Sorry," he says. "She's just getting on my nerves. I know she's had it rough. She and Ben were a thing, so she's on edge even more than usual, I guess."

The two of you enter the cafeteria and then, after taking a precautionary look around, you go into the kitchen and stuff everything you can get your hands on into the two bags you brought from sickbay: fruit chips, soda, water bottles, pastries, canned soup.

When you've filled the bags, you leave the cafeteria and make your way to the common room. Strauss, Neil, and Salvucci are waiting. The common room is a circular room with a couch, several chairs, and a large wall-mounted monitor connected a server archive of countless movies, shows, and documentaries.  

On the back wall, there are portholes—just like on the ships of old that sailed the waters—where you can gaze into the dark of space.

"Run into any trouble?" Salvucci asks as you hand him the bag.

"Didn't see a damn thing," Meat says.

"I'm telling you," Strauss says, rubbing her bandaged arm, "we won't see it until it wants us to see it."

Meat grumbles something about paranoia and then heads over to the table, where Neil is setting up a checkers board.

"How's your arm, doctor?" Salvucci asks.

"Fine, captain. Thank you."

You look around and notice dimly that you're a bit tired.

What should you do?

1.	[[Talk to Meat and Neil]]
2.	[[Go to sleep.]]

Strauss says nothing.  You can't help but notice Neil's grin.

"When are they supposed to be back?" He asks.

"An hour from when we left," Strauss says.

"How long ago was that?"

"I don't know. I'm not your timekeeper."

"Sheesh. Well, okay, so what should we do to pass the time?"

"Time's going to pass regardless of what we do with it."

"Right. So you're going to sulk over there in the corner. Fine."

He turns to you. "Julia?"

1. [[Rock, Paper, Scissors]]
2. [[Tic-Tac-Toe]]
3. [[Also sulk in silence]]

"Right? But I guess there's nothing we can do."

You both return to your group of friends to find that Neil is mooning the barkeep.

Weeks pass. One day you see a report about Earth mysteriously self-destructing. "An issue with the core," the handsome anchor says. 

No one mentions monsters. No mentions nukes or fleets of war crusiers. The thought strikes you that no one will ever know the sacrifices of you or your crew. You weep and Jessica asks what's wrong.

You lie. Just as you do when she asks you about the augmentations--the very ones she installed. "Accident in the cryotube," you tell her. You're so wracked with guilt over these lies that you make it a priority to never lie to her about anything else. For the most part, your relationship is one built on trust.

Three years after your return to Mars you're married. It's a simple ceremony. Your parents show up, as do the surviving members of your crew. You eat cake. You kiss.

You move in with Jessica even though her apartment is smaller than yours. You just love the view of the Martian landscape, and Jessica, quite content not to move anything, is more than happy to oblige you.

One day you catch a glimpse of light reflecting off the glass of the balcony window. You step onto the balcony and look out across the red canyons of your planet just to take in the beauty of it all. This is your new life, you tell youself. You've earned every second of it.
             
The End

"Awesome, someone I can actually depend on," she says, shooting a dirty look at Ryan.

"The hell did I do?"

She ignores his question. "You two will take that hole over there."

"All right then," Meat says.

1.[["Things that are not great ideas: this."]]
2.[["Let's get on with this then."]]

"I'm trying to figure out whether that's sarcasm. It's hard to tell with yo--"

"Andattheboardwalkifound..." 

"Uh...what was that?"

A shiver runs up your spine.

You raise your pistol up in front of you. The weapon's flashlight reveals there's nothing there.

"Was that Mar--HOLY SHIT!"

You feel Neil scramble up your leg. You turn to see Markie, her face slowly melting on Neil's pants leg.

"Oh shit oh shit oh shit."

Neil's head is in the way. You can't get a clear shot.

1. [[Shoot anyway.]]
2. [[Push Neil out of the way and lunge at Markie.]]

In the barracks, Meat flips on the lights and the three of you find your respective beds.

"Sleep tight, ladies," says Meat.

To your surprise, you find yourself drifting to sleep atop your bunk. Dreamless sleep covers your eyes. Briefly.

You awaken to the sound of choking. The first thing you see through blurred vision is a blood trail on the floor. You leap out of the bed and follow the trail out of the room to find Meat on the ground, neck slit. His eyes are watery as he grasps his throat.

"Strauss," he chokes "Strauss." He nods toward the lounge.

He closes his eyes and is gone forever.

You go to the lounge. You open the door to find Strauss standing in the middle of the room, a bloody scalpel in her hand. Her back is to you.

"Julia?" she says, not turning to face you.

1.[["Lenore."]]

It's a hard choice, but in the end, you get to your feet and sprint past the monster as it slaughters Strauss and Meat. You can hear their screams as you run down the hall. Soon things are mercifully silent. 

You climb up into the ventilation and decide to make your base of operations there. You're a survivor, you tell yourself. All you have to do is stay alive two months. That's all.

You go, day by day, into the ship in search of supplies. You often go to the mess hall to stock up on food and bring it back to the vents. You run into the creature twice. Each time it's grown bigger, nastier. The first time, you get away without a scratch.

The second time, a tentacle pierces your ankle. You still manage to hop away, but you can't climb into the vent because of your injury. You seek refuge in the darkness of the barracks. Soon every breath brings pain. You refuse to accept the hand you've been dealt, even when Strauss, half her head missing, sits down beside you to have a chat.

"You had a good run, idiot," she says. You stare at her ravaged face. 

1.[["You're not fucking real."]]

"Believe me, Julia, I'm all for a drawn-out, rational conversation, but we can't afford that luxury. She could expire and change at any moment."

"This is a bad horror movie," Ben moans, staring into the glass while Markie gazes at her own cauterized stump. She's drooling now and has a nosebleed. You can see black veins popping beneath the skin on her forehead.

"Enough," Salvucci says at last. "We're not killing anyone on my ship—we're not savages."

Meat seems relived. "Thanks boss."

"This is a mistake," Strauss says.

"Maybe," he says, "but it's my mistake to make, not yours. Do what you can to keep her alive and prep her for cryo sleep."

"Again, a mistake."

"Doctor Strauss, unless you want to be brought before a military tribunal for insubordination, I suggest you do as I say.

"Yes, captain," she says, voice calm, but there's a fire in her eyes. "Ben, lower the temperature to 15 degrees Fahrenheit. We'll try to freeze her."

Markie looks up at you all. A smile breaks out over her face and then she leans over and pukes.

"Disgusting creature," Strauss mutters.

"Travis, Julia, to the cockpit," Salvucci says.

1. [[Go to the cockpit.]]

You take the pistol from Meat's and proceed down the hall until you reach the cockpit. The door is unlocked. You step through.

Both Neil and Salvucci are there peering over the main console. They turn when they hear you enter.

"Zoe?" Neil says, his eyes staring at the blood on your face and uniform.

1. [[Murder both of them.]]
2. [[Put a bullet in your brain.]]

"What the fuck, Zoe?"

He turns to Strauss. "When are they supposed to be back?"

"An hour from when we left," Strauss says.

"How long ago was that?"

"I don't know. I'm a doctor, not a timekeeper."

"Sheesh. Well, okay, so what should we do to pass the time?"

"Time's going to pass regardless of what we do with it."

"Right. So you're going to sulk over there in the corner. Fine."

He turns to you. "Zoe?"

1. [[Play Rock, Paper, Scissors.]]
2. [[Play Tic-Tac-Toe.]]
3. [[Sulk in silence.]]

"You're not on Mars," he says. His accent is twangy. 

"You fell into a rift and got yourself stuck between universes. To tell you the truth, I'm more impressed by your survival instinct than anything else. I thought I had patched all the holes."

1. [["Holes?"]]

"I didn't have a choice," she stutters.

"There's always a choice," Meat barks, stomping toward her.

"It's what he wanted!"

"We could have saved him!"

"No, you coul—" Her declaration dies in her throat as Meat violently wraps his hands around her neck. "You'd do the same to any of us, wouldn't you?"

"Travis...stop," Neil says.

"No, she'd kill us all if it worked to her advantage, Neil. I don't want someone like that behind us."

Strauss' face is turning red.

1.[["Let her go."]]
2. [[Look into her eyes as she dies.]]

incoming: "You're still angry about that time she reset your broken finger, you big baby."
text:
Well, yeah, a bit. Maybe," he says, glancing at his finger. "It hurt."

The intercom clicks on before you can say anything. "All officers report to sickbay," Salvucci says.

Meat gobbles up the rest of his bowl and grabs the rifle leaning upright against the table. You realize that you're out of ammo, so you take one of the clips from your belt and reload the pistol.

You and Meat exchange no words on the way to sickbay. The door is open when you get there. Salvucci, Lenore, and Ben are standing around a bloody examination bed. You look to the right: Markie, one arm missing, is sequestered in a see-through quarantine cube. She's looking around wildly.

You smell gunsmoke. Ben has both of his hands wrapped around his pistol.

1.[["What happened?"]]

"No. I guess it really doesn't, does it?" He turns away from them, though you notice his eyes lingering on Strauss' corpse for a moment.

"God, I just want some sleep."

1.[["Let's sleep then."]]

You make your way to the vent where Meat has just finished prying off the cover. The gas is thick in the air, making you slightly dizzy.

"Tight fit," he says. "I'll go first so I can remove the next cover."

Strauss follows Meat. You look back to see that multiple tentacles have penetrated the door. Neil is pointing the pistol in the air and is breathing hard.

You force down the feeling of despair in your stomach and crawl through the vent. When you catch up to Strauss and Meat, he's already kicking a cover.

"Almost got it!" With one last kick, the cover comes free. Meat grabs Strauss and pulls her through. You emerge into the hallway just in time to feel the ship shake violently. 

Meat slams his fist into the wall over and over. Strauss looks on sadly.

1.[["Hey! Focus. I need you here. We can stew in our guilt later, got that?"]]
2. [[Leave him be.]]

"Would it kill you to be at least a little dishonest?" Meat says, smiling. "Somebody's got to be the optimist."

"Make your move already, dude," says Neil, growing impatient.

"Fine. Julia, we can talk strategy in a bit."

You walk away.

1. [[Talk to Salvucci and Strauss]]
2. [[Go to sleep.]]

Salvucci nods. "That's a viable plan. We'll all enter the ventilation and hunt it down."

"All of us?" Neil asks.

"Yes, pilot. All of us."

"Do I get, like, a weapon at least?"

"Here." Meat says, shoving his own pistol into Neil's hands.

"Bro, I've never used one of these."

"Well, if it makes you feel better, it wouldn't help much anyway. Bitch is a bullet sponge."

"Oh good, you know for a minute there I thought I might actually have decent odds of survival."

"Quit bickering," Salvucci says sternly. "We'll go for the vent in the central hallway. From there we can spread out and cover the whole ship."

You all make your way to the central vent, located in the belly of the ship. Salvucci pushes a button on the wall; the vent shrieks open and down pops a ladder.

"I'll go north. Travis, you're with me. Julia and Neil, you go south. We meet back here in twenty minutes. If you spot it, call for help."

You watch as Meat and Salvucci ascend the ladder. You and Neil wait a minute and then go up. 

The shaft is tight, but both of you manage to fit, with you at the front. You crawl slowly, pistol in hand.

"You know," Neil says after you've been crawling for five minutes, "I never thought I'd go like this. I thought that it'd be from a heart attack...in a bathroom or something, nude on a tile floor, ass up in the air."

1.[["Please be quiet."]]
2.[["Do tell."]]

"I guess I shouldn't expect kindness from any of you, though I only did what had to be done."

Meat lights the rag and then tosses the bottle at the corpses. Ben goes up in flames quickly. The captain isn't far behind.

"Come on, let's go," Neil says.

"Yes," Strauss says. "Anywhere but here."

"Sure you don't want to watch your boyfriend barbecue?"

Strauss gives him a look of pure malice and then walks around the corner.

Neil waits until she's out of sight. "What now?"

Meat looks at him. "We're not done hunting."

"Did either of you get the captain's pistol?"

"Yeah, it didn't have any ammo in it, though. That's not good. Man is...was a crackshot. That thing probably soaked up all those bullets like a sponge."

"We'll have to improvise."

The three of you leave.  You don't look back at the bodies, but you can hear the flesh crackling.

Strauss is waiting for you down the hallway, arms folded, the stony quality of her face fully returned. "What now?" she says.

"We find the other one and kill it."

"Yes, but how, precisely? What's our strategy?"

1.[["We need someone in the air ducts."]]

incoming: "You're alive, doctor. Isn't that what counts?"
text:
"I guess so. Still. I wish things could have been different."

You sip your drinks without another word until it's time to go. The cabbie takes you home first.

"Zoe," Strauss says. "Take care, okay?"

1.[["Yeah. You too, doc."]]
2. [[Simply nod.]]

incoming: Go home and get some sleep.
text:
"Yeah, that might be best for both of us." You share a cab. The cabbie drops you off at your home in the suburbs.

"Hey," Meat says as you get out of the cab. You turn. "Give me a call if you need anything, okay?"

1.[["Of course. You too."]]

"Just not worth it. They haven't come for us in two weeks. They're not going to come at all. What's the point of staying alive five days longer, y'know?"

Those are the last words he says to you. He goes to sleep later and doesn't wake up. You stare at his pale body sprawled out on the floor. Your belly rumbles weakly.

1. [[Eat him.]]
2. [[Don't eat him.]]

He nods.

"Space. You want to jettison the fucker. That's insane. Not like we have a better option though, and he's slow, so maybe we won't die. Maybe." He sighs. "Well, if we're gonna do this, let's do it."

You both retreat to the hanger.

"Shit," he says as the door slides shut behind you. "I thought this thing was bigger."

He's right: it's not much, and half the room is cramped by the reconnaissance droids.

"Loosen the holding clamps on those. I'll get our suits. Hurry, it can't be far behind us."

You deactivate the locks on the droids and catch the suit that Meat throws you. You're just about to put the helmet on when you hear the clanging at the door.

"Damn. It's here. When it gets in front of the droids, shoot the hanger switch, okay? And for fuck's sake, hold on to something."

1.[["Stay alive."]]

Meat lights the rag and then tosses the bottle at the corpses. Ben goes up in flames quickly. The captain isn't far behind.

"Come on, let's go," Neil says.

"Yes," Strauss says. "Anywhere but here."

"Sure you don't want to watch your boyfriend barbecue?" Meat says.

Strauss gives him a look of pure malice and then walks around the corner.

Neil waits until she's out of sight. "What now?"

Meat looks at him. "We're not done hunting."

"Did either of you get the captain's pistol?"

"Yeah, it didn't have any ammo in it, though. That's not good. Man is...was a crackshot. That thing probably soaked up all those bullets like a sponge."

"We'll have to improvise."

The three of you leave.  You don't look back at the bodies, but you can hear the flesh crackling.

Strauss is waiting for you down the hallway, arms folded, the stony quality of her face fully returned. "What now?" she says.

"We find the other one and kill it."

"Yes, but how precisely? What's our strategy?"

1.[["We need someone up in the vents."]]

You decide to wait it out, see if you're not infected. Too bad you killed the only guy who had access to the autopilot controls. 

That's when you notice a wetness on your cheek. You touch it with your finger and pull back blood.

You're infected. However, you can't bring yourself to eat a bullet. You've been through too much. You decide to ride it out, see what happens.

Nothing good. Your fingernails fall off first. Then you start vomiting and shitting blood. Your teeth are next. At this point you decide that killing yourself is the best course of action, but you go blind before you can find your gun.

Days pass like this, with you lying on the floor, begging for death, unable to see anything. Finally, you feel a movement in your chest. A tremor.

And then you feel nothing at all.

The End

"Huh, no shit?"

The four of you trek on in silence until you reach the crater. You approach the edge and look down into the abyss. The area of impact stretches for miles.

"I don't even see a fucking twig, man," Meat says.

"It's been over a hundred years since the impact. I think all you're going find is dirt down there," Markie replies.

"Don't forget the radiation," Ryan says, kicking a pebble over the edge.

"That too."

Markie peers down. "Zoom," she says. You hear the computer inside her helmet respond in affirmation to the command.

"You gonna get that girl of yours a rock from the surface?" Ryan asks Meat. "I hear people used to go crazy over moon rocks after the Apollo landings. Might make a punny engagement ring, y' know? Girls go for that sort of thing."

Meat grunts. "Not my woman. She's endowed, but it ain't with brains. The humor would, uh, escape her."

"And the radiation," Markie points out.

"Stupid radiation. Ruining everything," Ryan says.

"Hmm. That's interesting," Markie says—it's almost a whisper.

1.[["What is it?"]]

Meat nods. "Better than waiting around to die, I suppose."

Salvucci's demeanor doesn't shift. "If we're going to do this, we need to have a plan. How many guns do we have?"

You all lay out your firearms on one of the tables: one assault rifle with two clips, three pistols with 18 rounds each. In total, you have 94 rounds. You also have a Molotov cocktail, courtesy of Meat.

"Is that it?" says Salvucci.

Meat can't hide his annoyance. "What do you mean ‘is that it?' We have enough here to kill that thing fifty times over. Sorry, captain," he adds quickly.

Salvucci doesn't bother acknowledging the disrespect "All right, tactics time. Everyone knows the layout of the ship, correct?"

"Two main hallways. Left connects to crew quarters, common room, cafeteria, engineering, cryoroom, and bathrooms. The other leads to sickbay, cockpit, and the hanger," Strauss says quickly.

"Pfft. Hanger, if you can call it that," Neil says. "It's barely big enough to fit our droids."

"Is that really appropriate right now?" Strauss says.

"I'm just sayin'."

"The big question, then, is how we're dividing teams."

"I'm with Meat," Neil says quickly, eyeing the assault rifle.

Strauss rolls her eyes.

"What? I called dibs."

"Okay, so that puts Meat and Neil together. Julia, you go with them too. Doctor Strauss and I will take the right hallway."

1. [[Go with Meat and Neil.]]

You shoot her in the face. Her corpse falls back onto the floor and is still.

Moments later both Neil and Salvucci burst through the door. They see the corpse. Salvucci has his hand in his gun.

Neil speaks first: "What happened?"

1.[["She was infected. She killed Meat out of cowardice."]]
2. [[Take no chances: kill both of them.]]

incoming: "I've got at least two bullets left."
text:
"I'm not ready to call it quits yet. There's got to be a way to kill that thing without guns."

1.[["Okay, what about the hanger?"]]

"I'll do you one better," she says. She writes down her number on the back of an index card and places it on the table next to your bed. "Give me a call sometime and I'll tell you my name," she says, flashing that white smile.

Meat is the one who picks you up from the hospital and drives you home.

"That's pretty badass," he says, nodding toward your augmented hand. "Can you, like, crush steel and shit?"

1. [["I wish."]]

He approaches. You reach for his gun, swifter than you thought you could be, and pull it from his holster.

"Julia, what the--" His cry of surprise is cut off mid-blast as a shot to the chest robs him of his life and knocks him off his feet.

His dead eyes stare at the ceiling.

Now, the voice says, the other two.

1. [[Search for Neil.]]

"I know. It's my weight to bear, I suppose."

You sip your drinks without another word until it's time to go. The cabbie takes you home first.

"Julia," Strauss says. "Take care, okay?"

1. [["Thanks, doc."]]
2. [["I will."]]

You watch as Meat staggers out of the bar, hoping he calls a cab. You wait ten more minutes to avoid any awkward post-goodbye goodbyes and then stumble outside yourself.

A cab picks you up and takes you to your little house in the Martian suburbs.  You pay the cabbie and walk past your box—you'll get the mail later—and inside your home.

The door slides shut. And that's when you fall apart. You crumble to the floor and bawl yourself to sleep. You wake up in the night only to cry yourself asleep again.

When you wake up again, you want to believe it's a new day but you can still feel the weight of the dead on your shoulders. It's a weight you never learn to completely shake, but you grow accustomed to it: the night terrors, the sudden flashes of Ben dying in agony.

Meat's friendship and an ungodly amount of therapy help you get through the trauma, as does Jack, the man who becomes your husband. The military sticks you with an analyst position, something you're quite fine with, though it is boring work.

You grow older. You and Jack talk about having kids.

1. [[You have kids.]]
2. [[You don't have kids.]]

"Ugh. You too?" Meat groans.

"We're going to regret this," Strauss says.

Salvucci shakes his head. "We'll be fine. Strength in numbers. As long as we stick together, we won't lose anymore people."

The four of you decide to stick it out in the mess hall. Meat, you, and Salvucci take turns keeping an eye on the door for Markie. Strauss rations the food that comes out of the pantry...including your chips. You try not to hold it against her.

A week passes. No sight of the creature yet.

"Nice beard you've gotten going on there, Neil," Meat tells the pilot, who's been cultivating uneven patches of facial hair.

"Bite me, big man."

You're in the middle of biting into the last half of your final soy cookie when you hear the sound in the vent--it's a squishy sound.

"You heard it too," Meat says, standing up and pointing his rifle at the vent.

Something starts to hammer at the vent cover.

"It's her!" Salvucci yells. "Fire!"

The three of you unload your clips into the vent. The destroyed cover falls to the floor. And then something else: A giant, bulbous, leaky sack that explodes when it hits the ground. Blood and pus fly everywhere. 

You black out.

When you come to, Meat's helping you up. He, like you and everyone else, is covered in gore.

"Everyone all right?" Salvucci asks.

"Yeah, ugh this is so nast--" Meat is interrupted by Strauss leaning over and vomiting on the floor.

"Couldn't have said it better myself, doc. What was that? A bomb?"

"It's...oh god," Strauss spits. "It's what left of her."  She points at something on the ground.

1. [[Look at what she's pointing at.]]

"Everything will be fine," Markie says.

The groups go their separate ways; you hike down the cliff with Meat. It takes the larger portion of an hour to reach your tunnel. You step inside.

"Let's get our lights on."

You both tell your suits to turn your on your light attachments. Yours flickers for a moment before shooting a cone of light from your chest compartment.

The two of you proceed through the cave. On the Head-Up Display (HUD) of your suit, you can see the heartbeat monitors of everyone in your squad. You see that yours is going a little faster than normal and, knowing that everyone else can see that, you feel a little embarrassed.

You proceed through the cave.

"You know what I want?" Meat asks. He doesn't wait for you to answer. "I want a fucking taco. Beef. Cheese. Some guac on top. No more of this space bag food bullshit."

1.[["Pizza."]]
2.[["Space food's not so bad."]]

The door bursts open and flies across the hanger. In steps the monster, mouth stained with blood, eyes looking about wildly.

It takes a step toward you.

"Over here, motherfucker!" Meat shouts through his suit's comm.

It growls and moves toward Meat. Its footsteps leave imprints in the steel floor.

Meat backs away from the droids until his back is pressed against the wall. He grabs onto a wall-railing.

The monster steps in front of the line of droids.

"Do it, do it now."

You take aim at the switch on the far wall. You fire.

The shot slams into the switch, and the alarms blare. Meat slowly pulls himself along the rail until he's behind the droids.

The hanger door opens and air swooshes out. You grip the railing beside you.

"Hold on!"

The beast begins to backslide toward the hanger door, its feet dragging. It tries to throw a tentacle at Meat, but they're pulled back as well.  

A moment later they snap off and go flying into the black.  Meat, clinging to the railing, kicks the droids. It takes a second for them to detach from their holders and tumble down into the behemoth. The first one knocks it back a couple of feet. The second droid seals the monster's fate, knocking it off both of its feet and sending it careening into the stars.

"Eat shit and die, you fuck!" Meat screams through the comm. You can't help but grin as the monster spins out of sight.

The alarms in the hanger continue to yell for a couple of seconds, and then the emergency seal protocol activates, and the hanger door slowly slides to a close again.

"We did it," Meat says. "We fucking did it."

He walks over to you and hugs you tightly. You both laugh.

"We're alive!"

1.[["Come on. Let's get out of the hanger."]]

incoming: Keep on in the direction of the mess hall.
text:
You proceed into the mess hall.

"Check everything," Salvucci orders. You check around the tables and near the entertainment closest while Meat looks around the kitchen. Salvucci keeps his eyes on the door.

You find a bag of chips and pocket it. No monsters, though.

Meat pokes his head out of the kitchen. "Nothing."

"Shit," Salvucci says. "I guess we should go to the bu--" A high-pitched scream cuts him off. Then, gunfire.

"Strauss," Salvucci says.

"Well, come on, let's go," Meat says, running out of the kitchen, rifle in hands.

All of you run out the door and down the hallway toward Neil's cockpit. You're halfway there when you spot a sticky mass of flesh and blonde hair on the ground.

"It's Ben," Meat says.

You're almost to the body when Strauss, hair a mess and her cheek dripping with blood, steps out from the corner. Her shaky hands are gripped around the captain's pistol, a gun aimed at all three of you.

1.[["You crazy bitch."]]

He stops punching the wall after a while. Blood drips from his fingers. He breathes heavily.

"He's dead...because of us."

1.[["I know. Now let's make it count."]]
2.[["Nobody could have predicted that."]]

incoming: "What the fuck is wrong with you?"
text:
She glares at you.

"I am taking off her arm because it's required by fucking protocol. So get out of my office so I can do my job. Thanks."

She turns away from you to get to work. Ben looks from you to her without saying anything. He turns back to the tablet in his hands.

1.[["Talk to me like that again and I'll use that saw on you."]]
2. [[Leave the doctor to her work.]]

"What makes you so sure?" Strauss sneers.

1.[["You better watch your tone, Doc. I'm getting tired of your bullshit."]]
2.[["I have faith."]]
3.[["Listen bitch, step off."]]

Markie sighs. The four of you trek on in silence until you reach the crater. You approach the edge and look down into the abyss. The area of impact stretches for miles.

"I don't even see a fucking twig, man," Meat says.

"It's been over a hundred years since the impact. I think all you're going find is dirt down there," Markie replies.

"Don't forget the radiation," Ryan says, kicking a pebble over the edge.

"That too."

Markie peers down. "Zoom," she says. You hear the computer inside her helmet respond in affirmation to the command.

"You gonna get that girl of yours a rock from the surface?" Ryan teases Meat. "I hear people used to go crazy over moon rocks after the Apollo landings. Might make a punny engagement ring, y' know? Girls go for that sort of thing."

Meat grunts. "Not my woman. She's endowed, but it ain't with brains. The humor would, uh, escape her."

"And the radiation," Markie points out.

"Stupid radiation. Ruining everything," Ryan says.

Hmm. That's interesting," Markie says—it's almost a whisper.

1.[["What is it?"]]
2. [[Remain quiet.]]

You fire at the tentacle wrapped around Strauss' neck. The appendage snaps and she falls to the floor, gasping for breath. You run by and grab her arm, pulling her to her feet. The two of you sprint past the creature as it focuses its attention on Meat, who cries "Don't leave me!"

As the two of you run down the hallway, you can hear his screams echo down the hallway. 

You and Strauss stop when she runs out of breath.

"Why did you save me?" she asks.

1.[["Most people would say 'thank you.'"]]

"Thanks," she says. She leaves the mess hall. You hear her break out into a run, her footsteps echoing through the hall.

"Help!" she shrieks as she runs. "Help!"

Time passes painfully, slowly. Finally, Salvucci turns to both of you. "We go. Now."

All of you start running toward the hanger. "Keep an eye out for anything," Salvucci says. "It might try to use this plan against us."

You reach the hanger in two minutes. You all peek through the threshold to see Markie advancing on a bloodied Strauss, who has her back to the hanger door. The captain's pistol is on the floor several feet from the pair.

"She's wounded," Meat says, defeated. "Infected."
