Markie is shuffling closer, giggling. Strauss sees the three of you. She looks over at the panel that controls the hanger door and then looks back at you all. She nods.

You slowly raise your pistol. Markie grabs the doctor by the throat and lifts her into the air. She chokes.

You feel Meat beside you raising his rifle. His hands are shaking.

1. [[End Strauss' pain.]]
2. [[Shoot the switch.]]

incoming: "She had killed the captain. Looks like karma caught up with her."
text:
Your confession damns you. You're court-martialed and found guilty of murder in the first degree. You're sentenced to life aboard Titan penitentiary. For you, life turns out to be three years.

When you refuse the courtship of one of the most powerful inmates in the penitentiary, she has one of her thugs stab you in your throat while you're taking a shower.

As the blood and suds and water swishes all around you on the way to the drain, you look up at your nude attacker. On her calf, you see a tattoo of an angel and a demon dancing around a single word: "Karma."

You almost want to laugh. Almost.

The End

"Man, there's something about that doctor. She likes hurting people."

The PA clicks on: "All officers report to sickbay," Salvucci says.

Meat gobbles up the rest of his bowl and grabs the rifle leaning upright against the table. You realize that you're out of ammo, so you take one of the clips from your belt and reload the pistol.

You and Meat exchange no words on the way to sickbay. The door is open when you get there. Salvucci, Lenore, and Ben are standing around a bloody examination bed. You look to the right: Markie, one arm missing, is sequestered in a see-through quarantine cube. She's looking around wildly and doesn't seem to be aware of her surroundings.

You smell gunsmoke. Ben has both of his hands wrapped around his pistol.

1.[["Why weren't we invited to the party?"]]
2.[["Something happened, huh?"]]

incoming: Look at what she's pointing at.
text:
It's Markie's nametag, covered in gore.

"So, she's like, dead, right?" Neil says, picking gunk out of his hair. "We're safe now."

"Why did she die, though? And why like that?" Salvucci asks.

"Travis," Strauss says. "What did you say earlier?"

"What?"

"You said something a second ago. What was it?"

1.[["A bomb."]]

Javy Gwaltney: Designer/Writer

 Elizabeth Simins: Illustrator

And special thanks to Zeh Fernando for permission to use his font.

[[Begin]]

You sniff and then rub your eyes. The tears come quickly.

Meat falls for it. "Oh hey, hey, Julia." He hugs you.

Now, the voice hisses.

1. [[Kill Meat.]]

"Guess it isn't much use wondering about it, huh?" He turns away from them, though you notice his eyes lingering on Strauss' corpse for a moment.

"God, I just want some sleep."

1.[["Come on. Let's sleep, then."]]

You glimpse her smile. "You don't have a fucking clue do you? An earthworm is--what was that?"

You heard it too. A scuttle. 

Markie slowly pulls out her pistol. "Just in case."

Suddenly you hear a a high pitched whine from the darkness that sends a shiver down your spine. "Guys, we're not alone," Markie says into her comm.

"What's that?" you hear Ryan reply.

"There's something in here with us."

She nods at you and you both slowly back away. You pull out your pistol.

"What is it?" Meat asks.

"No idea. Whatever it is, we're in its territory. I'm inclined to think we should leave it alone. Let's head back to the ship."

The whine again. You focus your eyes and see something moving in the dark.

Markie sees it as well. "There's too many of them. Fall back!"

She fires a single shot. The flash of light reveals that the creature isn't one thing, but many things, with feelers and sharp teeth.

They rush toward you, hundreds of them.

1. [[Blast the little bastards.]]
2. [[Run. Now.]]

incoming: "I better get a lot more than a citation for my goddamn foot."
text:
"Cheer up! Ladies dig the augmentations. I'm gonna go tell them you're awake and we'll get your pod ready."

He leaves and comes back a couple minutes later, grabbing a wheelchair from the corner of the room. "All right, let's get you in. Just don't look at your foot."

He helps you into the chair.

1. [[Look at your foot.]]
2. [[Don't look at your foot.]]

The groups go their separate ways; you hike down the cliff with Markie. It takes the larger portion of an hour to reach your tunnel. You step inside.

"Let's turn our lights on," Markie says quietly.

You both tell your suits to turn your on your light attachments. Yours flickers for a moment before shooting a cone of light from your chest compartment.

The two of you proceed through the cave. On the Head-Up Display (HUD) of your suit, you can see the heartbeat monitors of everyone in your squad. You see that yours is going a little faster than normal and, knowing that everyone else can see that, you feel a little embarrassed.

You proceed through the cave.

"These caverns are massive. This one seems to just go on and on."

1.[["What do you think made them?"]]

"Yeah, thanks," he says before heading out the other sickbay door. You step outside to find Salvucci loading his pistol.
"Better to be safe than sorry. Do you have your pistol?"

You nod.

"Good. Hopefully we won't need it."

The two of you walk down the hallway. Salvucci appears to be deep in thought, distracted from his surroundings.

1.	[["It's not your fault, y' know."]]
2.	[["You okay, cap?"]]

incoming: "We put that thing down. Once and for all."
text: "With what? Pistol rounds ain't gonna put that motherfucker down, Zoe."\n\n1.[["Let's lead it to the hanger."]]

The hail of bullets clip the tentacle above Meat. It falls to the floor, but the beast itself is unfazed. Meat scrambles over to you.

"We've got to go now!"

You look to Strauss. She's crying as she's pulled toward the monster's face.

You and Meat run past the monster. As you run, you see Strauss's face being pressed against all the jagged teeth in the thing's mouth. You're turning the corner in the hallway when you hear a sickening snap.

"Keep running! Don't look back!"

You both run until Meat, out of breath, stops. You fall to the ground, back against the wall.

"She didn't deserve to die like that," Meat says aloud. "I didn't fucking like her, but nobody deserves to go like that."

1.[["I had to choose."]]
2.[["She didn't."]]

incoming: "That's funny coming from the person who was more than ready to put her down a couple of hours ago."
text:
You see hurt flash across Strauss' eyes.

"Julia," Salvucci says sharply.

"No, it's okay," Strauss says. "They were friends, except your friend's dead, Julia. That thing out there isn't Markie anymore," she says turning away from you.

The two of them descend into uncomfortable silence; Strauss looking at her feet, Salvucci at the viewport. You feel awkward standing there, so you wander away.

1. [[Go to sleep.]]

"Oh," she says, clearly surprised. "Pardon my assumption."

The two of you approach the cockpit. You knock on the door.
Neil's muffled voice comes from beyond the door: "Password!?"

1.	[["Uhh..."]]
2.	[["42."]]
3.	[["Open the damn door."]]

incoming: "You and her are gonna get us all killed if you keep bickering."
text:
"Sorry," he says. "She's just getting on my nerves. I know she's had it rough. She and Ben were a thing, so she's on edge even more than usual, I guess."

The two of you enter the cafeteria and then, after taking a precautionary look around, you go into the kitchen and begin to stuff everything you can get your hands on into the two bags you brought from sickbay: fruit chips, soda, water bottles, pastries, canned soup.

When you've filled the bags, you leave the cafeteria and make your way to the common room. Strauss, Neil, and Salvucci are waiting. The common room is a circular room with a couch, several chairs, and a large wall-mounted monitor connected a server archive of countless movies, shows, and documentaries.  

On the back wall, there are portholes—just like on the ships of old that sailed the waters of Earth—where you can gaze into the dark of space.

"Run into any trouble?" Salvucci asks as you hand him the bag.

"Didn't see a damn thing," Meat says.

"I'm telling you," Strauss says, rubbing her bandaged arm, "we won't see it until it wants us to see it."

Meat grumbles something about paranoia and then heads over to the table, where Neil is setting up a checkers board.

"How's your arm, doctor?" Salvucci asks.

"Fine, captain. Thank you."

You feel tired.

What should you do?

1. [[Talk to Neil and Meat.]]
2. [[Take a nap.]]

"She's doing a hell of a job of it, then. Almost made me shit myself."

"Zoe! Neil! Anyone!" Your walkie comes to life; it's Strauss, her voice filled with panic.

You pull the walkie off your belt loop.

"Please help us!" Strauss cries. "The captain keeps shooting but it's not doin—oh god."

Neil looks at you in horror. You click the button on side the side of the talkie. You say:

1.[["Hang on! We're on the way."]]
2.[["That's what you get."]]

You squeeze the trigger twice. Each round hits, but it doesn't even faze him. Ben opens his mouth and a moan leaks out. All of his teeth are gone. This close, you can see that the iris of his remaining eye is yellow. You take aim again.
Salvucci, standing on his wounded leg, beats you and Meat to it.

The captain grabs Ben by the side of his face and throws him into the wall. The thing moans as it hits the floor. It's surprisingly quick to rise, but Salvucci already has the crowbar in his hand.

He grunts and brings the curved end down on the back of Ben's head hard. The thing crumbles and is hit again as it slowly lifts its head. Red and yellow matter splatter the wall—little squirts at first, but they grow larger once the back of the skull caves in and brain matter flies. 

Salvucci drops the crowbar after the fifth hit and falls back onto the floor, out of breath.

Meat approaches the beast. It slowly sticks its hand out toward him, fingers crawling across the floor like a wounded spider. Meat raises his boot above the monster's head and stomps. Once. Twice. 

Ben convulses. He goes still after the third impact. Meat steps past the body and helps Salvucci to his feet.

"Holy shit, cap," Neil says, looking at the leg wound. 

"I'll brush it off," Salvucci says, limping to the door. He bangs his fist against it twice.

"Doctor, it's the captain. Everything is safe out here. Open up."

A moment passes and then the door slides open. Strauss steps out and, seeing Ben's corpse, puts her hand over her mouth to cover a gasp. You see her eyes water. She quickly turns her attention to Salvucci.

"No worse for wear," he says looking at the hole beneath his knee. She backs away from Salvucci. "No," she utters, "no."

"We have to take that leg off now," Meat says.

"You know that's not going to do any good," Strauss fires back.

"Are you just a fucking heartless bitch or what?" Meat yells.

"Travis, it's all right." Salvucci's expression is one of weary acceptance. "We both know what this bite means."

"There has got to be another way, captain."

"Yeah, yeah," Neil says. "We can put you in cryosleep or something."

"Even if it wasn't for the infection, this wound means I'm dead weight. You need to cut me lose. Burn what's left."

"No," Meat says firmly. He shakes his head defiantly. "We're not doing that."

"That's an order, Travis."

"I fucking said no!"

You barely have time to register that Strauss has taken the gun from your holster before the shot rings out. A brief spray of red. The captain falls like a tree. Blood gushes from his head. His lifeless, green eyes stare up at the ceiling.

A horrified moment of silence passes as everyone stares at the body. Strauss drops your gun to the floor, and everyone turns to her.

1.[["You monster."]]
2. [[Kill her.]]

incoming: Leave Meat to die and save yourself.
text:
It's a hard choice, but in the end, you get to your feet and sprint past the monster as it slaughters Meat. You can hear his screams as you run down the hall. Soon things are mercifully silent. 

You climb up into the ventilation and decide to make your base of operations there. You're a survivor, you tell yourself. All you have to do is stay alive two months. That's all.

You go, day by day, into the ship in search of supplies. You often go to the mess hall to stock up on food and bring it back to the vents. You run into creature twice. Each time it's grown bigger, nastier. The first time, you get away without a scratch.

The second time, a tentacle pierces your ankle. You still manage to hop away, but you can't climb into the vent because of your injury. You seek refuge in the darkness of the barracks. Soon every breath brings pain. You refuse to accept the hand you've been dealt, even when Strauss, purple-faced, sits down beside you to have a chat.

"You had a good run, idiot," she says. 

1.[["You're not even real."]]

"Meet us at the center of the crater!" Markie yells over the comm.

You look at Ryan's heart monitor; he's about to flatline. 

That's when you hear it: the roar from the black.

You have a single bullet left.

1. [[Shoot the beast.]]
2. [[Put Ryan out of his misery.]]
3. [[Run!]]

incoming: "She was infected; she killed Meat and then killed herself."
text:
"God," Salvucci says, holstering his pistol.

"And then there were three," Neil says, looking at Meat's corpse. "Sorry buddy."

"We're probably infected too," Salvucci says quietfully.

"But there's been no symptoms yet."

"What if they never show up until years later? When we're back on Mars."

"Then a doctor could take care of us or something, man."

You see Salvucci slowly reach for his pistol. "I can't take that risk. If our survival puts the human race in danger."

"Cap," Neil says, backing into the wall. "Think straight here."

"I'm sorry, Neil. I'm sure Julia agrees."

1. [[Die.]]
2. [[Don't die yet.]]

Neil nods at you one last time. You make your way to the vent where Meat has just finished prying off the cover. The gas is thick in the air, making you slightly dizzy.

"Tight fit," he says. "I'll go first so I can remove the next cover."

You look back to see that multiple tentacles have penetrated the door. Neil is pointing the pistol in the air and is breathing hard.

You force down the feeling of despair in your stomach and crawl through the vent. When you catch up to Meat, he's already kicking a cover.

"Almost got it!" With one last kick, the cover comes free. You emerge into the hallway just in time to feel the ship shake violently.

Meat slams his fist into the wall over and over. 

1. [[Comfort him by touching his shoulder.]]
2. [[Let him get it out of his system.]]

You never make your dislike of your daughter-in-law known, but she can sense it. You never become close.

You wake up one morning to find your wife cold on the kitchen floor. You get down on the floor and hold her corpse for hours before you finally dial the operator and tell the poor man on the other end that your wife is dead and you have no clue what to do. He takes your address and promises he'll send an ambulance.

They come. Your heart shatters when they zip her in a bag.

Later, weeks after the funeral, Meat comes to stay for a couple of weeks. He's bald and uses a cane because of a bum leg. You watch reruns of Friends 2041 and play chess. You talk of your loved ones and your children. Then, unexpectedly, he brings it up: "Do you ever think of them? The crew?"

1.[["Yes."]]
2.[["Never."]]
3.[["What's the use?"]]

You go four rounds. Neil wins two of them (rock over scissors each time). You with the other two times, with paper over rock.

You're about to start the fifth round when the second door to sickbay opens, and Meat and Salvucci step inside; both men were dark expressions.

"I'm guessing your hunt was uneventful?" Strauss says.

"Yeah, go on and rub it in then," Meat says, turning to rifle through the medical cabinets.

"What are you looking for?"

"Food."

"This is a medical facility, you fool. What makes you think there's food in here?"

Meat opens one of the lower cabinets and, after a moment, pulls out a large bag of apricot chips.

"Your assistant told me about his stash a while back."

"I'm glad you can eat his food while his remains are in the same room as you."

"Not like he's going to need them," Meat says with a shrug.

"Enough you two," Salvucci barks. "Pilot, you alright?"

"Yeah, I'm fine, captain. Thanks for asking."

"Did you three see anything?"

"No," Strauss says.

1.[["Where on the ship did you look?"]]
2.[["Did it leave a trail?"]]

"What do you think it is you found on Earth?" Salvucci says, changing the subject. Your reassurance seems to have made him more focused.

1.[["Yog-Sothoth?"]]
2.[["Not a damn clue."]]

"I'm a fan of anything that doesn't include the possibility of us getting sucked out into space."

"We just might catch the whole ship on fire is all,"  Salvucci says.

"Not if we do it right. We need to trap it in sickbay, where the extra cryopod is."

"Isn't that one broken?" Meat says.

"Yeah, which is perfect for us."

"I thought we were going to use fire?"

"We are. Just...just trust me, okay?"

Salvucci nods. "Okay, doctor. What do we need to do?"

"Give me your gun. I'm gonna run ahead and try and get it to follow."

"That's insane!" Meat yelled.

"It'll track me. You guys follow behind at a distance and when you get there, you do exactly as I say, okay?"

Salvucci hands her his pistol. "Stay safe," he says.

She nods. She goes to the door. "Doc," Meat says. 

She turns, hand on the door.

"Be careful, okay?"

"Thanks."

1.[["Don't get yourself killed, doc."]]
2.[["Save a round for yourself...just in case."]]

The mess hall is rather small: two tables next to an enclosed kitchen. You find Meat sitting by himself, shoveling ramen into his mouth. A plastic cup filled with cheap whiskey is next to his arm. You grab your favorite snack, a box of soy oatmeal cookies, from the paltry pantry and take a seat.

Meat looks up at you, eyes red, a weary expression.

"Hell of a day, huh? Poor Ryan. How's Markie?"

1.[["Strauss is removing her arm."]]
2.[["Not great."]]

When you get inside your house, you finally allow yourself to break down and cry. For the dead, for you, for Strauss.

It takes years for you to come to terms with the fact that you're alive. You see a therapist to help you cope with the nightmares and PTSD episodes. You are reassigned to a boring job as an analyst, an occupation you're fine with. You never marry, though you do have a series of healthy relationships with their ups and downs.

Twenty years later, Strauss sends you an email out of the blue; "I'm sorry" is all it says. The next morning the local news reports the suicide of a renowneddoctor. You turn off the TV before the anchor says her name. Though you never really talked after the Speedwell incident, you can't help but feel that your universe is a little smaller without Dr. Lenore Strauss in it.

You are now alone.

The End

"Dead," he says. "All thanks to you. We're alive and going home."

He looks away. "But...."

1.[["What is it, Travis?"]]

"The whole enchileda. But look at it this way: you get a cool robo foot now! And some fingers too! And we're all gonna get citations after this at the very least."

1.[["Except for the dead."]]
2.[["I better get a lot more than a citation for my goddamn foot."]]

Strauss closes her eyes and momentarily bites her lip. "I'm a coward."

Salvucci holsters his gun. "There's nothing you could have done, doctor. Let's go."

Strauss looks up, her remorse stowed away or perhaps an illusion. "What about the creature?"

"Meat's burning the bodies."

Her eyes widen. "Why the everliving hell is that lumbering mountain of idiocy doing such a thing?"

"He thinks they might come back."

"That fucking idiot! We don't know how that infection works. It could be twice as deadly as an airborne virus. I need those bodies intact. Call him! Stop him!"

Salvucci's face goes pale. "I don't have a walkie."

"Run," she says.

And you do. As fast as you can. Inside sickbay you find Meat, sitting down on the floor, staring at where the bodies should be, but instead there's only a lot of blood and some meaty chunks.

An oil can, a bottle, and a rag are next to Meat.
"Where are they?"  Strauss demands. "The bodies? Where are they?"

"Oh good. You're alive," Meat says. You can feel the force of his eyeroll from here.

"Where are the bodies? Did you burn them?"

"No, doctor. As you would have gathered from the lack of smoke if you weren't a nutjob, I have not burned a damn thing. I came back and they were gone."

Strauss approaches Meat, gets in his face. "Well did they just fucking get up and walk off?"

He yells back. "I don't know!"

"Everyone relax," Salvucci says, voice raised.  Meat and Strauss calm down, both refusing to look at the other, both saying nothing.

"We've got two missing bodies, possibly infected and mutated into hostile lifeforms." Salvucci rubs his forehead. "I need thoughts, suggestions, anything. Where should we go from here?"  He turns to you first. 

1.[["We should check on Neil."]]
2.[["Let's go hunting."]]

incoming: Go ahead and shoot the switch.
text:
Meat fires. Strauss' head falls back and her limbs go limp. Markie turns to see all of you. She growls and drops Strauss.

That's when you fire a single shot at the control panel. Upon impact, the door seperating the hanger from the rest of the ship comes down, dividing you from the hanger. Alarms blare. You watch through the door's window as both Strauss' corpse and the creature are sucked out into space. The two forms drift away until they're dots, inseparable from distant stars.

None of you give a cheer or breathe a sigh of relief, however. There's a sense of shame that hangs over all of you, an awareness of your cowardice. You played it safe so that one of your crewmates could sacrafice herself.

The auto-close kicks in and the hanger door shuts itself. The alarms cease their cries.

"We should go check Neil's console," Meat says.

The three of you silently make your way to the cockpit. Inside, you find the autopilot already engaged. The console is covered in blood; the pilot's headless corpse is behind it.

"He knew he wasn't going to make it," Meat says bitterly. "Setting the autopilot must have been the last thing he did. Another goddamn hero."

"Everyone who died here will be honored when we get home," Salvucci says. 

"Oh good, because medals were really what I was concerned about," Meat says. "I'm gonna go check the rest of the ship make sure nothing will snack on us while we sleep."

"I'll go with you," Salvucci says. "Zoe, go make sure the cryopods are ready."

1.[[Go ready the pods.]]

Her lip twitches. 

"Yes, I am fucking taking off her arm because it's required by protocol. So get out of here so I can do my fucking job. Thanks."

She turns away from you to get to work. Ben looks from you to her without saying anything. He turns back to the tablet in his hands.

1.[["I am so close to shoving that saw up your ass."]]
2. [[Say nothing. Leave.]]

Meat turns away without a word. He leaves through the other sickbay door.

You step outside to find Salvucci loading his pistol.

"Better to be safe than sorry. Do you have your pistol?"

You nod.

"Good. Hopefully we won't need it."

The two of you walk down the hallway. Salvucci appears to be deep in thought.

1.[["It ain't your fault."]]
2.[["Why the long face, cap?"]]

"Good question. Doctor?" Salvucci says, turning to Strauss. 

She's red in the face, clearly panicked.

"There's no way to know we're infected until we start seeing symptoms."

"Which would be..."

"I don't know, Travis. From our brief experience with Markie's transformation, I would be inclined to say that we would drop to the floor and start babbling nonsense while our bodies decayed...but she was bitten. If there was an airbone virus when that blob exploded, our transformations could be much more subtle. There's no way to know until whatever happens, happens."

"A comforting thought," Neil says.

"The best thing we can do right now is just wait. Maybe some of us get some shut eye and then rotate the guard."

"What are the guards looking out for, exactly?"

Strauss looks at Meat and takes a breath. "Symptoms. In case something goes wrong with one of the sleepers."

Salvucci nods. "We're all a bit tired. Meat, Julia, doctor, you three rest first. Neil and I will keep watch."

"Make sure not to turn into boogeymen," Neil says as the three of you head toward the barracks.

"If I do, I'll eat you first, little man," Meat answers.

1. [[Sleep in the barracks.]]

incoming: Go ready for the cryopods for the two of you.
text:
You head to the cryogenics room and boot up two pods. On the terminal, in the bottom left corner of the screen, a window of text catches your eye.

1.[[Read the text on the screen.]]
2.[[Finish programming the pods.]]

You watch as Neil turns to run to the kitchen. He's a foot away from the door when a grey tentacle shoots out of the body's back and impales him through the chest. It whirls him about and throws him through the kitchen door.

"Fuck it, run! Run!" Meat yells. He drops the rifle and runs into the kitchen. You aren't far behind, jumping over a low slash from the tentacle. Right before you step inside, you see another writhing tentacle erupt from her body.

You slam the door and turn around. Meat is looking over the bloody hole in Neil's chest. Blood is dripping from the corner of Neil's mouth. You hear another stretching sound follow by a splash outside. Another tentacle.

"Fuck me, fuck fuck fuck," Meat says, his voice dripping with guilt. "I'm so sorry."

Neil looks up at him. "Not your fault, big man. Wasn't fast enough..."

His wound looks deep.

He turns to you. "Zo...Zoe, come here."

You lean down.

"Cockpit. Computer login is..." he coughs up some blood. "login is ‘K-O-N-A-M-I. Got it?"

1.[["Shhh. I got it, Neil. Just rest."]]

"Well, we're about to put an end to that shit," Meat says as you approach the crew's quarters. You see large cables running through the doorway; they lead up the wall and into the ceiling.

Neil reaches up and runs his hand along the cables. He quickly pulls it back. "Augh! Fuck!"

"What is it?" Meat barks.

"Nothing," Neil says, regaining his composure. "Just fucking slime. Oh god, gag a maggot," he says. "This shit reeks." He holds his hand up to the light to reveal a goopy, transparent liquid.

"Hey, that looks a little bit like—"

"Don't you say it, Travis."

You examine the cables without touching them.

Meat takes a look as well. "Seems like a complicated operation."

"What, turning on the computer, starting a program, and plugging in some cables?"

Meat turns. "You didn't see how feral this thing was—not to mention she's missing a goddamn arm."

1.[["Could be Ben."]]

"Complete gibbersh, sounds like," Lenore says with cold detachment. "Move." 

She scoots past you and turns on the device in her hand. A hot laser point darts out about three inches from the top port of the device. Another line escapes the bottom port and swings around to connect to the top line.

"Cauterizing saw," she explains. "You might want to leave this to the professionals, girlie. It's going to get a little messy."

1.[["You're not really going to take her arm off, are you?"]]
2.[["The fuck is wrong with you?"]]
3. [[Say nothing. Leave.]]

'It's been in Neil's room. Somehow it's hooked up all his music to the PA system and is playing it. This is the third song."

You look over at Neil. He shrugs sheepishly. Strauss is glaring at him.

"The blasted beast is trying to draw us out," Salvucci says.

1.[["Guess we should go investigate, eh?"]]

"Guess it isn't much use wondering about it, huh?" He turns away from them, though you notice his eyes lingering on Strauss' corpse for a moment.

"God, I just want some sleep."

1.[["Let's sleep then."]]

"I like the sound of that!" Meat says, slapping your back.

"Hunt it with what, precisely? You shot it in the head, right?" Strauss says.

"Yeah."

"It got back up, right?"

"Yeah, but this time I'll make it stay dead."

"With fire? You ignorant ape, what if those bodies are toxic? What if we inhale a virus?"

"Doc, it's not that fucking hard. We set them on fire and then close the door. We lock it, don't enter it for the rest of the voyage home."

"This is a horrible plan."

"Well, doctor Strauss," Salvucci interjects, "do you have another plan in mind?"

She looks at the floor and then back at him. "No. I don't, in fact."

"Then you're not giving us much of a choice." 

"Should we split up to cover more ground?" Meat asks.

"No. I think we'll all stay together for this. Strength in numbers."

"Yes sir."

"Where should we hunt first, though?"

1.[["Let's head to the mess hall."]]
2.[["Let's head to the barracks."]]

You dive and grasp the rifle. It's in your hands when you see Markie twisting the knife in Ben's skull; the boy convulses.

You aim down the sights, but the captain beats you to it, his pistol planted against her temple. He fires. Brain, skull bits, and strands of hair blast across the light and onto the floor. The thing that was Markie topples over to the ground, blood spewing out of the nose and mouth as it giggles.

The red eyes roll around in her head like in a slot machine before settling on you.

"Buy two hypostims, get three free. Just come on down to the Couponia at Rylock's junction this Saturday—"

Salvucci puts another bullet in its face. Markie jerks and then stops moving completely.

Meat bends down to examine Ben. "He's dead," he says. The boy's face is a sea of blood and torn flesh. Half his eyeball has been pushed up through the socket.

A moment passes. Meat raises his gun and puts a round through Ben's head. You leap back in surprise.

1.[["What the hell was that for?"]]
2. [[Give Meat a chance to explain.]]

You and Jack adopt. Her name is Sarah, she's seven and has quite an imagination. Meat becomes her godfather. 

Sarah goes to college to become a writer.

You make enough money to retire. You grow old and stop shaving your legs because who gives a fuck? Jack's hair goes white first. Yours follows shortly. You decide not to get anti-aging treatments.

Sarah gets engaged to a pretty girl named Alexandria. You're not sure you approve of her.

1. [[Approve of Alex.]]
2. [[Disapprove of her.]]

incoming: "So if we can't burn its flesh off, what are we doing?"
text: "I'm getting there. The viewport windows are bulletproof, but enough acid might penetrate all the layers. All it takes is one crack on the outside layer."\n\n1.[["We space it?"]]

incoming: Risk your life to save Meat.
text:
The hail of bullets clip the tentacle above Meat. It falls to the floor, but the beast itself is unfazed. Meat scrambles over to you.

"We've got to go now."

You and Meat run past the monster. It swings a tentacle at you that comes close to taking off both your heads. The monster howls as you rush past it. 

You both run until Meat, out of breath, stops in a distant hallway. You fall to the ground, back against the wall.
You both take a breath.

"What happens now?"

1.[["We put that thing down. Hard."]]
2.[["I've got two bullets left."]]

"See?" Meat says. "Juila says he'll be fine too. He's a big boy."

"Idiot," Strauss says.

The four of you make your way to the mess hall. 

"Check everything," Salvucci orders. You check around the tables and near the entertainment closest while Meat looks around the kitchen. Salvucci keeps his eyes on the door. Strauss sits at a table away from everyone.

You find some soy raisin cookies and pocket them. No monsters, though.

Meat pokes his head out of the kitchen. "Nothing." He looks at all of you and shrugs his shoulders. "What now?"

As if to answer him, a loud shriek erupts from the vent hanging over you all.

"A GIFFTTTTT," Markie screams from the vent.

"Oh god," Strauss says, backing into the wall.

"Kill it," Salvucci says, raising his pistol. You, Meat, and Salvucci fire into the vent.

"Don't waste your ammo. Just a few shots," Meat yells.

You fire half of your clip and lower your weapon. The vent cover drops to the floor. Meat and Salvucci lower their guns as well.

"We got her, right?" Meat says.

"agiftagiftagiftagift," Markie answers from the vent.

"Fuck me."

"agiftagiftagiftAGIFTAGIFTAGIFT," she screams. At first, you're not sure what falls from the vent. You just see a small, almost circular object dropping through the air. When it hits the ground with a splat, you know what it is, but you can't bring yourself to look.

Strauss' screams confirm your fears. You finally look down; it's Neil's head. Both his eyes have been gouged out and there's a jagged line of flesh and muscle where he was decapitated.

"A GIFT!" Markie yells once more before you hear her scamper away further into the ducts.

"I told you," Strauss, the first to speak, says. "We should have sent someone to look after him.

Meat kicks over a table.

"I told you!" Strauss screams at him.

"Doctor, quiet," Salvucci barks. He lowers his voice. "We'll mourn later."

"If we fucking live that long," Meat says.

"We have to trap it," Strauss says suddenly. "I think it's pretty clear bullets aren't effective. We need to either space her or trap her in a tightly contained space and set that bitch on fire."

"Risky options," Salvucci says.

"For once, I'm in agreement with the good doctor. This thing is shrugging off bullets like their bug bites. Question is: burn it or space it?"

1. [[Space it.]]
2. [[Burn it.]]

"If it's not dead, we're fucked. All we got left is your pistol. I'm guessing you're down to two clips."

You pop the clip out of your pistol to show him it's the last one.

"Shit."

"We don't know if it's alive. If it is, we'll improvise."

"Great, I wonder who'll die next time thanks to our masterful improvisation abilities."

Strauss says nothing. 

A few minutes later you reach the cockpit door. Ben's body is still there, as are the burnt remains of the captain.

"Well, that's good, all things considered," says Meat. You notice that Strauss is deliberately looking away from Ben's smashed skull.

The three of you step into the cockpit. You slam the door behind you.

"Here's the computer."

You step over to the main console. A password screen greets you. You type in "KONAMI."

The screen changes to a selection of menus.

"There's the autopilot," says Strauss. She touches the screen and selects NEW AUSTIN.

"We done?" Meat asks.

"Yeah, I think we're set."

"Good."

All of you approach the door.

"Now let's get out of here before that fucking thing corn—" 

A tentacle sweeps through the door as soon as it opens and brushes all of you aside with a mighty swing. You all going flying across the room. You slam into the viewport, cracking the glass, and then fall to the floor. Looking up, you see the thing step into view: it's monstrous, with a greekly perfect human abdomen. 

The monster's face is distinctly unhuman with countless, slitted eyes glaring at you. The monster's mouth is a vortex of meat and sharp teeth. Four tentacles protrude from its back, each one moving like a rattlesnake.

"No!" you hear Strauss scream as one of the tentacles darts out and wraps itself around her neck.  It lifts her into the air and pulls her toward its master. You turn to look at Meat who's paralyzed with fear, watching one of the tentacles dance above him.

You reach for your pistol.

1. [[Save Meat.]]
2. [[Save Strauss.]]
3. [[Save yourself.]]

"I didn't have--" the impact from your fist sends her to the floor.

She starts to get back up, but Meat yanks her off her feet and slams her into the wall.

"Fuck!" she screams, blood across her lower lip. He wraps his hands around her throat.

She chokes and claws at his face in desperation. "Help me," she says, her eyes bulging out at you.

"You'd do the same to any of us, wouldn't you?" Meat shouts in her face.

"Travis...stop," Neil says.

"No, she'd kill us all if it worked to her advantage, Neil. I don't want someone like that behind us."

Strauss' face is getting red.

1.[["Let her go."]]
2. [[Look into her eyes as she dies.]]

Neil grabs a tablet from the counter and opens the Tic-Tac-Toe program that comes installed on every device. You play seven times and tie each time.

"This game is pretty dumb," he says.

You're about to start the eighth round when the second door to sickbay opens, and Meat and Salvucci step inside; both men wear dark expressions.

"I'm guessing your hunt was uneventful?" Strauss says.

"Yeah, go on and rub it in then," Meat says, turning to rifle through the medical cabinets.

"What are you looking for?"

"Food."

"This is a medical facility. What makes you think there's food in here?"

Meat opens one of the lower cabinets and, after a moment, pulls out a large bag of apricot chips.

"Your assistant told me about his stash a while back."

"I'm glad you can eat his food while his remains are in the same room as you."

"Not like he's going to need them," Meat says with a shrug.

"Enough you two," Salvucci barks. "Pilot, you all right?"

"Yeah, I'm fine, captain. Thanks for asking."

"Did you three see anything?"

"No," Strauss says.

1.[["Where on the ship did you look?"]]
2.[["Did it leave a trail?"]]

You make your way to the vent where Meat has just finished prying off the cover. The gas is thick in the air, making you slightly dizzy.

"Tight fit," he says. "I'll go first so I can remove the next cover."

Strauss follows Meat. You look back to see that multiple tentacles have penetrated the door. Neil is pointing the pistol in the air and is breathing hard.

You force down the feeling of despair in your stomach and crawl through the vent. When you catch up to Strauss and Meat, he's already kicking a cover.

"Almost got it!" With one last kick, the cover comes free. Meat grabs Strauss and pulls her through. You emerge into the hallway just in time to feel the ship shake violently. 

Meat slams his fist into the wall over and over. Strauss looks on sadly.

1. [[Touch his shoulder.]]
2. [[Do nothing.]]

You put a bullet in Strauss' leg. She falls to the ground screaming "No!"

The beast advances.

She turns, reaching toward you with an outstretched hand. "I don't want to die!"

You unload the rest of your clip into the viewport and press the button on the wall. The door comes down, separating you from Strauss and the monster. Through the window you watch the beast lift its massive foot above Strauss' head and then brings it down, snapping her neck.

The viewport finally shatters, sucking both the beast and Strauss' corpse into space. An alarm blares for a couple of seconds before the emergency panel closes over the viewport.

You breathe a sigh of relief. You're alive. You won.

Your body aches, but you have one last thing to do before you can enter the cryochamber. You don't know how to make a molotov cocktail, so you go around the ship in search of bodies. When you find them, if they have a skull, you stomp it in.

After you're done, you go to the cryoroom and ready one of the pods.It hisses as the hatch slides open. You get inside and close your eyes.

You're ready for this nightmare to be over.

When you awaken, you find yourself being assisted by a corporal. He takes you by the arm and guides you up from the pod. 

You're transported to a private room on the biggest military outpost in New Austin. You order steak and wine but find that you don't have an appetite. Some suits interview you. You answer all of their questions honestly, but then they show you security footage of you shooting Strauss.

"Explain," one of them, a beefy looking man with no hair, demands.

1.[["She had killed the captain. Karma."]]
2.[["I needed to ensure my survival. She was bait."]]
3.[["She was infected."]]

"Here's what we're going to do," Salvucci starts. 

The sudden discharge of your pistol cuts him off. The first two rounds shatter the quarantine glass. You approach the cube. 

Someone—-Meat perhaps?-—is shouting something, but it's too late. You're raising your gun, leveling it at Markie's head. She looks up at you, uncomprehending.

You fire once.  A mixture of red and yellow liquid spills out of the back of her head as her body crumples. The smell is excruciating. You gag. And that's when Meat smashes the butt of his rifle into your face.

You black out.

You wake up two months later in a cell where Salvucci, with a mixture of sympathy and disgust hiding behind his blue eyes, explains how they put you in cryo sleep for the rest of the journey home and how, now, you will be brought before a military tribunal for the murder of your fellow crewmember.

He refuses to listen when you try to explain your actions and offers you only one comfort before leaving: he hears your lawyer is pretty damn good.

And she is. She manages to convince the court that you committed, not murder, but manslaughter out of concern for your crew. You serve five years at Titan penitentiary. After beating the living piss out of the first person who tries to intimidate you, no one messes with you for the rest of your sentence.

Upon release, you became a jack of all trades, mostly those related to physical labor. The years pass. You work as a plumber,a construction worker, a repairwoman for Mal's Repair. The last one turns out to be the job you keep for most of your life. It's not what you dreamed of being, but it pays rent, groceries, and then some.

Eventually you get lonely and give Meat a call, hoping to reconcile. He's not there. You leave a message, but he never calls back. You have night terrors and imagine Markie's face, her yellow eyes, staring at you from beyond the darkness. 

When you were younger, you told yourself you'd never be a cat lady, so you become an alpaca lady instead. Most of your free time and extra money are dedicated to purchasing cute clothes for your robo-alpaca. You call her CiCi. You have lovely, one-sided conversations.

Finally, some fifty years after you killed Markie, you begin to feel life slip away from you. You're not sure if it's disease or depression or some form of universal comeuppance, but you let yourself go piece by piece. You're defiant all the way to the end. "I did the right thing," you mutter to yourself. "I saved lives." 

Soon you fall into eternal rest. You leave Cici to your younger sister, but she never comes for her.

                          The End

"Either way, we'll burn the corpses. Travis, take care of it."

"On it," Meat says, leaving you two alone.

"Come on, we'll head to the cockpit. See if we can figure out how to fly this thing."

If only it were that easy. You and Salvucci discover Neil's console locked.

"Did he ever tell you his password?"

1. [["No, he didn't."]]

"Fuck. All right, let's get her aboard."

You and Meat help Markie to the ship's elevator. Meat enters a combination on the keypad and the door slides open. Inside the elevator, as you ride up, all three of you remove your helmets. You notice for the first time that your face is drenched in sweat.

A ding. The door opens. Captain Jonas Salvucci, an older, muscular man with little patience for tomfoolery, awaits you—his hand wrapped around the pistol in his holster.
He takes his hand away from the gun when he sees there's no threat.

"Get her to sickbay."

You nod and help Markie through the hallway of the ship. Behind you, you can hear Salvucci interrogating Meat. "What happened to Ryan?"

"He's dead, cap. Something got him."

"Hell, Travis. What did you find down there?"

When you get to sickbay, both Lenore Strauss, the doctor, and her geeky assistant Ben are prepping the examination table.

"Where's she wounded?" Lenore asks, as you help a woozy Markie out of her suit.  You glare at Ben as he gawks at her well-toned body. He smiles sheepishly and looks away, cheeks burning red with shame. Markie's drenched in sweat; she stares around wildly while Lenore straps her in. She examines the bite; it's just above the elbow, an inflamed bulging of the skin.

"And I was young and we were running," Markie rambles, "eyes bouncing up and down the shore while the sun cooked the corpses of washed up jellyfish."

You turn to Lenore; she's prepping some kind of tool.

1.[["What's she saying?"]]
2.[["What is that?"]]

You fire several rounds as well, tearing off her other arm. Still, the body convulses. You watch as Neil turns to run to the kitchen. He's a foot away from the door when a grey tentacle shoots out of the body's back and impales him through the chest. It whirls him about and throws him through the kitchen door.

"Fuck it, run! Run!" Meat yells. He drops the rifle and runs into the kitchen. You aren't far behind, jumping over a low slash from the tentacle. Right before you step inside, you see another writhing tentacle erupt from her body.

You slam the door and turn around. Strauss and Meat are looking over the bloody hole in Neil's chest. Blood is dripping from the corner of Neil's mouth. You hear a stretching sound follow by a splash outside. Another tentacle.

"Fuck me, fuck fuck fuck," Meat says, his voice dripping with guilt. "I'm so sorry."

Neil looks up at him. "Not your fault, big man. Wasn't fast enough..."

"Stop talking, sweetie," Strauss says, taking you by surprise with the earnest care in her voice as she examines the wound. "An artery's been pierced."

"Shit, is there anything you can do for him?"

Strauss looks at you both, clearly not wanting to give her answer in front of Neil. You feel a tap on your arm. Neil looks up at you.

"Julia...Julia, come here."

You lean down.

"Cockpit. Computer login is..." he coughs up some blood. "login is ‘K-O-N-A-M-I.' Got it?"

1.[["Yeah, I got it."]]

"Did I hear some eagerness there?" He said, smiling wearily. "Come on. 

Let's get this over with." His smile disappears as you both hear footsteps—giant footsteps.

You retreat to the hanger.

"Shit," he says as the door slides shut behind you. "I thought this thing was bigger."

He's right: it's not much, and half the room is cramped by the reconnaissance droids.

"Loosen the holding clamps on those. I'll get our suits. Hurry, it can't be far behind us."

You deactivate the locks on the droids and catch the suit that Meat throws you. You're just about to put the helmet on when you hear the clanging on the door.

"Shit. It's here. When it gets in front of the droids, shoot the hanger switch, okay? And for fuck's sake, hold on to something."

1.	[["Stay safe."]]

You can't bring yourself to eat the body of your friend. Instead, you drag his corpse to the bunkroom and close him in so you don't have to look at or smell his corpse.

You're not far behind him. When it's time for you to go, you climb atop one of the tables and close your eyes. You wake up once, twice, but not the third time. Your sleep is endless.

The End

"Awesome, someone I can actually depend on," she says, shooting a dirty look at Ryan.

"The hell did I do?"

She ignores his question. "You two will take that hole over there."

"All right then," Meat says.

1.[["This is a bad idea."]]
2.[["Let's go."]]

"Very well," she says. She lifts the scalpel upward and pulls it across her throat. She gasps as blood streams down her neck. She falls to the floor and chokes.

You watch until she expires. You leave the room to find the captain and Neil in the barracks examining Meat's corpse.

They look at you. "Where's Strauss?" Salvucci demands. His gun is in his hand.

1.[["She was infected; she killed Meat and then killed herself."]]
2. [[Shoot the both of them.]]

Your confession damns you. You're court-martialed and found guilty of murder in the first degree. You're sentenced to life aboard Titan penitentiary. For you, life turns out to be three years.

When you refuse the courtship of one of the most powerful inmates in the penitentiary, she has one of her thugs stab you in your throat while you're taking a shower.

As the blood and suds and water swish all around you on the way to the drain, you look up at your nude attacker. On her calf, you see a tattoo of an angel and a demon dancing around a single word: "Karma."

You almost want to laugh. Almost.

The End

"He might come back, y'know?" Meat says. "Like a zombie."

"Stop talking," Salvucci says. "We need to find Strauss."

"If she isn't dead," Meat says grimly, eyes set on what's left of Ben's face.

1.	[["He said Markie chased her into the hall."]]
2.	[["Ben said Markie chased her into the hallway. She's probably dead."]]

"What's that? Oh, you're making a joke, aren't you? Hardly the time, Julia." He says, giving you a sharp look of disapproval. He sighs.

"Maybe Strauss will know what it is—if she's still alive."

1.	[["Don't talk like that."]]
2.	[["You're right. She's probably dead."]]

"Easy for you to say, Julia. You're not the one who's being served up as dinner."

Meat slaps Neil on the shoulder. "We won't let you get eaten, okay?"

"You're not making this any more appealing."

He takes a breath. "Okay, well, how are we going to do this?"

"We'll go to the cafeteria—big, open space."

You all make your way to the cafeteria, eyes watching the walls and vents. The journey is a safe one. 

All of you step into the cafeteria.

Neil looks out across the tables like a man looking at his own grave.

"I always thought lunchrooms were kind of scary when I was a kids, ‘cause of the bullies and all. Never thought I'd die in one, though."

"You'll be fine," Meat says. "We'll be in the other room. You're gonna stay in here and use your walkie."

"To do what?"

"Be bait. Make helpless noises."

"How's it gonna hear that?"

"Marki—what used to be Markie has a walkie clipped to her belt."

"And if she thinks it's a trap?"

"She won't." Meat says as you and he make your way to the kitchen door.

"I can't believe this shit," Neil says.

You and Meat step into the kitchen and move away from the door. He turns to you. "Make sure you have your gun ready, okay? I don't want Neil to get eaten because we ran dry."

You check your pistol to make sure it has a full clip and nod. You both listen to Neil in the other room. "Please help me," you hear him beg. "I can't find you guys."

This goes on for 20 whole minutes, Neil's acting growing steadily worse. "I fucking hurt my leg," he whimpers.

"He's clearly never taken a drama class," Meat says.

"Oh fuck," Neil says urgently.

1. [[Hand Meat the walkie.]]

"I know. It's my weight to bear, I suppose."

You sip your drinks without another word until it's time to go. The cabbie takes you home first.

"Zoe," Strauss says. "Take care, okay?"

1.[["Yeah. You too, doc."]]
2. [[Simply nod.]]

incoming: " Doctor Strauss is right; stop dicking around, Neil."
text:
"Right, well, can one of you humorless assholes bring me up to speed at least?"

1.[["Ben's dead now."]]
2.[["There are one, possibly two monsters crawling around the ship."]]

In the barracks, Meat flips on the lights and the three of you find your respective beds.

"Sleep tight, ladies," says Meat.

To your surprise, you find yourself drifting to sleep atop your bunk. Dreamless sleep covers your eyes. Briefly.

You awaken to the sound of choking. The first thing you see through blurred vision is a blood trail on the floor. You leap out of the bed and follow the trail out of the room to find Meat on the ground, neck slit. His eyes are watery as he grasps his throat.

"Strauss," he says. "Strauss." He nods toward the common room.

He closes his eyes and is gone forever.

You proceed to the common room. You open the door to find Strauss standing in the middle of the room, a bloody scalpel in her hand. Her back is to you.

"Zoe?" she says, not turning to face you.

1.[["What the hell did you do?"]]

"Space. You want to jettison the fucker. That's insane. He's slow though, so maybe it could work."

1.	[["What else are we going to do?"]]

"Everywhere," Meat says before swallowing a chip. 

"Engineering, the cafeteria, the cryo room. We checked every nook and cranny. My guess is they're in the vents."

"This is some fucked up shit," Neil says.

"Eloquent as always, pilot," Strauss snaps.

"We should move shop," Meat says after a moment. "This facility has two doors. I don't like that. Captain and I were talking; the common room is more safe and it's closer to the cafeteria. We can make supply runs."

"...while we, what? Wait for the creature to die?" Strauss asks.

"That's the plan. We stay safe, let it starve."

"And what if it can wait longer than us? What if that's part of the thing's plan, eh? Wait till we get sick and hungry enough for it to overpower us? Did you even bother thinking about the logistics of that move? Cryosleep is part of the ship's travel. We don't have enough food on board to support us until we reach Mars. We have maybe a month at the most before we run out. Then what?"

"I don't know, okay? I hear a lot of criticism but I don't hear you contributing anything else, doctor."

Strauss scowled. "That's because I'm trying to prevent you from leading us into a disaster."

"Can it, the both of you," Salvucci commands. "Meat's right as far as safety precautions go. The common room will be easier to fortify and protect than this place. We can worry about long term plans once we get set up there. Doc, you and Neil grab whatever supplies you think we might need from in here. Travis, you and Julia make a trip to the cafeteria, bag some grub, meet us in the common room. Be. Careful."

"Yeah, boss. Got it," Meat says. "Come on, Julia."

The two of you leave as Strauss, Neil, and Salvucci retrieve medical supplies.	

"You and the captain should have put a round in her when you found her," Meat says as you walk toward the cafeteria.

1.[["Not funny."]]
2.[["Your bickering is going to get us killed."]]
3.[["It was tempting."]]

"Well, good for you then," she says in a bitter tone.

The two of you approach the cockpit. You knock on the door.
Neil's muffled voice comes from beyond the door: "Password?"

1.[["Open the door, numbnuts."]]
2.[["Oedipa."]]

You place your head against his neck. You hear the pumping of an artery. You smell blood. 

You turn and savagely rip into his neck with a sickening bite. Meat's scream becomes a gurgle as you pull away, ripping away the skin and his cartoid.

He stumbles away you hand pressed agaisnt his neck, but it's no good. He trips over a cable and falls back onto the floor.

He reaches toward you but then drops his arm. He's dead.

Now, the voice says, the other two.

1. [[Search for Neil.]]

"Yes," he says, wiping his forehand with the back of his hand. "Yes, it was. Thanks."

You both take a breath.

"What now?"

1.[["Kill or be killed."]]
2.[["I've got at least two bullets left."]]

incoming: Absentmindedly kick rocks while you wait for someone to answer.
text:
"Ryan, let Captain Salvucci know what we've found. Let's try and get a pick up at the LZ in two hours."

"Aye."

"That thing loaded, Meat?"

"Duh."

"Okay, I'm thinking we should split up to cover more ground. How should we do this?"

1.[["I'm with Ryan."]]
2.[["I'm with Markie."]]
3.[["I'm with Meat."]]

You grab the saw. Markie's about to leap atop you when you swing the heated blade into her right foot, removing it from the rest of her body. She topples back as the leg stump turns into a geyesr of black blood. You throw the saw at her face, blinding her with heat.

"Put her in the chamber!" Strauss roars, pointing with her free hand at the cryochamber in the corner of the room. Meat and the captain are quick, grabbing the creature by its arm while it flails about. They pull it by the rotting arm to the chamber quickly. The pod hisses as it opens. Markie snaps at them, tries to attack with her claw but she can't get a shot in. She shrieks as Meat and Salvucci heave her into the pod.

You smash the pod's panel with your fist and the chamber closes. You can hear Markie's muffeled screams from within. 

She starts to smack the door with her claw; cracks appear in the glass.

"Whatever you're doing do it fast, doc." Meat says, aiming his rifle at the pod.

"Put your gun down and take this," she says, passing off the hose from the machine. Meat takes it. "Now, plug it into the port at the bottom of the pod. Hurry! And make sure it's plugged in tight."

Another crack in the glass. Meat takes the hose and screws it into the pod's hole.

"Let go!"

Meat backs away from the hose. Strauss presses several buttons on the machine.

"What is that?" Salvucci says.

"It's the incinerator," she says, slamming her palm down on one last button. You hear the roar of the flames as they pass through the hose and into the chamber itself. The inside of the pod lights up as Markie's screams become even louder. 

Markie beats against the glass harder with her claw, but it's useless. Within minutes, the creature's been vaporized.

For a moment, no one says anything. And then, just as you're all about to take a breath, in stumbles what was once Ben. The monster, missing both its eyeballs, gurgles as it reaches toward you with rotting hands.

1.[[Blast Ben.]]

"He might come back, y'know?" Meat says. "Like a zombie."

"Stop talking," Salvucci says. "We need to find Strauss."

"If she isn't dead," Meat says grimly, eyes set on what's left of Ben's face.

1.[["Ben said she was chased into the hallway."]]

incoming: "Hey! Focus. I need you here. We can stew in our guilt later, got that?"
text:
He stops punching the wall after a while. Blood drips from his fingers.

"He's dead because of us."

1.[["Yeah, well, let's make sure he died for something worth dying for."]]
2.[["Get your head in the fucking game."]]

"Right. Sorry, Julia."

"Andattheboardwalkifound..." A shiver runs up your spine.

"Uh...what was that?"

You raise your pistol up in front of you. You see nothing.

"Was that Mar--HOLY SHIT!"

You feel Neil scramble up your leg. You turn to see Markie, her face slowly melting on Neil's pants leg.

"Oh shit oh shit oh shit."

Neil's head is in the way. You can't get a clear shot.

1. [[Take the shot anyway.]]
2. [[Lunge at Markie.]]

You unholster your pistol. You hear it again: scuttling, and then something else--a high pitched whine that sends a shiver down your spine.

"We're not alone," Meat says, voice low.

"What's that?" you hear Ryan say over your comm.

"There's something in here with us. We're turning back."

Meat nods at you and you both slowly back away.

"What do you see, Meat?" Markie asks.

"Dunno. Don't like it whatever it is." 

The whine again. You focus your eyes and see something moving in the dark.

Meat sees it, too. He fires at it. As muzzle flash fills the cave with brief spells of light you see that the creature isn't one thing, but many things, with feelers and sharp teeth.

They rush toward you, hundreds of them.

"Let's get out of here!" Meat yells.

1.[[Shoot them.]]
2.[[Run away.]]

"Everything will be fine," Markie says.

The groups go their separate ways; you hike down the cliff with Markie. It takes the larger portion of an hour to reach your tunnel. You step inside.

"Let's turn our lights on," Markie says quietly.

You both tell your suits to turn your on your light attachments. Yours flickers for a moment before shooting a cone of light from your chest compartment.

The two of you proceed through the cave. On the Head-Up Display (HUD) of your suit, you can see the heartbeat monitors of everyone in your squad. You see that yours is going a little faster than normal and, knowing that everyone else can see that, you feel a little embarrassed.

You proceed through the cave.

"These caverns are massive. This one seems to just go on and on."

1.[["What do you think made them?"]]

"Are you serious?!" he yells, hands clutching her throat still. She throws a weak punch at his arm. "She killed him; she'll kill us, too."

"Dude, just...stop. We'll tell the authorities what she did when we get back."

Meat considers this and then lets go of Strauss. She gasps for air. "Insane...idiot!"

"You shut your damn mouth. I'm a second away from adding your body to the pile."

Meat sets down his backpack and opens it up, pulling out the glass bottle, rag, and oil can.  He gets to work as Strauss stumbles over to join you and Neil.

"Thanks," she says, not turning to face you.

1.[["Don't you say a goddamn word to me."]]
2.[["I really should have let him kill you."]]
3.[["Yeah. Don't mention it. Really."]]

incoming: Send somebody to check on Neil.
text:
"I'll go," Strauss says. "Anything to get away from this moron."

"Be careful, sweetheart," says Meat. "It'd be a shame for you to get your face bitten off."

"Here. Take this." Salvucci hands her his pistol. She nearly drops it.

"Thanks captain."

"Be careful."

Without another word, she disappears around the corner.

1. [[Keep on in the direction of the mess hall.]]

Meat takes the walkie. "Neil?"

"She's fucking here, guys. Oh god she reeks."

"Sit tight," Meat says. He nods at you. Both of you creep to the door. Meat pushes it open slightly and peers out. You look out as well.

Neil is backing into a wall, face red and dripping with sweat. Several feet away is Markie. You can smell her from here, but that's not what's making you struggle not to gag. Her face is a jagged piece of flesh hanging from her skull, her sockets void of eyeballs.

"Stay away from me," Neil begs.

It lumbers toward the pilot, groaning. Several teeth fall to the ground in a mixture of salvia and blood.

"Now," Meat says.

The two of you emerge from the kitchen. Markie doesn't even have time to turn her head before machinegun fire rips the neck from her body and her head tumbles to the floor, smashing to the ground like a pumpkin.

Meat opens his mouth to let loose a witty remark, but vomit emerges. You're not far behind, the smell finally having gotten the best of you. Luckily, there's not much for you and your partner to barf up.

"Oh godfuckingshit," Neil yells. "That was Markie." He takes a step closer to the body, his arm over his nose. "So, we like win now, right? They're all dead?"

"Yeah, I think—"

Meat is cut off by the sound of Markie's hand slapping the floor as the body convulses, pus and blood shooting from the decimated neck stump. He fires the rest of the clip into the corpse.

1. [[Shoot her!]]
2. [[Run into the kitchen!]]

The hail of bullets clip the tentacle above Meat. It falls to the floor, but the beast itself is unfazed. Meat scrambles over to you.

"We've got to go now."

You and Meat run past the monster. It swings a tentacle at you that comes close to taking off both your heads. The monster howls as you rush past it. 

You both run until Meat, out of breath, stops in a distant hallway. You fall to the ground, back against the wall.
You both take a breath.

"What happens now?"

1.[["We put that thing down. Once and for all."]]
2.[["Well...I've got two bullets. So there's that."]]

incoming: "Any ideas how to beat that thing?"
text:
"One, but we have to act quickly. Let's go to sickbay."

You follow her. When you get there, she tells you to lock both doors leading into the unit. You do so.

"How many rounds do you have left?" she asks as she pulls out a small brush and a flask of a yellow sticky substance."

You hand her the clip.

"Okay, good, there's enough here."

You watch her get to work. She ejects each bullet from the clip and then sticks her brush carefully inside the flask. Pulling the brush from the flask, she coats each bullet with some of the goo.

1.[["What are you doing?"]]

"Yes," he says, wiping his forehand with the back of his hand. "I know. For what it's worth, I really appreciate it."

You both take a breath.

"What now?"

1.[["We kill it."]]
2.[["I've got at least two rounds left."]]

incoming: "I think so...but I couldn't tell for sure."
text:
"Either way, we'll burn the corpses. Travis, take care of it."

"On it," Meat says, leaving you two alone.

"Come on, we'll head to the cockpit. See if we can figure out how to fly this thing."

If only it were that easy. You and Salvucci discover Neil's console locked.

"Did he ever tell you his password?"

1. [["He didn't."]]

She looks at you, tears in her eyes, and says "I just want to sleep."

She gets into her pod without another word. The hatch closes over her. You get in yours and close your eyes as the hatch seals. Sleep follows.

When you awaken, you find yourself being assisted by a corporal. He takes you by the arm and guides you up from the pod. 

Both you and Strauss are transported to private rooms on the biggest military outpost in New Texas. You order steak and wine but find that you don't have an appetite. Some suits interview you and, after you answer every question, you're told that you'll be allowed to leave soon.

"Soon" turns out to be three days. You and Strauss meet on the base. She seems paler and thinner.

"Can we get a drink?" she asks. "I just want to go somewhere, anywhere but home first."

1. [[Get a drink with Strauss]]
2. [[Opt to go home.]]

No sense in delaying the inevitable, you suppose.

You press the gun against your temple and pull the trigger. You lifeless body collapses onto the floor to join the others.

Your ship drifts through space for nearly three weeks until it finally collides with an asteroid and explodes, vaporizing your corpses.

The End

"Yeah, thanks," he says before heading out the other sickbay door. You step outside to find Salvucci loading his pistol.

"Better to be safe than sorry. Do you have your pistol?"

You nod.

"Good. Hopefully we won't need it."

The two of you walk down the hallway. Salvucci appears to be deep in thought.

1.[["It ain't your fault."]]
2.[["Why the long face, cap?"]]

incoming: "Fuck. Guess the old man was right."
text:
He sighs. "I know. I'll, just, god..god damn it, just give me a second to set a course for the sun."

You watch as he presses some buttons on the console and turns to you.

"So, how do you want to do thi--" he's only begun to show fear when you shoot him in the face. He flops to the floor. You carefully step past him and look out into the darkness of space.

You realize the few loved ones you have at home will never know what happened to you. You will die a mystery.

You put the gun to your temple and pull the trigger.

Several month later, the Speedwell tries to fly into the heart of the sun but is vaporized.

The End

"Blowing it to smithereens. Higher-ups decided it was already a husk of a planet anyway. A fleet's heading there now; they're gonna bombard it until it's nothing but dust. Can you imagine that? Where our ancestors came from...just gone? It doesn't feel right."

1.[["No, it doesn't."]]
2.[["Nothing to be done about it, I guess."]]

incoming: "I needed to ensure my survival. I had to use her as bait."
text:
Your confession damns you. You're court-martialed and found guilty of murder in the first degree. You're sentenced to life aboard Titan penitentiary.

You live within the walls of this fine establishment for 63 more years. You learn to live without dignity and eventually, after a decade of abuse from both your inmates and the guards, earn your own amount of respect. An inmate doesn't like the way you look at her. She attacks you. You snap her neck.

No one messes with you anymore.

You spend the rest of your days caring for the community garden and reading literature in the library. No one comes to see you, which is fine. You've made it this far without people. You thrive in loneliness. At least, that's what you tell yourself.

One morning your cellmate, Lucca, tries wake you up only to find that you're not breathing. You're cold to the touch. "She's dead," she yells at a nearby guard. "This bitch is dead!"

The End

He gives a good natured smile, says "Just wanted to make sure. You looked troubled."

"Stop trying to hit that, Ryan. It's not gonna happen," says Markie, the Speedwell's science officer.

Ryan waves his hand dismissively.

The enforcer of the group, Meat, chuckles. "She told you."

1.[[Nudge Markie and give her a wink of gratitude.]]
2.[[Say nothing.]]

But he doesn't. "Doctor Strauss left me here, and...and Markie chased her into the hallway. I can't believe she left me."

Before you can say a word, something SLAMS into you, knocking you and the rifle across the floor. You look up. The rifle's light shines on Markie as she sits atop of Ben, a scalpel in her hand.  She's giggling like a hyena. You can only see the side of her face but you know that your friend is gone. Blood and grime are dripping off her body, and her skin is peeling.

As if to remove all trace of doubt, the creature inside your friend speaks. "Now now teacher's pet, no one likes a suck-up!"

"The hell?!" Meat roars.

The thing slams the scalpel into Ben's face, sinking the blade into his right eyeball.

1. [[Rush her.]]
2. [[Scream in terror.]]

He changes the subject. "What do you think it is you found on Earth?" Salvucci says. Your reassurance seems to have made him more focused.

1.[["Cthulhu?"]]
2.[["No clue."]]

You watch as Meat staggers out of the bar, hoping he calls a cab. You wait a ten more minutes to avoid any awkward post-goodbyes and then stumble outside yourself.

A cab picks you up and takes you to your little house in the Martian suburbs.  You pay the cabbie and walk past your box—you'll get the mail later—and inside your home.

The door slides shut. And that's when you fall apart. You crumble to the floor and bawl yourself to sleep. You wake up in the night only to cry yourself asleep again.

When you wake up, you want to believe it's a new day but you can still feel the weight of the dead on your shoulders. It's a weight you never learn to shake completely , but you grow accustomed to it: the night terrors, the sudden flashes of Ben dying in agony.

Meat's friendship and an ungodly amount of therapy helps you get through the trauma, as does Melissa, the woman who becomes your wife. The military sticks you with an analyst position, something you're quite fine with, though it is boring work.

You grow older. Melissa talks about having kids.

1. [[Have kids.]]
2. [[Don't have kids.]]

"This is a bad horror movie," Ben moans, staring into the glass while Markie gazes at her own cauterized stump. She's drooling now and has a nosebleed. You can see black veins popping beneath the skin on her forehead.

"Enough," Salvucci says at last. "We're not killing anyone on my ship—we're not savages."

Meat seems relived. "Thanks, boss."

"This is a mistake," Strauss says.

"Maybe," he says, "but it's my mistake to make, not yours. Do what you can to keep her alive and prep her for cryo sleep."

"Again, a mistake."

"Dr. Strauss, unless you want to be brought before a military tribunal for insubordination, I suggest you do as I say.

"Yes, captain," she says, voice calm, but there's a fire in her eyes. "Ben, lower the temperature to 15 degrees Fahrenheit. We'll try to freeze her."

Markie looks up at you all. A smile breaks out over her face and then she leans over and pukes.

"Disgusting creature," Strauss mutters.

"Travis, Julia, to the cockpit," Salvucci says.

1. [[Go to the cockpit.]]

"I like the sound of that!" Meat says, slapping your back.

"Hunt it with what, precisely? You shot it in the head, right?" Strauss says.

"Yeah."

"It got back up, right?"

"Yeah, but this time I'll make it stay dead."

"With fire? You ignorant ape, what if those bodies are toxic? What if we inhale viruses?"

"Doc, it's not that fucking hard. We set them on fire and then close the door. We lock the room, don't enter it for the rest of the voyage home."

"This is a horrible plan."

"Well, doctor Strauss," Salvucci interjects, "do you have another plan in mind?"

She looks at the floor and then back at him. "No. I don't, in fact."

"Then you're not giving us much of a choice." 

"Should we split up to cover more ground?" Meat asks.

"No. I think we'll all stay together for this. Strength in numbers."

"Yes sir."

"Where should we hunt first, though?"

1. [[Mess hall]]
2. [[Barracks]]

You watch as Neil turns to run to the kitchen. He's a foot away from the door when a grey tentacle shoots out of the body's back and impales him through the chest. It whirls him about and throws him through the kitchen door.

"Fuck it, run! Run!" Meat yells. He drops the rifle and runs into the kitchen. You aren't far behind, jumping over a low slash from the tentacle. Right before you step inside, you see another writhing tentacle erupt from her body.

You slam the door and turn around. Strauss and Meat are looking over the bloody hole in Neil's chest. Blood is dripping from the corner of Neil's mouth. You hear another stretching sound follow by a splash outside. Another tentacle.

"Fuck me, fuck fuck fuck," Meat says, his voice dripping with guilt. "I'm so sorry."

Neil looks up at him. "Not your fault, big man. Wasn't fast enough..."

"Stop talking, sweetie," Strauss says, taking you by surprise with the earnest care in her voice as she examines the wound. "An artery's been pierced."

"Shit, is there anything you can do for him?"

Strauss looks at you both, clearly not wanting to give her answer in front of Neil. You feel a tap on your arm. Neil looks up at you.

"Zoe, come here."

You lean down.

"Cockpit. Computer login is..." he coughs up some blood. "login is ‘K-O-N-A-M-I. Got it?"

1.[["Yeah. I understand."]]

"I'm a fan of anything that doesn't include the possibility of us getting sucked out into space."

"We just might catch the whole ship on fire is all,"  Salvucci says.

"Not if we do it right. We need to trap it in sickbay, where the extra cryopod is."

"Isn't that one broken?" Meat  asks.

"Yeah, which is perfect for us."

"I thought we were going to use fire?"

"We are. Just...just trust me, okay?"

 Salvucci nods. "Okay, doctor. What do we need to do."

"Give me your gun. I'm gonna run ahead and try and get it to follow."

"That's insane!" Meat yells

"It's already established I'm the weakest out of all of us. It'll track me. You guys follow behind at a distance and when you get there, you do exactly as I say, okay?"

Salvucci hands her his pistol. "Stay safe," he says.

She nods. She goes to the door. "Doc," Meat says. She turns, hand on the door.

"Be careful, okay?"

"Thanks."

1.[["Don't get killed."]]
2.[["Keep one bullet in the chamber for yourself...just in case."]]

"No," she says, turning away from you. "But it is."

You turn just in time to make out the tentacle that rends your head from your body.

The last sound you hear is the beast roaring with satisfaction.

The End

You slide into your chamber and the hatch closes. You quickly fall into slumber. When you wake up, you're surounded by soldiers. One of them, a corporal, is saying something but his words are soundless. He takes you by the arm and guides you up from the pod.

From there, you, the captain, and Meat are transported to the military outpost in New Austin. All of you are given private rooms and access to nearly anything you could want. You order a steak on the first night and it's delicious.

Just as Meat said, men in suits come and interview you about your experiences on the Speedwell. You answer their questions in as much detail as you can. They thank you for your time and promise you will be released soon.

"Soon" turns out to be three days later. You, Meat, and Salvucci meet on the base and request a transport to the nearest bar. There, you all drink in almost complete silence, only uttering the names of the lost from time to time.

You all take seperate cabs home. When you reach your house in the suburbs, you pass your mailbox but decide to check it later. It's only when you swipe your card against the door's reader and hear it unlock that you feel as though you are truly safe. Inside, you shut the door and hang up your coat.

You go into the living room and sit on the couch. You do nothing but stare at the wall for hours, in a trance of sorts. You rub you finger up and down one of the cushions of your couch. You are alive to do this, but you're not sure you're thankful for that.

You begin to see a therapist. You make progress--according to him, anyway. You never really shake the memories of your time aboard the Speedwell, but you're able to cope with them.

That's more than can be said for Captain Salvucci, who eats 
a bullet on the third anniversary of your return to Mars.

You don't go to the funeral.

You and Meat stay in contact but the emails you send one another are largely going through the motions bullshit. Your failure to connect with him is indicative of your relationship with the rest of humankind. You never marry or even begin what you're comfortable calling a relationship with anyone. For the first ten years or so this bothers you but you slowly grow comfortable with this new you.

You become a writer. Your sci-fi espionage novels sell well enough for you to live comfortably by yourself and away from everyone. You're mostly happy but sometimes there's a thought strikes you like the lash of a whip.

You are alone.

The End

You open your mouth to speak, but you're cut off by a familiar voice.  "Well, captain, I guess it's too much to hope for some confidence in my abilities."

Out from a supply closet steps Strauss.  Sweat is dripping off her face; there's blood on her lab coat.

"Doctor, are you hurt?"

"No," she says. "It broke through the glass and grabbed me, but Ben pushed it off. I ran and didn't look back. I heard him scream behind me."

Salvucci looks at you nervously.

1.	[["Ben's dead."]]
2.	[["You left him to die, you bitch."]]

"Please hurry," she begs. "We're in the cockpit."

"Hustle people," Meat says, breaking out into a sprint.

You and Neil follow.

You keep an eye out for Markie, but, thankfully, she never exploits your panic. When you reach the bend before the cockpit, Meat slows down and raises his hand for you to stop. You do so and listen. Just out of sight, you can hear something cracking.

Meat steps out of the corner, and his face goes pale. You and Neil join him, your pistol raised in the direction of the cockpit. There, covered in red and yellow grime, his back to you, is Ben biting into Salvucci's leg and tearing away flesh and muscle. Salvucci is against the cockpit's door, either unconscious or dead. Blood trickles from his forehead. A crowbar is on the ground next to him.

Meat aims down the sight and breathes hard.

"Conserve the ammo," Neil says.

Meat gently tugs the trigger. A round slams into Ben's neck; the creature masquerading in your crewmate's skin whirls around and slams into the wall. It hisses and stands up. What was once Ben's youthful face glares at you. 

The thing takes a step forward.

Meat fires another two shots that slam into its chest. Ben is knocked back, but he recovers quickly, taking another step toward you. And then another. He's closing in.

"Well don't just stand there—shoot him!"

You aim down the sight of your pistol.

1. [[Pull the trigger.]]

When you get inside your house, you finally allow yourself to break down and cry. For the dead, for you, for Strauss.

It takes years for you to come to terms with the fact that you're alive. You see a therapist to help you cope with the nightmares and PTSD episodes. You are reassigned to a boring job as an analyst, an occupation you're fine with. You never marry, though you do have a series of healthy relationships with their ups and downs.

Twenty years later, Strauss sends you an email out of the blue; "I'm sorry" is all it says. The next morning the local news reports the suicide of a renowned doctor. You turn off the TV before the anchor says her name. Though you never really talked after the Speedwell incident, you can't help but feel that your universe is a little smaller without Lenore Strauss in it.

You are now alone.

The End

"Thanks," she says. She leaves the mess hall. You hear her break out into a run, her footsteps echoing through the hall.

"Help!" she shrieks as she runs. "Help!"
