Time passes painfully, slowly. Finally, Salvucci turns to both of you. "We go. Now."

All of you start running toward the hanger. "Keep an eye out for anything," Salvucci says. "It might try to use this plan against us."

You reach the hanger in two minutes. You all peek through the threshold to see Markie advancing on a bloodied Strauss, who has her back to the hanger door. The captain's pistol lay on the floor several feet from the pair.

"She's wounded," Meat says, defeated. "Infected."

Markie is shuffling closer, giggling. Strauss sees the three of you. She looks over at the panel that controls the hanger door and then looks back at you all. She nods.

You slowly raise your pistol. Markie grabs the doctor by the throat and lifts her into the air. She chokes her.

Meat raises his rifle. His hands are shaking.

1. [[Mercy kill Strauss first.]]
2. [[Go ahead and shoot the switch.]]

"Please hurry," she begs. "We're in the cockpit."

"Hustle people," Meat says, breaking out into a sprint.

You and Neil follow.

You keep an eye out for Markie, but, thankfully, she never exploits your panic. When you reach the bend before the cockpit, Meat slows down and raises his hand for you to stop. You do so and listen. Just out of sight, you can hear something cracking.

Meat steps out of the corner. You and Neil join him, your pistol raised in the direction of the cockpit. There, covered in red and yellow grime, his back to you, is Ben biting into Salvucci's leg and tearing away flesh and muscle. Salvucci is against the cockpit's door, either unconscious or dead. Blood trickles from his forehead. A crowbar is next to his body.

Meat aims down the sight and breathes hard.

"Conserve the ammo," Neil says.

Meat gently tugs the trigger. A round slams into Ben's neck; the creature masquerading in your crewmate's skin whirls around and slams into the wall. It hisses and stands up. What was once Ben's youthful face glares at you. 

The thing takes a step forward.

Meat fires another two shots that slam into its chest.  Ben is knocked back, but he recovers quickly, taking another step toward you. And then another. He's closing in.

"Well don't just stand there—shoot him!"

You aim down the sight.

1. [[Fire the gun.]]

"I hear that. Level with me though. You think we got a chance against this thing? Whatever it is."

Neil leans in as well, clearly interested in your response.

1.[["Of course. We just need to flush it out and kill it...somehow."]]
2.[["No idea."]]
3.[["We're screwed, fellas."]]

"Me too, me too." That's all he says on the matter. The week passes. He leaves. His wife, Rhonda, calls you a month later later to tell you he passed away in his sleep. You can't make the funeral because traveling would make your ailing health even worse.

You wait. You spend days watching old movies. You try to make your way through a collection of Christine Love's works, but you keep losing your focus.

Death comes when you're sitting in your loveseat watching a news report on a bridge being built in a neighboring county. It is a quick, painful tremor that starts in your chest and spreads out.

The dark sets in. You never expected slipping away to be this easy.


The End

incoming: "That's good and all, but what about Markie?"
text:
We have to euthanize her," Strauss says, looking through the glass at Markie. "The infection could spread."

"I thought you chopped her damn arm off so that wouldn't happen."

"The possibility of infection still remains and, as I'm sure Julia can attest to, officer Daniels has only worsened in the past half hour. I'd say there's at least a fifty percent chance that what happened to the arm will happen to her."

"That thing was bad enough, captain," Ben says. "It took three rounds to kill it."

"We have no idea what kind of beast she'll devolve into—"

"If she turns in the first place. God damn it. This is a fucking human being we're talking about," Meat yells.

"Keep your cool, Travis," Salvucci commands. 

"Captain, if she turns into something, I'm not sure we'll be able to contain it. Protocol states—'

"To hell with your protocol! That's Markie we're talking about. And you said it's a fifty percent chance. That ain't a sure thing. Not by a long shot."

"Do you really want to bet everyone's lives on a coin toss?"

"Let's just keep her in the cube until something happens, then we decide what to do with her. I've got my rifle. Everybody else has pistols."

"Yes, because an assault rifle worked wonders for Sergeant Benson, didn't it?"

Meat glares at Strauss but she continues.

"Mark my words, if we don't take care of that thing, it's going to take care of us."

The conversation is becoming heated. The captain seems uncertain what to do.

text:

"What is it?"

Before you can answer, Strauss slams the fist of her unwounded arm against the door.

"Listen here, you little shit. You open this door right now or so help me I'll put you to sleep, slather whatever honey we have left in the cafeteria on your testicles, and we'll use you as bait."

The door slides open. Neil's face, boyish as ever, awaits you and Strauss. He is unharmed.

"It eats honey?"

"I don't think I'll ever be able to fathom the depths of your stupidity, pilot."

Neil frowns; he seems genuinely hurt by the remark.

1.[["Let's just go."]]

You crawl away from Ben, shrieking as loud as you can. Markie jabs her scalpel into the boy's eye socket again and again.

She's in mid plunge when the captain steps into view, plants his pistol against her temple, and fires. Brain, skull bits, and strands of hair blast across the light and onto the floor. The thing that was Markie topples over to the ground, blood spewing out of her nose and mouth as she giggles.

The red eyes roll around in her head like in a slot machine before settling on you.

"Buy two hypostims, get three free. Just come on down to the Couponia at Rylock's junction this Saturday—"

Salvucci puts another bullet in its face. Markie jerks, and then stops moving completely.

Meat examines Ben. "He's dead," he says. The boy's face is a sea of blood and torn flesh. Half his eyeball has been pushed up through the socket.

incoming: "The hanger. We can use the hanger."
text:

"Space. You want to jettison the fucker. That's insane. He's slow though, so maybe it could work."

1.[["Maybe, maybe not. Either way, we don't have much to work with and we're running out of time."]]

incoming: Wait for someone to say something.
text:
Salvucci turns to Strauss. "Are we good, doctor?"

"There's no way to know we're infected until we start seeing symptoms."

"Which would be..."

"I don't know, Travis. From our brief encounter with Markie's transformation, I would be inclined to say that we would drop to the floor and start babbling nonsense while our bodies decayed but she was bitten. If there was an airbone virus when that blob exploded, our transformations could be much more subtle. There's no way to know until whatever happens, happens."

"A comforting thought," Neil says.

"The best thing we can do right now is...just wait. Maybe some of us get some shut eye and then rotate the guard."

"What are the guards looking out for, exactly?"

Strauss looks at Meat and takes a breath. "Symptoms. In case something goes wrong with one of the sleepers."

Salvucci nods. "We're all a bit tired. Meat, Julia, doctor, you three rest first. Neil and I will keep watch."

"Make sure not to turn into boogeymen," Neil says as the three of you head toward the barracks.

"If I do, I'll eat you first, little man," Meat teases back.

1. [[Sleep in the barracks.]]

You reach the cryogenics room. You set three of the pods to prepare for a trip to Mars. Each one slides open. 

You wait. An hour later Meat and Salvucci return. Each covered in sweat. "Found Ben creeping around. Put him down and burned him. Glad the doc wasn't around for that."

"Two months," Salvucci says, staring down into his pod. "It's going to feel instantaneous."

"Gonna wake up to a bunch of disbelieving suits asking why most of our crew's dead," Meat says, putting his rifle aside. "I for one cannot wait for that."

You get into your pod. You look at your companions.

1.[["Sleep tight, bitches."]]
2.[["See you at home."]]

You squeeze the trigger. Neil's head swings right in front of the barrel when you do. His head pops. You scream as blood splashes across your face, but you continue firing until the clip goes dry.

You open your eyes. Neil's corpse is missing the top half of his head. What was Markie is absolutely still, the form riddled with holes.

"Zoe?" Salvucci says through your walkie.

You pick up your walkie.

1.[["Neil and Markie are dead."]]

"Best goddamn thing I've heard on this stupid voyage. Let's go."

You both head to the cryogenics room and ready your pods. They hiss and spew cold air on you as they open.

"Two months," he says as he stares at the tube, which you realize now looks very much like a coffin. "Here's hoping nothing eats us while we're sleeping."

He gets in his. You follow suit.

"See you soon, lady."

You press the button on the interior door and it slowly closes on your tube. You hear the seal clamp. A mist falls over your face.

You slowly closes your eyes and hope you wake up.

It's as though no time passes between the moment the darkness falls over you to when you open your eyes again to see ten soldiers standing over you, peering down, each of them equipped with assault rifles.

"Come on, lieutenant," one of them says, lifting you to your feet. You see Meat being held up by two soldiers. He's grinning like a fool.

"We did it," his eyes say.

The troops escort you both to your own personal rooms where you're served cheap stake and soda pop. It tastes superb. 

Later, you and Meat are interviewed about the incident aboard the Speedwell. You both answer the interviewer, an older man with a bald spot, as honestly as you can.

And then he shows you security footage of Meat killng Strauss...while you and Neil look on.

"Explain," he says. Before you can even say anything, Meat jumps in. "She killed the captain. She would have killed us too if she saw us as obstacles to her survival. You bet I put her the fuck down."

And just like that, his confession damns you. You're both court-martialed. Meat gets life. You get a hard 25 without parole in Titan penitentiary. You don't make the 25. You don't even make five.

When you refuse the courtship of one of the most powerful inmates in the penitentiary, she has one of her thugs stab you in your throat while you're taking a shower.

As the blood and suds and water swishes all around you on the way to the drain, you look up at your nude attacker. On her calf, you see a tattoo of an angel and a demon dancing around a single word: "Karma."

You almost want to laugh. Almost.

The End

incoming: Put a bullet in your brain.
text:
You can't kill them. You thought you could, but you're not strong enough. Not all of them.

"Zoe, put down the gun...please,"  Salvucci says, hand reaching toward you as he approaches.

"Where's Meat?" Neil asks.

"What happpened? You can tell me,"  Salvucci says.

The barrel is cold beneath your chin. The thing screams, cursing your spinlessness.

The barrel erupts, silencing the voice and sending you careening into quiet, peaceful oblivion.

The End

"Yeah, he might have stuck his head out after all that noise. Damn it, why don't we have walkies?"

"We'll get them after we get Neil," Salvucci says.

The three of you leave behind the bodies of your comrades and make your way to the cockpit.

You breathe a sigh of relief when you see the door's still shut. Meat knocks on the door.

From within: "Password?"

"Come on, Neil. Knock that shit off."

Again, louder: "Password?"

Meat sighs. "Ocelot."

The door slides open, and Neil's boyish face is there to greet you. "Heard gunshots. You guys killin' things out here?"

Salvucci cuts to the chase. "Doctor Strauss, Ben, and Markie are dead. Whatever killed them is still on the ship, dressed in Markie's skin."

Neil looks at you all from left to right. "You guys are fucking with me, right?"

"Does it look like we're yanking your chain, Neil?" Meat growls, pointing to his gore-covered boot.

He gulps. "No, I guess not. So what happens now?"

"We fucking kill it," Meat says.

"Well, yeah, but how?"

1.[["We check out the vents."]]

"That's exactly what we're going to do. Hallway A has a section with a viewport enclosed by two doors. We get it there, you shoot the window, and then we close it in."

1.[["Dangerous. I like it."]]
2.[["This plan sucks."]]

You crawl away from Ben, shrieking as loud as you can. Markie jabs her scalpel into the boy's eye socket again and again.

She's in mid plunge when the captain steps into view, plants his pistol against her temple, and fires. Brain, skull bits, and strands of hair blast across the light and onto the floor.  The thing that was Markie topples over to the ground, blood spewing out of her nose and mouth as it giggles.

The red eyes roll around in her head like in a slot machine before settling on you.

incoming: "Let's burn her just to be sure."
text:
Meat nods. Twenty minutes later, he's scavenged the supplies for another Molotov. 

Both of you return to Strauss' body. You watch silently as it burns.

"We shouldn't move the bodies," he says. "Might make us sick or something. Be a fucking shame to die over a little infection at this point," he says, attempting to smile, but he can't manage it. The will to smile or laugh has gone out of both of you at this point. Your friends are dead. You only managed to cling to life.

What future awaits you both now?

You both return to your cryo tubes and pop them open. They hiss and spew cold air on you.

"Two months," he says as he stares at the tube, which you realize now looks very much like a coffin. "Here's hoping nothing eats us while we're sleeping."

He gets in his. You follow suit.

"See you soon, kid."

You press the button on the interior door and it slowly closes on your tube. You hear the seal clamp. A mist falls over your face.

You slowly close your eyes and hope you wake up.

"What happened to Ryan?" Meat shouts over the roar of Speedwell's engine as the ship lands.

1.[["He's dead, Meat."]]

"I'm trying to figure out whether that's sarcasm. It's hard to tell with yo--"

"Andattheboardwalkifound..." 

"Uh...what was that?"

A shiver runs up your spine.

You raise your pistol up in front of you. You see nothing.

"Was that Mar--HOLY SHIT!"

You feel Neil scramble up your leg. You turn to see Markie, her face slowly melting on Neil's pants leg.

"Oh shit oh shit oh shit."

text:
Strauss is waiting for you when you step outside. She's holding her arm. There's a patch of red coming through the white sleeve right above her elbow.

"It's not a bite," she says, noticing your stare. "I fell when I was running and my arm took the fall."

1.[["Oh good, that means your ass is useless in a fight."]]
2.[["Don't strain yourself; I don't want to be scooping you off the ground while I'm trying to shoot something."]]

"Right. Sorry, Zoe."

"Andattheboardwalkifound..." A shiver runs up your spine.

"Uh...what was that?"

You raise your pistol up in front of you. The weapon's flashlight reveals there's nothing there.

"Was that Mar--HOLY SHIT!"

You feel Neil scramble up your leg. You turn to see Markie, her face slowly melting on Neil's pants leg.

"Oh shit oh shit oh shit."

Neil's head is in the way. You can't get a clear shot.

2. [[Push Neil out of the way and lunge at Markie.]]

"I dream of them from time to time," he says.

That's all he says on the matter. The week passes. He leaves. His wife, Rhonda, calls you a week later to tell you he passed away in his sleep. You can't make the funeral because traveling would worsen your ailing health even more.

You wait. You spend days watching old movies. You try to make your way through a collection of Christine Love's works, but you keep losing your focus.

Death comes when you're sitting in your loveseat watching a news report on a bridge being built in a neighboring county. It is a quick, painful tremor that starts in your chest and spreads out.

And then the dark sets in;you never expected slipping away to be this easy.

The End
"Hah. Yeah, no."\n\n1.[["Okay, what about the hanger?"]]

Before the words can leave your mouth, there's a whooshing sound, followed by a giant spike tearing through Ryan's chest, splattering the cave with red. Ryan's pistol drops to the floor. He moans. 

You cast your light on the protruding spike and realize, as your comrade is slowly being lifted in the air, that it's a limb of some sort.

Markie's voice barks over the comm. "Zoe! What's happening!? Ryan's vitals are dropping." You fire several shots into the darkness. One of them slaps into Ryan's arm; his blue eyes gaze at you in shock.

Meat now: "Zoe? Answer us, girl. What the fuck is going on?"

1.[["We need to go. Now!"]]
2.[["Ryan's chum."]]

incoming: "This is ridiculously dangerous. Count me in."
text:
"In any other situation, your reaction would be troubling."

The door behind you clangs.

"Shit," Strauss says, coating the last bullet. "At least we don't have to bait it now.

A louder bang now. A tentacle penetrates the door.

"Come on, let's go!"

You leave through the other sickbay door. In the hallway, she hands you your pistol. You find the viewport. It's a spacious square of glass that takes up half the wall. Behind you there is the sound of giant, reveberating footsteps.

"He's coming. You get near the switch. I'll jump back after you shoot the window." Strauss positions herself near the window; you stand next to the switch. 

The creature approaches. It growls as it lumbers toward the doctor. Both the monster and Strauss are close to the window now.

1. [[Shoot the viewport.]]
2. [[Cripple Strauss first.]]

You fire several rounds as well, tearing off her other arm. Still, the body convulses. You watch as Neil turns to run to the kitchen. He's a foot away from the door when a grey tentacle shoots out of the body's back and impales him through the chest. It whirls him about and throws him through the kitchen door.

"Fuck it, run! Run!" Meat yells. He drops the rifle and darts into the kitchen. You aren't far behind, jumping over a low slash from the tentacle. Right before you step inside, you see another writhing tentacle erupt from her body.

You slam the door and turn around. Meat is looking over the bloody hole in Neil's chest. Blood is dripping from the corner of Neil's mouth. You hear another stretching sound follow by a splash outside. Another tentacle.

"Fuck me, fuck fuck fuck," Meat says, his voice dripping with guilt. "I'm so sorry."

Neil looks up at him. "Not your fault, big man. Wasn't fast enough..."

His wound looks deep.

He turns to you. "Julia...Julia, come here."

You lean down.

"Cockpit. Computer login is..." he coughs up some blood. "Login is ‘K-O-N-A-M-I. Got it?"

1.[["Yes, I understand."]]

You snatch the gun from his holster and shoot him in the shin. He falls to the ground screaming in pain.

"The fuck, Zoe!?"

You back away from him, pistol aimed at his head.

1. [["Come after me and I'll vent your head."]]
2. [[Say nothing and leave.]]

incoming: "We need someone in the air ducts."
text:

Strauss gets it. "Of course. That's how it could be traveling."

"Not good survival odds though, if someone finds her up there," Neil says, eyes toward the ducts. "That close proximity? With bullets that don't do shit? Yeah, I'm not gonna volunteer for that."

"Shit bird's right," Meat says. "If it is hiding up there, we need to figure out how to draw it out. If we go into the vent, we're fucking toast."

"What kind of insult is ‘shit bird?" Neil mutters.

1. [[Draw it out.]]

incoming: "You're talking about a trout, Meat, you dumbass."
text:
"Huh, no shit?"

The four of you trek on in silence until you reach the crater. You approach the edge and look down into the abyss. The area of impact stretches for miles. 

"I don't even see a fucking twig, man," Meat says.

"It's been over a hundred years since the impact. I think all you're going find is dirt down there," Markie replies.

"Don't forget the radiation," Ryan says, kicking a pebble over the edge.

"That too."

Markie peers down. "Zoom," she says. You hear the computer inside her helmet respond in affirmation to the command.

"You gonna get that girl of yours a rock from the surface?" Ryan teases Meat. "I hear people used to go crazy over moon rocks after the Apollo landings. Might make a punny engagement ring, y'know? Girls go for that sort of thing."

Meat grunts. "Not my woman. She's endowed, but it ain't with brains. The humor would, uh, escape her."

"And the radiation," Markie points out.

"Stupid radiation. Ruining everything."

"Hmm. That's interesting," Markie says—it's almost a whisper.

1.[["Well, out with it Mark. What is it?"]]
2. [[Let someone else ask.]]

You grab the pistol from your holster. Too slow. Markie's atop of you, her semi-human hand wrapped around your neck before you can even pull it up to chest level.

You aim upward and fire a shot into her chest. She looks down at you and smiles. The claw is surprisingly quick as it rips open your throat.

"Julia!" Meat cries, but you know you're a goner. You watch helplessy as Salvucci and Meat both tackle her. Strauss is screaming about the cryopod.

Your vision is becoming blurry. 

You hope your crewmates make it out OK and that they have nice words to say about you at your funeral.

Most of all, though, you wish you had gone for the goddamn saw. You were so close to getting out of here.

The End

He folds his arms. "Do tell."

1.[["One word: ‘hanger.']]
2.[["We could try our fists."]]

"It doesn't work like that, Ryan. I'm reading at least seven tunnels, carved out exactly the same size."

"Meaning what?"

"There might be something down there."

"Spooky," Meat says, peering at the expanse of the crater.

For a moment no one says anything.

1.[["We should check it out, right?"]]
2.[["Let's check it out."]]
3.[["I feel like nobody really wants to go down there, and that no one is going to say otherwise if we leave out some details out of our report. Sound good to everybody else? Good."]]
4. [[Absentmindedly kick rocks while you wait for someone to answer.]]

"Ryan, let Captain Salvucci know what we've found. Let's try and get a pick up at the LZ in two hours."

"Aye."

"That thing loaded, Meat?"

"Duh."

"Okay, I'm thinking we should split up to cover more ground. How should we do this?"

1.[["I'm with Ryan."]]
2.[["I'm with Markie."]]
3.[["I'm with Meat."]]

You take your knife and slowly cut up Meat's body. It's messy work, dividing the flesh and muscle from the bone. You store the body in various bags that are then stuffed into the freezer.

You stay alive another week, but the ships never come. The will to live finally leaves you; you lay down on the floor and close your eyes. You would cry if you had the strength.

The last thing you feel is the cold of the metal floor leaving your cheek.

The End

"What the fuck happened?"

"If you must know," Strauss says, turning her head to glare at Neil, "he saved me and I left him to die."

The surprise and indignation in Neil's voice fades. "Oh."

"Yes. Now can we please just get back to sickbay?"

"Sure. Sorry."

1.[["Dude, stop talking."]]
2.[["That was a bit harsh, Doc."]]

You put a bullet in Strauss' leg. She falls to the ground, screaming "No!"

The beast advances.

She turns, reaching toward you with an outstretched hand. "I don't want to die!"

You unload the rest of your clip into the viewport and press the button on the wall. The door slides down, separating you from Strauss and the beast. Through the window you watch the beast lift its massive foot above Strauss' head and then bring it down, snapping her neck.

And then the viewport finally shatters, sucking both the monster and Strauss' corpse into space. An alarm blares for a couple of seconds before the emergency panel closes over the viewport.

You breathe a sigh of relief. You're alive. You won.

Your body aches, but you have one last thing to do before you can enter the cryochamber. You don't know how to make a molotov cocktail, so you go around the ship in search of bodies. When you find them, if they have a skull, you stomp it in. 

After you're done, you go to the cryoroom and ready one of the pods. It hisses as the hatch slides open. You get inside and close your eyes. You're ready for this nightmare to be over.

When you awaken, you find yourself being assisted by a corporal. He takes you by the arm and guides you up from the pod. 

You're transported to a private room on the biggest military base outpost in New Texas. You order steak and wine but find that you don't have an appetite. Some suits interview you. You answer all of their questions honestly, but then they show you security footage of you shooting Strauss.

"Explain," one of them, a beefy looking man with no hair, demands.

1.[["She had killed the captain. Looks like karma caught up with her."]]
2.[["I needed to ensure my survival. I had to use her as bait."]]
3.[["She was infected. I did what I had to."]]

We have to euthanize her," Strauss says, looking through the glass at Markie. "The infection could spread."

"I thought you chopped her damn arm off so that wouldn't happen."

"The possibility of infection still remains and, as I'm sure Zoe can attest to, officer Daniels has only worsened in the past half hour. I'd say there's at least a fifty percent chance that what happened to the arm will happen to her."

"That thing was bad enough, captain," Ben says. "It took three rounds to kill it."

"We have no idea what kind of beast she'll devolve into—"

"If she turns in the first place. God damn it. This is a fucking human being we're talking about."

"Keep your cool, Travis," Salvucci commands. 

"Captain, if she turns into something, I'm not sure we'll be able to contain it. Protocol states—"

"To hell with your protocol! That's Markie we're talking about. And you said it's a fifty percent chance. That ain't a sure thing. Not by a long shot."

"Do you really want to bet everyone's lives on a single coin toss?"

"Let's just keep her in the cube until something happens, then we decide what to do with her. I've got my rifle. Everybody else has pistols."

"Yes, because an assault rifle worked wonders for Sergeant Benson, didn't it?"

Meat glares at Strauss, but she continues.

"Mark my words, if we don't take care of that thing, it's going to take care of us."

The conversation is becoming heated. The captain seems uncertain what to do. You grip the pistol in your hand more 
tightly.

1.[["Calm your tits, everybody."]]
2.[[Kill Markie.]]

You head to the cryogenic room and prepare the four pods. Strauss is the first to make it in. She's pale.

"Are they almost ready? Good. I am so ready to be asleep. I don't have much to go back home to, but, y'know, it's better than what's here."

1.[["So, doc, what are you going to do when we get back?"]]

The room is still in the same state it was earlier. Meat thrusts a walkie into Neil's hands.

"So I guess I should just go stand by the blood or something," says Neil.

"Yeah, the minute you hear something let us know. If you see her, just yell. We'll be right outside the door."

"Yeah, got it."

You leave him inside.

"You know it's fucked up what we're doing to him, right?" Meat asks the two of you after you've been waiting a while.

"Everything will be fine. I doubt she'll fall for something so--"

"HELP!" Neil shrieks. "She's here! AND SHE HAS A TAIL."

The three of you burst into the room to find Neil backing away from the examination table upon which Markie stands. Her eyes are red and where her left arm should be there's a giant, purple claw. She hisses at all of you.

"Guys! Guns!" Neil screams, cowering. "Shoot her!"

"Fire!" Salvucci roars. You unleash a hail of bullets that knocks her off the table, but she brushes it off and stands, grinning to reveal a toothless mouth.

"Fuck" Meat says. "Clip's dry." Your mag is empty as well.

"I've got two left," says Salvucci.

Out of the corner of your eye, you see a ruptured hose slowly filling the room with the same gas used to operate your cryostasis chambers.

1. [[Improvise.]]

"Damn. Do you hear that?"

Footsteps. Giant footsteps.

"Let's go."

You both retreat to the hanger.

"Shit," he says as the door slides shut behind you. "I thought this place was bigger."

He's right: it's not much, and half the room is cramped by the reconnaissance droids.

"Loosen the holding clamps on those. I'll get our suits. Hurry, it can't be far behind us."

You deactivate the locks on the droids and catch the suit that Meat throws you. You're just about to put the helmet on when you hear the clanging on the door.

"It's here. When it gets in front of the droids, shoot the hanger switch, okay? And for fuck's sake, hold on to something."

The door bursts open and flies across the hanger. In steps the monster, mouth stained with blood, eyes looking about wildly.

It takes a step toward you.

"Over here, motherfucker!" Meat shouts through his suit's comm.

It growls and moves toward Meat. Its footsteps leave imprints in the steel floor.

Meat backs away from the droids until his back is pressed against the wall. He grabs onto a wall-railing.
The monster steps in front of the line of droids.

"Do it, do it now."

You take aim at the switch on the far wall. You fire.
The shot slams into the switch, and the alarms blare. Meat slowly pulls himself along the rail until he's behind the droids.

The hanger door opens and air swooshes out. You grip the railing beside you.

"Hold on!"

The beast begins to backslide toward the hanger door, its feet dragging. It tries to throw a tentacle at Meat, but they're pulled as well.  

A moment later they snap off and go flying into the black.  Meat, clinging to the railing, kicks the droids. It takes a second for them to detach from their holders and tumble down into the behemoth. The first one knocks it back a couple of feet. The second droid seals the monster's fate, knocking it off both of its feet and sending it careening into the stars.

"Eat shit and die, you fuck!" Meat screams through the comm. You can't help but grin as the monster spins out of sight.

The alarms in the hanger continue to yell for a couple of seconds, and then the emergency seal protocol activates, and the hanger door slowly slides to a close again.

"We did it," Meat says. "We fucking did it."

He walks over to you and hugs you tightly. You both laugh.

"We're alive!"

1.[["Home. Let's get the fuck home."]]

"Meet us at the center of the crater!" Markie yells over the comm.

You look at Ryan's heart monitor; he's about to flatline.
 
That's when you hear it: the roar from the black.

You have a single bullet left.

1. [[Shoot the beast.]]
2. [[Put Ryan out of his misery.]]
3. [[Run!]]

In the kitchen, you find the charred corpse of Neil. Meat stands over him and retrieves the broken pistol fragments from his hand.

"You think we could have saved him—saved all of them? If we had made difference choices?"

1.[["We're alive."]]
2.[["Yeah."]]
3.[["I don't think so, Meat."]]

"What about the bodies? Do you think Strauss will come back?"

1.[["Let's burn her just to be sure."]]

You awaken in sickbay. Meat is standing over you, a relieved expression on his face. You realize your holster's empty; your pistol is gone.

"Good, we worried you weren't gonna wake up. You hit your head pretty hard there."

You feel your forehead. There's a bandage. "Yeah, between Neil and I we managed to get that on your forehead. Nasty cut. Probably should get the doctors to look at it when get back to Mars."

You eye the pistol in his holster and then look up into his eyes. The thing's voice curls itself around your mind like a snake. Kill him, it hisses. Kill him and be done with it.

"Something wrong?"

1.[["Tell everyone I'm sorry."]]
2.[["No. Nothing at all."]]

incoming: Take no chances: kill both of them.
text:
You put two rounds each into both of them. They're both dead before they hit the floor.

What now?

1. [[End your life.]]
2. [[Wait.]]

"This, right here, is preserved acid. Right now it's completely safe but once the tempature is high enough, it does what acid does. Unfortunately, we can't really use it as a weapon agaisnt the beast itself. It's just not that powerful, and I can't coat each bullet with enough of it to make a difference."

1.[["So if we can't burn its flesh off, what are we doing?"]]

incoming: "She was infected. I did what I had to."
text:
The man seems doubtful of your lie, but he has no evidence to contradict it.

Within three days, you're free to leave the military base. 

You return to your home in the suburbs and pour yourself a drink from the unopened bottle of whiskey in your cabinet. In spite of recent events, you feel...good. 

Not only did you survive horrific setup ripped from a bad horror movie...you killed someone and got away it. You feel a buzz.

You got away with murder.

And thus begins your reign as Mars' most renowned serial killer. Drunks staggering away from the bar and the homeless are your victims. Your weapon of choice? A scalpel. Each kill fills you with a kind of energy you've never known. The news says you're doing this because you're religious or you play video games or you have sexual fantasies about your mother, but they couldn't be further from the truth. You have no delusions. You just like killing people. It feels good.

The cops finally get you on the sixteenth murder. Turns out the poor bum you stabbed was an undercover copper. You see the flash of red and blue as soon as you penetrate the poor officer's throat. You run, not even bothering to retrieve the scalpel jutting from his trachea.

You don't get very far. The sniper's bullet shatters your sternum, sending bone fragments into your heart. You're already dying when you hit the ground.

As police officers gather to get a good look at you, all you can do is wonder what they'll say about you on the morning news.

The End

"She chased the doctor into the hallway. Can't believe doctor Strauss left me here."

He turns to you, eyes filled with tears.

1. [[Move to comfort him]]
2. [[Don't touch him]]

incoming: "Come on. Let's get out of the hanger."
text:
"Yeah, let's."

The two of you walk back through the hallway leading to the hanger and then to the cockpit. The bodies of your crew are still there, including the headless corpse of Dr.Strauss.

"I was hoping she got away," he says sadly.

1.[["Me too."]]
2.[["It is what it is."]]

"No problem," she says.

"What was that?" Ryan asks.

"We're coming up on that big-ass hole," Markie says. "You big bad men got your willy compensators charged?"

"Ha. Ha. Ha," Ryan says.

"Oh you bet, baby," Meat says, showing off the rifle in his hands. "32 round clip, full metal jacket. Enough stopping power to put down a rhinoceros."

"A rhywhat?"

"Didn't you pay attention in school at all? A rhinoceros, man. It's a huge fucking lizard that ruled over all the other dinosaurs."

1. [[Say nothing at all.]]
2.[["You're talking about a trout, Meat, you dumbass."]]

incoming: "Things that are not great ideas: this."
text:
"Everything will be fine," Markie says.

The groups go their separate ways; you hike down the cliff with Markie. It takes the larger portion of an hour to reach your tunnel. You step inside.

"Let's turn our lights on," Markie says quietly.

You both tell your suits to turn on your light attachments. Yours flickers for a moment before shooting a cone of light from your chest compartment.

On the Head Up Display (HUD) of your helmet, you can see the heartbeat monitors of everyone in your squad. Yours is going a little faster than normal and, knowing that everyone else can see that, you feel a little embarrassed.

You proceed through the cave.

"These caverns are massive. This one seems to just go on and on."

1.[["What made them?"]]

incoming: "God damn it. I'm so sorry, Neil."
text:
You make your way to the vent where Meat has just finished prying off the cover. The gas is thick in the air, making you slightly dizzy.

"Tight fit," he says. "I'll go first so I can remove the next cover."

You look back to see that multiple tentacles have penetrated the door. Neil is pointing the pistol in the air and is breathing hard.

You force down the feeling of despair in your stomach and crawl through the vent. When you catch up to Meat, he's already kicking a cover.

"Almost got it!" With one last kick, the cover comes free. You emerge into the hallway just in time to feel the ship shake violently.

Meat slams his fist into the wall over and over.
 
1. [[Comfort him by touching his shoulder.]]
2. [[Let him get it out of his system.]]

"Fuck that!" Meat says, turning. He aims his assault rifle at the first speaker and dismembers it with a single shot. He takes the second, third speakers out of commission as well. The music is no longer overpowering, but you can hear its echoes in the hallway.

"Brutal, but effective," Strauss comments.

Salvucci frowns. "You're footing the bill for that when we get back."

"Guys, now that Julia is awake, I think we should talk strategy. I just finished with our travel projections," Neil says.

"And?" Strauss says, as though she knows what's coming next.

"Well, it's like you said, doc: not good. Two months to Mars."

"We could last that long," Salvucci says. "We ration food, ammo, go in groups to the rest of the ship when we need supplies."

"Captain, permission to speak?" Meat says.

Salvucci nods.

"That's a horrible idea. We've got guns. Why don't we use them? For all we know, that beastie thing could be growing. We need to hunt it down and kill it now."

"Travis, I put a gun against Markie's head and blew her brains all over the floor. Apparently the thing inside her shook it off. I don't think bullets are going to save us."

"Then we destroy the body completely," Meat suggests. "Shoot it, stomp it, burn it, and then jettison the motherfucker into space."

"Captain, I don't like either choice, but I think the more cautious one would be eliminating its presence from the ship," Strauss says slowly.

"Didn't you say something about it being airborne?" Salvucci asks. "Could killing it infect one of us?"

Strauss sighs, shrugs. "There's no way to be sure. I didn't get to run any tests on it. However, I'd rather take a chance on that possibility than risk us starving ourselves into easy prey."

Silence fills the common room. Then—

"What do you think, Julia?" Neil asks.

Everyone turns to you.

1.[["Let's kill it."]]
2.[["Let's wait it out."]]

"Let's burn it. Just to be sure." Twenty minutes later, he's scavenged the supplies for another Molotov. 

Both of you return to Strauss' body. You watch silently as it burns.

"We shouldn't move the bodies," he says. "Might make us sick or something. Be a fucking shame to die over a little infection at this point," he says, attempting to smile, but he can't manage it. The will to smile or laugh has gone out of both of you at this point. 

What future awaits you both now?

You both return to your cryo tubes and pop them open. They hiss and spew cold air on you.

"Two months," he says as he stares at his tube, which you realize now looks very much like a coffin. "Here's hoping nothing eats us while we're sleeping."

He gets in his. You follow suit.

"See you soon, kid."

You press the button on the interior of the door and it slowly closes on your tube. You hear the seal clamp. A mist falls over your face.

You slowly closes your eyes and hope you wake up.

1.[[Go to sleep]]

"I dream of them from time to time," he says.

That's all he says on the matter. The week passes. He leaves. His wife, Rhonda, calls you a month later to tell you he passed away in his sleep. You can't make the funeral because traveling would make your ailing health even worse.

You wait. You spend days watching old movies. You try to make your way through a collection of Christine Love's works, but you keep losing your focus.

Death comes when you're sitting in your loveseat watching a news report on a bridge being built in a neighboring county. It is a quick, painful tremor that starts in your chest and spreads out.

The dark sets in. You never expected slipping away to be this easy.

The End

She appraises you with a cold glare, like you're a fly that's landed on her sandwich.

"What does it look like?"

She scoots past you and turns on the device in her hand. A hot laser point darts out about three inches from the top port of the device. Another line escapes the bottom port and swings upward to connect to the top beam.

"Cauterizing saw. You might want to leave this to the professionals, girlie. It's going to get a little messy."

1.[["Are you really going to take her arm off?"]]
2.[["What the fuck is wrong with you?"]]

incoming: Read the text on the screen.
text:
Tell it to me again. 

Tell you what again?

You know.

Darling, I don't.

I want the story.

Not that story.

Yes. Tell me the story of how we first met.

Every night for a hundred years you want to hear it. Aren't you tired of it by now?

Clearly not.

Fine. Once upon a time in a pawn shop...

On Callisto.

Who's telling the story?

I'm just reminding you. You always leave that bit out. It's important.

Okay. Fine. Once upon a time, in a pawn shop on Castillo, there was an old woman in search of a friend....

1. [[Finish programming the pods.]]

"It's been in Neil's room. Somehow it's hooked up all his music to the PA system and is playing it. This is the third song."

You look over at Neil. He shrugs sheepishly. Strauss is glaring at him.

"The blasted beast is trying to draw us out," Salvucci says.

1.[["Should we go investigate?"]]
2.[["What do we do?"]]

You and Melissa adopt, opting not to go with artificial insemination. His name is Andre, he's seven, and unruly like most young boys. He grows into a fine young man. Meat becomes his godfather. 

Andre goes to college to become a physicist.

You make enough money to retire. You grow old and stop shaving your legs, because who gives a fuck? Melissa's hair goes white first. Yours follows shortly. You decide not to get anti-aging treatments.

Andre gets engaged to a pretty girl named Jennifer. You're not sure you approve of her.

1. [[Approve.]]
2. [[Disapprove.]]

"Guess not," he says, seeing the expression on your face. 

"I'll just go over here and play with this tablet."

"Moron," you hear Strauss mutter.

You take a seat on the examination table and look around the wrecked room. You're staring at the bloodstains left by Ben's corpse when the door opens and in walk Meat and Salvucci; both men were dark expressions.

"I'm guessing your hunt was uneventful?" Strauss says.

"Yeah, go on and rub it in then," Meat says, turning to rifle through the medical cabinets.

"What are you looking for?"

"Food."

"This is a medical facility. What makes you think there's food in here?"

Meat opens one of the lower cabinets and, after a moment, pulls out a large bag of apricot chips.

"Your assistant told me about his stash a while back."

"I'm glad you can eat his food while his remains are in the same room as you."

"Not like he's going to need them," Meat says with a shrug.

"Enough you two," Salvucci barks. "Pilot, you alright?"

"Yeah, I'm fine, captain. Thanks for asking."

"Did you three see anything?"

"No," Strauss says.

1.[["Where on the ship did you look?"]]
2.[["Did it leave a trail?"]]

He stops punching the wall. Blood drips from wounded fingers.

"He's dead...because of us."

1.[["Yeah, so let's make it count."]]
2.[["Listen to me: this is not on you."]]

You flee.

Looking over your shoulder, you watch as what's left of Ryan is pulled out of sight. His heart monitor flatlines.

You run and run and run. You lose feeling in your legs but somehow keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but you eventually stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way, you can see Meat assisting a limping Markie.

Behind them, you glimpse small purple mushroom shapes scuttling across the ground. You run toward your squadmates. You've covered half the distance when, looking up, you see the Speedwell beginning its descent.

When you reach them, Meat hands Markie off to you and turns to fires several rounds at the crab creatures. He tags all of them except for one. 

You watch helplessly as the little bastard leaps through the air and, with tentacles shooting out from its underbelly, wraps itself around Markie's arm.

She screams in pain. You whip out your pistol and bash the monster's dome in. The creature lets go of her arm and falls to the ground, legs squiggling. Its agony is short-lived; Meat puts three rounds into the soft belly.

"Fucking fuck." He kicks the crab.

You turn to Markie, who's holding her arm. 

1.[["Is your suit ripped?"]]

"I dream of them from time to time," he says. "I miss them." 

That's all he says on the matter. The week passes. He leaves. His wife, Rhonda, calls you a month later to tell you he passed away in his sleep. You can't make the funeral because traveling would worsen your ailing health even more.

You wait. You spend days watching old movies. You try to make your way through a collection of Christine Love's works, but you keep losing your focus.

Death comes when you're sitting in your loveseat watching a news report on a bridge being built in a neighboring county. It is a quick, painful tremor that starts in your chest and spreads out.

And then the dark sets in; you never expected slipping away to be this easy.

The End

"Okay, with what?" Neil asks.

There's a moment of silence as you, Meat, and Strauss turn to look at Neil. 

"Oh," he says, getting it. "Well fuck that."

1.[["Don't be a wuss. This is your chance to be a man."]]
2.[["We could just knock you out."]]

"Yeah, that might be best for both of us." You share a cab. The cabbie drops you off at your home in the suburbs.

"Hey," Meat says as you get out of the cab. You turn. "Give me a call if you need anything, okay?"

1.[["You too, okay?"]]
2. [[Nod at him.]]

He sighs. "We need to find the doctor...if she's not dead."

1.[["Don't talk like that."]]
2.[["You're right. She's probably dead."]]

incoming: "Nothing we can do about it, Meat."
text:
"I know you're right, but..still. It's our homeworld."

You both return to your group of friends to find that Neil is mooning the barkeep.

Weeks pass. One day you see a report about Earth destructing. "An issue with the core,"  says the handsome anchor. No one mentions monsters. No mentions of nukes or fleets of war crusiers. It stirkes you that no one will ever know the sacrifices of you or your crew. You weep and Michelle asks what's wrong.

You lie. Just as you do when she asks you about the augmentations. Accident in the cryotube, you tell her.

You're so wracked with guilt over these lies that you make it a priority to never lie to her about anything. For the most part, your relationship is one built on trust.

Three years after your return to Mars you're married. It's a simple ceremony. Your parents show up, as do the surviving members of your crew. You eat cake. You kiss.

Michelle moves in with you. You live a comfortable life together. She starts talking about children and you make efforts to put off that conversation for as long as possible.

One day, the two of you take a trip to the recently terraformed beach. There's a moment where you're looking out across the manufactured ocean of Mars. You know the ocean is fake, but you can't help but admire its beauty. This is your new life, you tell youself. It's one you've made for yourself, and you've earned every second of it.
             
The End

You unload your clip into the window. On the fourth shot you hear a sucking sound. 

Bingo.

The doctor leaps back behind the door's threshold. You smash the button and the emergency door comes down between the two of you and the beast. It wastes no time in striking at the door with its tentacles. You watch through the glass in the door as the viewport's glass cracks, shatters, and is sucked into space. The monster, though it tries to cling to the inside of the ship with its appendages, isn't far behind.

"We did it," Strauss says, relieved. The alarms blare for a few minutes until the emergency panel comes down and covers where the viewport was.

The door in front of you lifts, giving you access to the rest of the ship again.

"I guess we should burn the other bodies. Just to be sure. I'll go to the lab and make some molotovs. You go get our cryopods ready."

1.[[Go ready for the cryopods for the two of you.]]

It's Ben. There's a giant slash across his cheek and his eyes are wide with fear, but he's alive. You lean down to help him to his feet. You tug but he doesn't get up. He whimpers in pain. Meat shines the light down where his feet should be; the upturned examination table has pinned his legs.

"Travis, help me with this," Salvucci says.

"Hang on, son, Meat says," handing you the rifle so that he can give Salvucci a hand.

"She broke free..." Ben says. "Attacked me. Turn..turned the table on me."

1.[["Where the fuck did she go, Ben? Talk to me."]]
2.[["Don't talk, okay?"]]
"I'm not ready to call it quits yet. There's got to be a way to kill that thing without guns. We just gotta improvise."\n\n1. [["The hanger. We'll use the hanger."]]

You watch as Neil turns to run to the kitchen. He's a foot away from the door when a grey tentacle shoots out of the body's back and impales him through the chest. It whirls him about and throws him through the kitchen door.

"Fuck it, run! Run!" Meat yells. He drops the rifle and runs into the kitchen. You aren't far behind, jumping over a low slash from the tentacle. Right before you step inside, you see another writhing tentacle erupt from her body.

You slam the door and turn around. Strauss and Meat are looking over the bloody hole in Neil's chest. Blood is dripping from the corner of Neil's mouth. You hear another stretching sound follow by a splash outside. Another tentacle.

"Fuck me, fuck fuck fuck," Meat says, his voice dripping with guilt. "I'm so sorry."

Neil looks up at him. "Not your fault, big man. Wasn't fast enough..."

"Stop talking, sweetie," Strauss says, taking you by surprise with the earnest care in her voice as she examines the wound. "An artery's been pierced."

"Shit, is there anything you can do for him?"

Strauss looks at you both, clearly not wanting to give her answer in front of Neil. You feel a tap on your arm. Neil looks up at you.

"Julia...Julia, come here."

You lean down.

"Cockpit. Computer login is..." he coughs up some blood. "login is ‘K-O-N-A-M-I.' Got it?"

1.[["Yeah, I got it."]]

incoming: "When I wake up, I expect to have kickass robo-limbs."
text:
Meat smiles and closes the pod. A moment exists between when the gas floods your chamber and when you wake up in a hospital bed on an army base in New Austin. A brief, dark moment.

"Hello, Julia, your doctor says with a friendly smile. "We took the liberty of installing your augmentations while you were under a delayed cryo release," she says. She has pretty eyes, and she's blonde. You were always a sucker for blondes.

Some suits come by a day later and ask you for your official account of what happened aboard the Speedwell. You tell them everything, although you feel like a loony. They thank you for your time and leave you to rest.

Less than a week later, you're released from the care unit. The doctor comes to visit you to perform a final checkup.

1. [[Ask her for her name.]]
2. [[Thank her for taking care of you.]]

When you get inside your house, you finally allow yourself to break down and cry. For the dead, for you, for Strauss.

It takes years for you to come to terms with the fact that you're alive. You see a therapist to help you cope with the nightmares and PTSD episodes. You are reassigned to a boring job as an analyst, an occupation you're fine with. You never marry, though you do have a series of healthy relationships with their ups and downs.

Twenty years later, Strauss sends you an email out of the blue; "I'm sorry" is all it says. The next morning the local news reports the suicide of a renowned doctor. You turn off the TV before the anchor says her name. Though you never really talked after the Speedwell incident, you can't help but feel that your universe is a little smaller without Dr. Lenore Strauss in it.

You are now alone.

The End

You awaken in sickbay. Meat is standing over you, a relieved expression on his face. You realize your holster's empty; your pistol is gone.

"Good, we were worried you weren't gonna wake up. You hit your head pretty hard there."

You feel your forehead. There's a bandage. "Yeah, between Neil and I we managed to get that on your forehead. Nasty cut. Probably should get the doctors to look at it when get back to Mars."

You eye the pistol in his holster and then look up into his eyes. The thing's voice curls itself around your mind like a snake. Kill him, it hisses. Kill him and be done with it.

"Something wrong?"

1. [["I'm sorry, Travis."]]
2. [["Not a thing."]]

"You look better. Neil's already at the bar. Salvucci will be along soon."

Sure enough, the little man is already getting his drink on when you step through the door.

"Holyyyy shit," he says, the margarita he just sipped through his straw spraying everywhere. "It's the Bionic Woman! Barkeep! I'm buying all this lady's drinks tonight."

You take a seat next to him at the table. Meat sits next to you and nearly takes up your whole side of the booth.

You turn to Neil, who's bright red in the face.

1.[["What, no foam finger for me, pilot?"]]

"All right, let's head that way," the captain says.

The four of you make your way to the barracks. Inside, you see two rows of bunkbeds and all your personal belongings. You and Meat check underneath each bed, but there's no trace of the creature.

1.[["Let's head to the mess hall."]]

"She's doing a hell of a job of it, then. Almost made me shit myself."

"Julia! Neil! Anyone!" Your walkie comes to life; it's Strauss, her voice filled with panic.

You pull the walkie off your belt loop.

"Please help us!" Strauss cries. "The captain keeps shooting but it's not doin—oh god."

Neil looks at you in horror. You click the button on side the side of the talkie. You say:

1.[["Hold on, Doc. We're coming!"]]
2.[["Serves you right."]]
3. [[Say nothing; give the walkie to Meat.]]

"I'll go with Sergeant Can't Keep It In His Pants, then."

"Hey!"

"We'll hike down the wall and take our respective tunnels. You guys have that one on the right over there. See it?" she asks, pointing.

"Yeah," Meat says. "On it."

1. [["This is a plan I'm not crazy about."]]
2.	[["Roger, roger."]]

You decide to wait it out, see if you're not infected. Too bad you killed the only guy who had access to the autopilot controls. You can't even send a distress beacon now.

That's when you notice a wetness on your cheek. You touch it with your finger and pull back blood.

You're infected. However, you can't bring yourself to eat a bullet. You've been through too much. You decide to ride it out, see what happens.

Nothing good. Your fingernails fall off first. Then you start vomiting and shitting blood. Your teeth are next. At this point you decide that killing yourself is the best course of action, but you go blind before you can find your gun.

Days pass like this, with you lying on the floor, begging for death, unable to see anything. Finally, you feel a movement in your chest. A tremor.

And then you feel nothing at all.

The End.

"Will try," she says and then takes off running, screaming her head off.

"Five minutes,"  Salvucci says. "That's all we give her."
Meat nods. Her footsteps (and screams) trail away. 

After three minutes, Salvucci says "She's had enough time. Let's go."

The three of you run down the hall to sickbay. She's inside, screwing a hose onto a black machine of some sort. She looks up. "I told you to give me mor--"

She's interrupted by Markie's descent from the ventilation shaft onto the examination table. She growls at all of you. A giant purple claw has sprouted out of her missing arm. The other arm is rotting, like the rest of her body.

"Prettyprettyprettypretty."

Out of the corner of your eye, you see the cauterizing saw on the table next to the bed. 

1. [[Attack with the saw.]]
2. [[Attack with your gun.]]

"Easy for you to say, Julia. You're not the one who's being served up as dinner."

Meat slaps Neil on the shoulder. "We won't let you get eaten. It's gotta be you, man. You're the tiniest one—the easiest prey, see?"

"You're not making this any more appealing."

"We can't make him do this," Strauss interjects, finally saying something.

"When the hell did you grow a conscience?" Meat growls.

"I did what I did for the sake of survival. There were no other options. There are other options here. We just need to think rationally."

"Well," Meat says. "I'm waiting, doctor."

"No," Neil says. "I'll do it."

You turn to Neil.

1.[["You sure?"]]
2.[["Atta boy."]]

You fire several rounds as well, tearing off her other arm. Still, the body convulses. You watch as Neil turns to run to the kitchen. He's a foot away from the door when a grey tentacle shoots out of the body's back and impales him through the chest. It whirls him about and throws him through the kitchen door.

"Fuck it, run! Run!" Meat yells. He drops the rifle and runs into the kitchen. You aren't far behind, jumping over a low slash from the tentacle. Right before you step inside, you see another writhing tentacle erupt from her body.

You slam the door and turn around. Strauss and Meat are looking over the bloody hole in Neil's chest. Blood is dripping from the corner of Neil's mouth. You hear another stretching sound follow by a splash outside. Another tentacle.

"Fuck me, fuck fuck fuck," Meat says, his voice dripping with guilt. "I'm so sorry."

Neil looks up at him. "Not your fault, big man. Wasn't fast enough..."

"Stop talking, sweetie," Strauss says, taking you by surprise with the earnest care in her voice as she examines the wound. "An artery's been pierced."

"Shit, is there anything you can do for him?"

Strauss looks at you both, clearly not wanting to give her answer in front of Neil. You feel a tap on your arm. Neil looks up at you.

"Zoe, come here."

You lean down.

"Cockpit. Computer login is..." he coughs up some blood. "login is ‘K-O-N-A-M-I. Got it?"

1.[["Yeah. I understand."]]

You slide into your chamber and the hatch closes. You quickly fall into slumber. When you wake up, you're surounded by soldiers. One of them, a corporal, is saying something but his words are soundless. He takes you by the arm and guides you up from the pod.

From there, you, the captain, and Meat are transported to the military outpost in New Austin. You are all given private rooms and access to nearly anything you could want. You order a steak on the first night and it's delicious.

Just as Meat said, men in suits come and interview you about your experiences on the Speedwell. You answer their questions in as much detail as you can. They thank you for your time and promise you will be released soon.

"Soon" turns out to be three days later. You, Meat, and Salvucci meet on the base and request a transport to the nearest bar. There, you all drink in almost complete silence, only uttering the names of the lost from time to time.

You all take seperate cabs home. When you reach your house in the suburbs, you pass your mailbox but decide to check it later. It's only when you swipe your card against the door's reader and hear it unlock that you feel as though you are truly safe. Inside, you shut the door and hang up your coat.

You go into the living room and sit on the couch. You do nothing but stare at the wall for hours, in a trance of sorts. You rub you finger up and down one of the cushions of your couch. You are alive to do this, but you're not sure you're thankful for that.

You begin to see a therapist. You make progress--according to him, anyway. You never really shake the memories of your time aboard the Speedwell, but you're able to cope with them.

That's more than can be said for Captain Salvucci, who eats a bullet on the third anniversary of your return to Mars. 

You don't go to the funeral.

You and Meat stay in contact but the emails you send one another are largely bullshit. Your failure to connect with him is indicative of your relationship with the rest of humankind. You never marry or even begin what you're comfortable calling a relationship with anyone. For the first ten years or so, this bothers you but you slowly grow comfortable with this new you.

You become a writer. Your sci-fi espionage novels sell well enough for you to live comfortably by yourself and away from everyone. You're mostly happy but sometimes there's a thought strikes you like the lash of a whip.

You are alone.

The End

"Please hurry," she begs. "We're in the cockpit."

"Hustle people," Meat says, breaking out into a sprint.

You and Neil follow. 

You keep an eye out for Markie, but, thankfully, she never exploits your panic. When you reach the bend before the cockpit, Meat slows down and raises his hand for you to stop. You do so and listen. Just out of sight, you can hear something cracking.

Meat steps out of the corner, and his face goes pale. You and Neil join him, your pistol raised in the direction of the cockpit. There, covered in red and yellow grime, his back to you, is Ben biting into Salvucci's leg and tearing away flesh and muscle. Salvucci is against the cockpit's door, either unconscious or dead. Blood trickles from his forehead. A crowbar is on the ground next to him.

Meat aims down the sight and breathes hard.

"Conserve the ammo," Neil says.

Meat gently tugs the trigger. A round slams into Ben's neck; the creature masquerading in your crewmate's skin whirls around and slams into the wall. It hisses and stands up. What was once Ben's youthful face glares at you. The thing takes a step forward.

Meat fires another two shots that slam into its chest. Ben is knocked back, but he recovers quickly, taking another step toward you. And then another. He's closing in.

"Well don't just stand there—shoot him!"

You aim down the sight of your pistol.

1. [[Pull the trigger.]]

"Hey, fuck you. I've been cooped up in that room this whole time. Forgive me for being a little curious about why everything around me is going to hell."

The three of you say nothing for the rest of the walk, but you can't shake the feeling that Neil is angry at you.

When you reach the sickbay, it's deserted.

"I suppose those fools are still out looking for it...or they're dead."

"Holy shit," Neil says, approaching the puddle of gore in the center of the room. He stands there, gazing down at it. 

You lean against the wall and take a seat, but your pistol remains in your hand. 

"Meat and the captain aren't really dead, are they?"

1.[["No. Of course not."]]
2.[["Who knows?"]]
3.[["Yeah, they're food."]]

You watch as Neil turns to run to the kitchen. He's a foot away from the door when a grey tentacle shoots out of the body's back and impales him through the chest. It whirls him about and throws him through the kitchen door.

"Fuck it, run! Run!" Meat yells. He drops the rifle and darts into the kitchen. You aren't far behind, jumping over a low slash from the tentacle. Right before you step inside, you see another writhing tentacle erupt from her body.

You slam the door and turn around. Meat is looking over the bloody hole in Neil's chest. Blood is dripping from the corner of Neil's mouth. You hear another stretching sound follow by a splash outside. Another tentacle.

"Fuck me, fuck fuck fuck," Meat says, his voice dripping with guilt. "I'm so sorry."

Neil looks up at him. "Not your fault, big man. Wasn't fast enough..."

His wound looks deep.

He turns to you. "Julia...Julia, come here."

You lean down.

"Cockpit. Computer login is..." he coughs up some blood. "Login is ‘K-O-N-A-M-I. Got it?"

1.[["Yes, I understand."]]

She turns away from you and leaves the mess hall. You hear her break out into a run, her footsteps echoing through the hall.

"Help!" she shrieks as she runs. "Help!"

Time passes painfully, slowly. Finally, Salvucci turns to both of you. "We go. Now."

All of you start running toward the hanger. "Keep an eye out for anything," Salvucci says. "It might try to use this plan against us."

You reach the hanger in two minutes. You all peek through the threshold to see Markie advancing on a bloodied Strauss, who has her back to the hanger door. The captain's pistol lay on the floor several feet from the pair.

"She's wounded," Meat says, defeated. "Infected."

Markie is shuffling closer, giggling. Strauss sees the three of you. She looks over at the panel that controls the hanger door and then looks back at you all. She nods.

You slowly raise your pistol. Markie grabs the doctor by the throat and lifts her into the air. She chokes.

You feel Meat beside you raising his rifle. His hands are shaking.

1. [[End Strauss' pain.]]
2. [[Shoot the switch.]]

incoming: Put Ryan out of his misery.
text:
You take careful aim and fire a single shot that pierces Ryan's visor and kills him instantly. The squad vital monitor shrieks as he flatlines.

The monster roars again and then you catch a glimpse of its hideous, reptilian face as it darts out and closes its jaws around Ryan's head. Like fingers plucking a grape from a vine, the beast rips out your squadmate's head, leaving a bloody stump of a neck.

You flee.

You run and run and run. You lose feeling in your legs but somehow manage to keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but eventually you stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way, you can see Meat assisting a limping Markie. Behind them, you glimpse small purple mushroom shapes scuttling across the sand. You run toward your squadmates. You've covered half the distance when, looking up, you see the Speedwell beginning its descent.

When you reach them, Meat hands Markie off to you and turns to fire several rounds at the crab creatures. He tags all of them except for one. 

You watch helplessly as the little bastard leaps through the air and, with tentacles shooting out from its underbelly, wraps itself around Markie's arm.

She screams in pain. You whip out your empty pistol and bash the monster's dome in. The creature lets go of her arm and falls to the ground, legs squiggling. Its agony is short-lived, as Meat puts three rounds into the soft belly.

"Fucking fuck." He kicks the crab.

You turn to Markie, who's holding her arm. 

1.[["Is your suit ripped?"]]

"Fuck it. Let's get her aboard. We'll worry about what happened later."

You and Meat help Markie to the ship's elevator. Meat enters a combination on the keypad and the door slides open.  Inside the elevator, as you ride up, all three of you remove your helmets. You notice for the first time that your face is drenched in sweat.

A ding. The door opens. Captain Jonas Salvucci, an older, muscular man with little patience for tomfoolery, awaits you—his hand wrapped around the pistol in his holster.

He takes his hand away from the gun when he sees there's no threat.

"Get her to sickbay."

You nod and help Markie through the hallway of the ship. Behind you, you can hear Salvucci interrogating Meat.

"What happened to Ryan?"

"He's dead, cap. Something got him."

"Hell, Travis. What did you find down there?"

When you get to sickbay, both Lenore Strauss, the doctor, and her geeky assistant Ben are prepping the examination table.

"Where's she wounded?" Lenore asks, as you help a woozy Markie out of her suit.  You glare at Ben as he gawks at her well-toned body. He smiles sheepishly and looks away, cheeks burning red with shame. Markie's drenched in sweat; she stares around wildly while Lenore straps her in. She examines the bite: it's just above the elbow, an inflamed bulging of the skin.

"And I was young and we were running," Markie rambles, "eyes bouncing up and down the shore  while the sun cooked the corpses of washed up jellyfish."

You turn to Lenore; she's prepping some kind of tool.

1.[["What's she saying?"]]
2.[["What is that?"]]

"Hanger it is then," Meat says.

"One of us needs to lead it there," Strauss says. "Play wounded. Beg for help. The others have to hang back otherwise it won't fall for the trick."

"I don't like this," Salvucci says.

"Me neither, but she ain't wrong," Meat says grimly. "Somebody's got to be ready to put it all on the line for this."

"I'll go," Strauss says.

Meat doesn't contain his shock. "What?"

"I think we've already established I'm helpless, which means that thing has too. It'll come running."

"This is fucking crazy. Cap, we can't send her out there. I'll go," Meat says.

"You're the biggest of us. It won't go after you, not until it's killed everyone else off. It has to be me."

Salvucci furrows his brow. He unholsters his pistol and hands it to Strauss. "I want my gun back, doctor. Be careful."

"Yes sir."

"Five minutes and then we're coming after you," Meat says.

She nods.

1. [["Be careful."]]
2. [["Better you than me."]]

incoming: "Nice job, shrimp. Didn't think you had it in you."
text:
"Thanks," he utters, looking away from you.

"What about Markie," Meat asks.

"We have to euthanize her," Strauss says, looking through the glass at Markie. "The infection could spread."

"I thought you chopped her damn arm off so that wouldn't happen."

"The possibility of infection still remains and, as I'm sure Zoe can attest to, officer Daniels has only worsened in the past half hour. I'd say there's at least a fifty percent chance that what happened to the arm will happen to her."

"That thing  was bad enough, captain," Ben says. "It took three rounds to kill it."

"We have no idea what kind of beast she'll devolve into—"

"If she turns in the first place. God damn it. This is a fucking human being we're talking about."

"Keep your cool, Travis," Salvucci commands. 

"Captain, if she turns into something, I'm not sure we'll be able to contain it. Protocol states—"

"To hell with your protocol! That's Markie we're talking about. And you said it's a fifty percent chance. That ain't a sure thing. Not by a long shot."

"Do you really want to bet everyone's lives on a single coin toss?"

"Let's just keep her in the cube until something happens, then we decide what to do with her. I've got my rifle. Everybody else has pistols."

"Yes, because an assault rifle worked wonders for Sergeant Benson, didn't it?"

Meat glares at Strauss but she continues.

"Mark my words, if we don't take care of that thing, it's going to take care of us."

The conversation is becoming heated. The captain seems uncertain what to do. You grip the pistol in your hand more tightly.

1.[["Calm your tits, everybody."]]
2. [[Kill Markie.]]

incoming: "You know what we have to do."
text:
He sighs. "I know. I'll just, god..god damn it, just give me a second to set a course for the sun."

You watch as he presses some buttons on the console and turns to you.

"So, how do you want to do thi--" he's only begun to show fear when you shoot him in the face. He flops to the floor. You carefully step past him and look out into the darkness of space.

You realize the few loved ones you have at home will never know what happened to you. You will die a mystery. You put the gun to your temple and pull the trigger.

Several month later, the Speedwell tries to fly into the heart of the sun and is vaporized. 

The End

He sighs. "We need to find the doctor...if she's not dead."

1.[["Don't talk like that, cap."]]
2.[["She's meat."]]

"Just not worth it. They haven't come for us in two weeks. They're not going to come at all. What's the point of staying alive five days longer, y'know?"

Those are the last words he says to you. He goes to sleep later and doesn't wake up. You stare at his pale body sprawled out on the floor. Your belly rumbles weakly.

1. [[Resort to cannibalism.]]
2. [[Starve.]]

"They're all dead because of me," he says quietly. "I've never had people die under my command before. It's a strange feeling."

1.[["It's not your fault."]]
2.[["Move past it or more people are going to die."]]

"Thanks," she says quietly. You get a cab and tell him to take you to the nearest bar. There, the two of you sit in silence for at least an hour sipping your drinks. Finally, Strauss speaks.

"I killed the captain. I let Ben die."

1. [["You did."]]
2. [["You only did what you had to."]]

You fire several shots into the sea of creatures and even kill a few, but they still surge toward you.

"Come on!" Meat roars. "This isn't a fight we can win."

You both retreat. "Neil," he yells into the comm. "Bring the Speedwell to the LZ. We need some fucking help here."

"Coming as fast I can," Neil replies.

You run and run and run. You lose feeling in your legs but somehow manage to keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but you manage to stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way, you see Markie running by herself--her suit covered in what appears to be blood. Ryan is nowhere to be seen. You've covered half the distance to her when, looking up, you see the Speedwell beginning its descent.

When you reach her, you take her by the arm and look through her visor. Her eyes are wild, and she's sweating.

"Markie," Meat says, "where's Ryan?"

She stutters. "D...d..dead."

"Fuck!" He turns back to the hole you and he emerged from. The wave of crabs has reached the mouth of the cave. In the light, they're purple and fungal looking.

He fires some shots at them while you tend to Markie. Her arm is wounded.

1.[["Are you okay?"]]
2. [[Remain silent and keep your hand over the tear in her suit.]]

Before the words can leave your mouth, there's a whooshing sound, followed by a giant spike tearing through Ryan's chest, splattering the cave with red. Ryan's pistol drops to the floor. He moans. 

You cast your light on the protruding spike and realize, as your comrade is slowly being lifted in the air, that it's a limb of some sort.

Markie's voice barks over the comm. "Julia! What's happening? Ryan's vitals are dropping." You fire several shots into the darkness. One of them slaps into Ryan's arm; his blue eyes gaze at you in shock.

Meat now: "Julia? Answer us, girl. What the fuck is going on?"

1.[["Get the Speedwell here now!"]]
2.[["We've got to go!"]]
3.[["Something's got Ryan!"]]

You fire at the tentacle wrapped around Strauss' neck. The appendage snaps and she falls to the floor, gasping for breath. You run by and grab her arm, pulling her to her feet. The two of you run past the creature as it focuses its attention on Meat, who cries "Don't leave me!"

As the two of you sprint down the hallway, you can hear his screams echo down the hallway. 

You and Strauss stop when she runs out of breath.

"Why did you save me?" she asks.

1.[["Not even a simple 'thanks?'"]]

He smiles. The cab pulls away and you walk past your box—you'll get the mail later—and inside your home.
The door slides shut. And that's when you fall apart. You crumble to the floor and bawl yourself to sleep. You wake hours later only to cry yourself asleep again.

When you wake up, you want to believe it's a new day but you can still feel the weight of the dead on your shoulders. It's a weight you never learn to completely shake, but you grow accustomed to it all: the night terrors, the sudden flashes of Ben dying in agony.

Meat's friendship and an ungodly amount of therapy helps you get through the trauma, as does Melissa, the barista who becomes your wife. The military sticks you with an analyst position, something you're quite fine with, though it is boring work.

You grow older. Melissa talks about having kids.

1. [[Have kids.]]
2. [[Don't have kids.]]

"Space. You want to jettison the fucker. That's insane. He's slow though, so maybe it could work."

1.[["What else are we going to do?"]]

"Please hurry," she begs. "We're in the cockpit."

"Hustle people," Meat says, breaking out into a sprint.

You and Neil follow. 

You keep an eye out for Markie, but, thankfully, she never exploits your panic. When you reach the bend before the cockpit, Meat slows down and raises his hand for you to stop. You do so and listen. Just out of sight, you can hear something cracking.

Meat steps out of the corner. You and Neil join him, your pistol raised in the direction of the cockpit. There, covered in red and yellow grime, his back to you, is Ben biting into Salvucci's leg and tearing away flesh and muscle.  Salvucci is against the cockpit's door, either unconscious or dead. Blood trickles from his forehead. A crowbar is next to his body.

Meat aims down the sight and breathes hard.

"Conserve the ammo," Neil says.

Meat gently tugs the trigger. A round slams into Ben's neck; the creature masquerading in your crewmate's skin whirls around and slams into the wall. It hisses and stands up. What was once Ben's youthful face glares at you. The thing takes a step forward.

Meat fires another two shots that slam into its chest.  Ben is knocked back, but he recovers quickly, taking another step toward you. And then another. He's closing in.

"Well don't just stand there—shoot him!" Neil screams.

You aim down the sight.

1. [[Fire the gun.]]

incoming: "Ben said she was chased into the hallway."
text:
"Meat, you go check on Neil. Zoe and I are going to look for Strauss."

"What should we do about them? They might, y'know, come back."

"Knock that horror movie shit off, Travis."

"Captain, with all due respect, I think we're pretty well entrenched in horror movie territory right about now, oh with the crazy alien women and two dead crew members. Is it too much to humor me when I ask for a little reassurance?"

Salvucci frowns. "What are you suggesting?"

Meat looks down at the corpses. "I need oil. We can use the lab's emergency coolant system to control the blaze."

Salvucci nods solemnly. "Run to engineering. Grab what you need. Burn the bodies."

1.[["Are you two serious? This is insane!"]]
2.[["Burn 'em."]]

"What about the bodies? Do you think Strauss will come back?"

1.[["Burn her just to be sure."]]
2.[["She won't."]]

Strauss closes her eyes and momentarily bites her lip. "I'm a coward."

Salvucci holsters his gun. "There's nothing you could have done, doctor. Let's go."

Strauss looks up, her remorse stowed away or perhaps an illusion. "What about the creature?"

"Meat's burning the bodies."

Her eyes widen. "Why the everliving hell is that lumbering mountain of idiocy doing such a thing?"

"He thinks they might come back."

"That fucking moron! We don't know how that infection works. It could be twice as deadly as an airborne virus. I need those bodies intact. Call him! Stop him!"

Salvucci's face goes pale. "I don't have a walkie."

"Run," she says.

And you do. As fast as you can. Inside sickbay you find Meat, sitting down on the floor, staring at where the bodies should be, but instead there's only a lot of blood and some meaty chunks.

An oil can, a bottle, and a rag are next to Meat.

"Where are they?"  Strauss demands. "The bodies? Where are they?"

"Oh good. You're alive," Meat says. You can feel the force of his eyeroll from here.

"Where are the bodies? Did you burn them?"
