The two of you walk down the hallway. Salvucci appears to be deep in thought, distracted from his surroundings.

1.	[["It's not your fault, y' know."]]
2.	[["You okay, cap?"]]

incoming: "The fucking thing ripped his head off."
text:
"Fuck. All right, let's get her aboard."

You and Meat help Markie to the ship's elevator. Meat enters a combination on the keypad and the door slides open. Inside the elevator, as you ride up, all three of you remove your helmets. You notice for the first time that your face is drenched in sweat.

A ding. The door opens. Captain Jonas Salvucci, an older, muscular man with little patience of tomfoolery, awaits you—his hand wrapped around the pistol in his holster. He takes his hand away from the gun when he sees there's no threat.

"Get her to sickbay."

You nod and help Markie through the hallway of the ship. Behind you, you can hear Salvucci interrogating Meat.

"What happened to Ryan?"

"He's dead, cap. Something got him."

"Hell, Travis. What did you find down there?"

When you get to sickbay, both Lenore Strauss, the doctor, and her geeky assistant Ben are prepping the examination table.

"Where's she wounded?" Lenore asks, as you help a woozy Markie out of her suit.  You glare at Ben as he gawks at her well-toned body. He smiles sheepishly and looks away, cheeks burning red with shame. Markie's drenched in sweat; she stares around wildly as Lenore straps her in. Strauss examines the bite: it's just above the elbow, an inflamed bulging of the skin.

"And I was young and we were running," Markie rambles, "eyes bouncing up and down the shore  while the sun cooked the corpses of washed up jellyfish."

You turn to Lenore, who's prepping some kind of tool.

1.[["What the hell is she saying?"]]

You approach the table. Neil takes one of Meat's checkers.
They look up at you.

"Thought we'd see a lot of boring shit on this trip, but I can honestly say I didn't expect to run into a fucking alien," Meat says.

"Is it an alien, though? I mean, maybe it's just something that's been in the Earth the entire time?"

"Shut up, Neil. You know what I meant."

"Hey, I'm just saying that maybe we should be a little more careful about the terms we're throwing around, y'know, for science?"

"Just play the damn game. " He turns to you. "How are you holding up, Zoe?"

1.[["Good, all things considered."]]
2.[["The fuck you think I'm holding up?"]]

You never make your dislike of your daughter-in-law known, but she can sense it. You never become close.

You wake up one morning to find your husband cold on the patio. You get down on the floor and hold his corpse for hours before you finally dial the operator and tell the poor man on the other end that your husband is dead and you have no clue what to do. He takes your address and promises he'll send an ambulance.

They come. Your heart shatters when they zip him in a bag.

Later, weeks after the funeral, Meat comes to stay for a couple of weeks. He's bald and uses a cane because of a bum leg. You watch reruns of sitcoms and play chess. You talk of your loved ones and your children. Then, unexpectedly, he brings it up: "Do you ever think of them? The crew?"

1.[["I do."]]
2.[["I don't."]]
3.[["What's the point?"]]

"I guess so. Come on. Let's go...let's go see Neil. Just to be sure."

In the kitchen, you find the charred corpse of Neil. Meat stands over him and retrieves the broken pistol fragments from his hand.

"You think we could have saved him—saved all of them--if we had made different choices?"

1.[["We're still breathing."]]
2.[["I don't know, Meat. I don't want to know."]]
3.[["We did our best."]]

You go for your gun, but someone beats you to the trigger. A shot tears off Ben's lower jaw, sending it flying into the wall. The second splits his forehead. The body falls back onto the floor and continues to gurgle.

You turn to see Strauss holding up the captain's pistol, tears in her eyes.

"Doc," Meat says, but she walks past him and continues to fire round after round into the corpse. Ben goes silent and still.

"Lenore," Salvucci says, reaching out to comfort her.

"We have to burn him too," she says, no hint of emotion in her voice. "Don't touch him. Don't want to risk infection anymore than we have already."

"What about airborne infection?" Salvucci asks.

"What of it?" she says. "If it's airborne, we're dead anyway."

"I'll go get some oil then," say Meat.

"And I'll check on the console in the cockpit and hope to god Neil had enough time and selflessness to set up our autopilot. Zoe, why don't you go get our cryopods ready?" the captain says.

1. [[Go to the cryopods.]]

The captain and Meat continue to examine the rest of the room for clues of the creature's whereabouts. You wait for Ben to finish sobbing so you can continue your conversation.

He stops crying, but it's not because he's calmed down. His eyes widen as he looks at something behind you. Instinct guides you toward the rifle on the floor, but you're thrown to the side before you can even touch it.

Your shoulder slams into the ground and goes numb. Looking up, you see Markie straddling Ben, a scalpel in her hand. She's giggling. You can only see the side of her face but you know that your friend is gone. Blood and grime are dripping off her body, and her skin is peeling.

As if to remove all trace of doubt the creature inside her speaks: "Now now, teacher's pet, no one likes a tattletale."

"The hell?!" Meat roars, whirling around. Too late.

The monster slams the scalpel into Ben's face, sinking the blade into his right eyeball.

1. [[Go for the gun.]]
2. [[Scream helplessly.]]

incoming: "What's waiting for you back on Mars?"
text:
"What kind of question is that? Here and now? You've never made the effort bef—oh, I see. You're just trying to make conversation. Well, fine then: I have nothing waiting for me. How does that sound? Nothing. Not a lover, not a child, not even a pet. This was my life and now it's gone to shit.  Well now I feel good about myself. How about you.  Any boys waiting for you?"

1.[["No, I don't."]]
2.[["Yeah, I do."]]

"Let's go...let's go see Neil. Just to be sure."

In the kitchen, you find the charred corpse of Neil. Meat stands over him and retrieves the broken pistol fragments from his hand.

"You think we could have saved him—saved all of them--if we had made different choices?"

1.[["We're still breathing."]]
2.[["I don't know, Meat. I don't want to know."]]
3.[["We did our best."]]

You both retreat. "Neil," you hear Meat yell over the comm. "Bring the Speedwell to the LZ. We need some fucking help here."

"Coming as fast I can," Neil says.

You run and run and run. You surge ahead of Markie and lose feeling in your legs, but somehow you keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but you eventually stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way, you see Meat running by himself. Ryan is nowhere to be seen. You've covered half the distance to Meat when, looking up, you see the Speedwell beginning its descent.

You're almost to him when you hear Markie scream. Turning, you see her fling one of those crab creatures across the ground.

"Damn!" she yells.

Meat blasts the creature into pieces. The two of you rush over to her. She's holding her arm.

"It got me," she says; there's fear in her voice. She turns to Meat. "Where's Ryan?"

"Goddamn fucking thing ate him. It ATE him."

Meat's answer fills you with cold. Ryan is dead. No one that close to you has ever died before. Your vision becomes unfocused. A slap on the arm brings you back.

"We've got company, Julia. I need you here and now," Meat says, nodding at the mouth of the cave where the crab creatures are gathering. There must be thousands of them. Luckily, behind you the Speedwell is landing.

Meat fires several shots at the crabs, but they don't seem to be leaving the cave anyway.

You and Meat help Markie to the ship's elevator. Meat enters a combination on the keypad and the door slides open. Inside the elevator, as you ride up, all three of you remove your helmets. You notice for the first time that your face is drenched in sweat.

A ding. The door opens. Captain Jonas Salvucci, an older, muscular man with little patience for tomfoolery, awaits you—his hand wrapped around the pistol in his holster.

He takes his hand away from the gun when he sees there's no threat.

"Get her to sickbay."

You nod and help Markie through the hallway of the ship. Behind you, you can hear Salvucci interrogating Meat.

"What happened to Ryan?"

"He's dead, cap. Something got him."

"Hell, Travis. What did you find down there?"

When you get to sickbay, both Lenore Strauss, the doctor, and her geeky assistant Ben are prepping the examination table.

"Where's she wounded?" Lenore asks as you help a woozy Markie out of her suit. You glare at Ben as he gawks at her well-toned body. He smiles sheepishly and looks away, cheeks burning red with shame. Markie's drenched in sweat; she looks around wildly while Lenore straps her in. 

She examines the bite: it's just above the elbow, an inflamed bulging of the skin.

"And I was young and we were running," Markie rambles, "eyes bouncing up and down the shore while the sun cooked the corpses of washed up jellyfish."

You turn to Lenore; she's prepping some kind of tool.

1.[["What's she saying?"]]
2.[["What is that?"]]

"Good question. Doctor?" Salvucci says, turning to Strauss. She's red in the face, clearly panicked.

"I don't know," she says. "There's no way to know we're infected until we start seeing symptoms."

"Which would be..."

"I don't know, Travis. From our brief encounter with Markie's transformation, I would be inclined to say that we would drop to the floor and start babbling nonsense while our bodies decayed, but she was bitten. If there was an airbone virus when that blob exploded, our transformations could be much more subtle. There's no way to know until whatever happens, happens."

"A comforting thought," Neil says.

"The best thing we can do right now is...just wait. Maybe some of us get some shut eye and then rotate the guard."

"What are the guards looking out for, exactly?"

Strauss looks at Meat and takes a breath. "Symptoms. In case something goes wrong with one of the sleepers."

Salvucci nodded. "We're all a bit tired. Meat, Zoe, doctor, you three rest first. Neil and I will keep watch."

"Make sure not to turn into boogeymen," Neil says as the three of you head toward the barracks.

"If I do, I'll eat you first, little man," Meat replies.

1. [[Sleep in the barracks]]

"Yeah, that's what counts, I guess. What now?"

1.[["We sleep."]]

"I was worried you'd say something like that." Meat sighs. "Yeah, I guess I should focus some of my mental energy on figuring out how to kill it instead of wasting it on fucking checkers, huh?"

"Make your move already, dude," says Neil, growing impatient.

"Fine. Julia, we can talk strategy in a bit."

You walk away.

1. [[Talk to Salvucci and Strauss]]
2. [[Go to sleep.]]

Something feels different. The cold is gone. You're warm, in fact.

You open your eyes.

You are curled up on the floor of small room with a grey carpet and a fold-out couch.

On the other side of the room is a young man sitting at his desk, typing away at his computer. He is tall with short brown hair.

1. [["I'm alive."]]
2. [["Where am I?"]]

"I didn't have a choice," she stutters.

"There's always a choice," Meat barks, stomping toward her.

"It's what he wanted!"

"We could have saved him!"

"No, you coul—" Her declaration dies in her throat as Meat violently wraps his hands around her neck. "You'd do the same to any of us, wouldn't you?"

"Travis...stop," Neil says.

"No, she'd kill us all if it worked to her advantage, Neil. I don't want someone like that behind us."

Strauss is getting red in the face.

1.[["Travis...let her go."]]

"Wrong. Those three people were under my command. Their lives were in my hands. At the very least I made a decision that cost that boy his life. He wasn't even 20 yet."

You hear his voice break.

1.[["You made the sensible choice. It just wasn't the right one. Don't let it get to you."]]
2.[["Regardless, don't let this distract you. I need you here, not in mourning. Save that for later."]]

You head to the cryogenics room and boot up two pods. Strauss shows up an hour later smelling like smoke.

"It's done."

She takes off her glasses and places them on a table nearby.

1. [["Do you want to talk?"]]

You snatch the gun from his holster and shoot him in the shin. He falls to the ground screaming in pain.

"The fuck, Julia?!"

You back away from him, pistol aimed at his head.

1.[["Don't follow me."]]
2. [[Leave without a word.]]

The gunshot echos throughout the hallway. Salvucci slumps against the wall with a bullet in his temple. Smoke drifts upward from the barrel of your pistol.

"God damn it!" Neil screams. "Why did he make us do that?"

1. [["Screaming isn't going to get us anywhere, Neil."]]
2. [[Shoot him too.]]

"About what?"

You snatch the gun from his holster and shoot him in the shin. He falls to the ground screaming in pain.

"The fuck, Julia?!"

You back away from him, pistol aimed at his head.

1.[["Don't follow me."]]
2. [[Leave without a word.]]

"Are you serious?" he yells, hands clutching her throat still. She throws a weak punch at his arm. "She killed him; she'll kill us, too."

"Dude, just...stop. We'll tell the authorities what she did when we get back. She'll rot in prison."

Meat considers this and then lets go of Strauss. She gasps for air. "Insane...idiot!"

"You shut your damn mouth. I'm a second away from adding your body to the pile."

Meat sets down his backpack and opens it up, pulling out the glass bottle, rag, and oil can. He gets to work as Strauss stumbles over to join you and Neil.

"Thanks," she says, not turning to face you.

1.[["Don't thank me."]]
2.[["I should have let him kill you."]]
3.[["You're welcome."]]

You sniff and then rub your eyes. The tears come quickly.

Meat falls for it. "Oh hey, hey, Zoe." He hugs you.

Now, the voice hisses.

You place your head against his neck. You hear the pumping of an artery. You smell blood. 

You turn and savagely rip into his neck with a sickening bite. Meat's scream becomes a gurgle as you pull away, ripping away the skin and his cartoid.

He stumbles away fom you, hand pressed agaisnt his neck, but it's no good. He trips over a cable and falls back onto the floor.

He reaches toward you but then drops his arm. He's dead.

Now, the voice says, the other two.

1. [[Find Neil.]]

You take careful aim and fire a single shot that pierces Ryan's visor and kills him instantly. The squad vital monitor shrieks at you as he flatlines.

The beast roars again and then you catch a glimpse of the monster's hideous, reptilian face as it darts out and closes its jaws around Ryan's head. Like fingers plucking a grape from a vine, the beast rips out your squadmate's head leaving a bloody stump. 

You flee.

Looking over your shoulder, you watch as what's left of Ryan is pulled out of sight.

You run and run and run. You lose feeling in your legs but somehow keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but eventually you stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way, you can see Meat assisting a limping Markie. Behind them, you glimpse small purple mushroom shapes scuttling across the ground. You run toward your squadmates. You've covered half the distance when, looking up, you see the Speedwell descending.

When you reach them, Meat hands Markie off to you and turns to fires several rounds at the crab creatures. He tags all of them except for one. 

You watch helplessly as the little bastard leaps through the air and, with tentacles shooting out from its underbelly, wraps itself around Markie's arm.

She screams in pain. You whip out your empty pistol and bash the monster's dome inward. The creature lets go of her arm and falls to the ground, legs squiggling. Its agony is short-lived, as Meat puts three rounds into the soft underbelly.

"Fucking fuck." He kicks the crab.

You turn to Markie, who's holding her arm. 

1.[["Your suit's ripped."]]

He stops punching the wall. Blood drips from his fingers. He breathes heavily.

"He's dead...because of us."

1.[["I know. Now let's make it count."]]
2.[["Nobody could have predicted that."]]

You fire several rounds as well, tearing off her other arm. Still, the body convulses. You watch as Neil turns to run to the kitchen. He's a foot away from the door when a grey tentacle shoots out of the body's back and impales him through the chest. It whirls him about and throws him through the kitchen door.

"Fuck it, run! Run!" Meat yells. He drops the rifle and runs into the kitchen. You aren't far behind, jumping over a low slash from the tentacle. Right before you step inside, you see another writhing tentacle erupt from her body.

You slam the door and turn around. Meat is looking over the bloody hole in Neil's chest. Blood is dripping from the corner of Neil's mouth. You hear another stretching sound follow by a splash outside. Another tentacle.

"Fuck me, fuck fuck fuck," Meat says, his voice dripping with guilt. "I'm so sorry."

Neil looks up at him. "Not your fault, big man. Wasn't fast enough..."

His wound looks deep.

He turns to you. "Zo...Zoe, come here."

You lean down.

"Cockpit. Computer login is..." he coughs up some blood. "login is ‘K-O-N-A-M-I. Got it?"

1.[["Shhh. I got it, Neil. Just rest."]]

incoming: "You won't find any sympathy with me. Do it yourself."
text:
"Very well," she says. She lifts the scalpel to her neck and pulls it across. She gasps as blood streams down neck. She falls to the floor and chokes.

You watch until she expires. You leave the room to find the captain and Neil in the hallway examining Meat's corpse.

They look at you. "Where's Strauss?" Salvucci demands.

1.[["She was infected. She killed Meat out of cowardice."]]
2.[[Take no chances: kill both of them.]]

"Shit. Make your way back to the hall."

You do so. Meat and Salvucci are below you, waiting. Meat won't look you in the face.

"Are you sure it's dead?" Salvucci asks.

1.[["Yeah, they're not getting back up."]]

"Yeah, let's."

The two of you walk back through the hallway leading to the hanger and then to the cockpit. The bodies of your crew are still there. Meat stares at them.

"Do you think if we had made different choices, they'd still be alive?"

1.[["We're alive. What else matters?"]]
2.[["Meat, I don't know, okay?"]]

Salvucci nods. "That's a viable plan. We'll all enter the ventilation and hunt it down."

"All of us?" Neil asks.

"Yes, pilot. All of us."

"Do I get, like, a weapon at least?"

"Here." Meat says, shoving his own pistol into Neil's hands.

"Bro, I've never used one of these."

"Well, if it makes you feel better, it wouldn't help much anyway. Bitch is a bullet sponge."

"Oh good, you know for a minute there I thought I might actually have decent odds for survival."

"Quit bickering," Salvucci says sternly. "We'll go for the vent in the central hallway. From there we can spread out and cover the whole ship."

You all make your way to the central vent, located in the belly of the ship. Salvucci pushes a button on the wall; the vent shrieks open and down pops a ladder.

"I'll go north. Travis, you're with me. Julia and Neil, you go south. We meet back here in twenty minutes. If you spot it, call for help."

You watch as Meat and Salvucci ascend the ladder. You and Neil wait a minute and then go up. 

The shaft is tight, but both of you manage to fit, with you at the front. You crawl slowly, pistol in hand.

"You know," Neil says after you've been crawling for five minutes, "I never thought I'd go out like this. I thought that it'd be from a heart attack...in a bathroom or something, nude on a tile floor, ass up in the air."

1.[["Neil. Shut the fuck up."]]
2.[["Oh do tell."]]

"Helpful information," Strauss says.

"Great. If it's not dead, we're fucked. All we got left is your pistol. I'm guessing you're down to two clips."

You pop the clip out of your pistol to show him it's the last one.

"Shit."

"We don't know if it's alive. If it is, we'll improvise."

"Great, I wonder who'll die next time thanks to our masterful improvisation skills."

Strauss says nothing. 

A few minutes later you reach the cockpit door. Ben's body is still there, as are the burnt remains of the captain.

"Well, that's good, all things considered," says Meat. You notice that Strauss is deliberately looking away from Ben's smashed skull.

The three of you step into the cockpit. You slam the door behind you.

"Here's the computer."

You step over to the main console. A password screen greets you. You type in "KONAMI."

The screen changes to a selection of menus.

"There's the autopilot," says Strauss. She touches the screen and selects NEW AUSTIN."

"We done?" Meat asks.

"Yeah, I think we're set."

"Good."

All of you approach the door.

"Now let's get out of here before that fucking thing corn—" 

A tentacle sweeps through the door as soon as it opens and brushes all of you aside with a mighty swing. You all going flying across the room. You slam into the viewport, cracking the glass, and then fall to the floor. Looking up you see the thing step into view: it's monstrous, with a muscular human abdomen. 

The thing's face is distinctly unhuman with countless slitted eyes glaring at you. The monster's mouth is a vortex of meat and sharp teeth. Four tentacles protrude from its back, each one moving like a rattlesnake.

"No!" you hear Strauss scream as one of the tentacles darts out and wraps itself around her neck. It lifts her into the air and pulls her toward its master. You turn to look at Meat who's paralyzed with fear, watching one of the tentacles dance above him.

You reach for your pistol.

1. [[Help Meat.]]
2. [[Help Strauss.]]
3. [[Leave them to die.]]

"Then that makes you an even bigger idiot than I thought you already were."

"When are they supposed to be back?" Neil asks before you can reply to Strauss.

"An hour from when we left," Strauss says.

"How long ago was that?"

"I don't know. I'm a doctor, not a timekeeper."

"Sheesh. Well, okay, so what should we do to pass the time?"

"Time's going to pass regardless of what we do with it."

"Right. So you're going to sulk over there in the corner. Fine."

He turns to you. "Julia?"

1.	[[Rock, Paper, Scissors]]
2.	[[Tic-Tac-Toe]]
3.	[[Also sulk in silence]]

He doesn't meet your eyes. "Whatever. We need...we need to get this boat moving again. He gave you a password, right? Let's hope that console has autopilot or some shit. Worry about that motherfucker then."

The two of you make your way toward the cockpit.

A few minutes later you reach the cockpit door. Ben's body is still there, as are the burnt remains of the captain.
"Well, that's good, all things considered," says Meat. You step into the cockpit. The door slides shut behind you.

"Here's the computer."

You step over to the main console. A password screen greets you. You type in "KONAMI."

The screen changes to a selection of menus.

"Here we go: autopilot" says Meat. He touches the screen and selects NEW AUSTIN. You head for the door.

"Alright, good. We're set. Let's get the hell out of her--"
A tentacle sweeps through the door as soon as it opens and brushes both of you aside with a mighty swing. 

You slam into the viewport, cracking the glass, and then fall to the floor. Looking up, you see the thing step into view: it's monstrous, with a greekly perfect human abdomen. The thing's face is distinctly unhuman with countless, slitted eyes glaring at you. The monster's mouth is a vortex of meat and sharp teeth. Four tentacles protrude from its back, each one moving like a rattle snake.

You turn to look at Meat. He's being lifted into the air by one of the tentacles. His face turns red; he's slowly being choked to death.

You reach for your pistol.

1. [[Risk your life to save Meat.]]
2. [[Leave Meat to die and save yourself.]]

incoming: "You're not really going to take her arm off, are you?"
text:
She frowns. "Protocol states that any possibility of extraterrestrial infection must be removed with prejudice. We don't know what ungodliness is brewing in that bite, so, yes, I am going to take off her arm. Now stay and watch, or leave us to our work. I don't care either way."

You can't bear to watch the doctor dismember your comrade, so you leave.

You're now standing in the hallway outside of sickbay. Oddly enough, you're hungry.

1. [[Go eat something.]]

"What the fuck happened?"

"If you must know," Strauss says, turning her head to glare at Neil, "he saved me and I left him to die."

The surprise and indignation in Neil's voice fades. "Oh."

"Yes. Now can we please just get back to sickbay?"

"Sure. Sorry."

1.[["Neil, stop talking."]]
2.[["Harsh, doc. Harsh."]]

"Dead. He's dead," she says again.

Above you you hear the roar of the Speedwell's thruster as the ship lands. The sound frightens the fungal crabs back into their home.

You and Meat help Markie to the ship's elevator. Meat enters a combination on the keypad and the door slides open.  

Inside the elevator, as you ride up, all three of you remove your helmets. You notice for the first time that your face is drenched in sweat.

A ding. The door opens. Captain Jonas Salvucci, an older, muscular man with little patience of tomfoolery, awaits you—his hand wrapped around the pistol in his holster.
He takes his hand away from the gun when he sees there's no threat.

"Get her to sickbay."

You nod and help Markie through the hallway of the ship. She's delerious now, stumbling. Behind you, you can hear Salvucci interrogating Meat.

"What happened to Ryan?"

"I dunno. I think the blood on Markie's suit isn't all hers, though."

"Damn it, Travis. What did you find down there?"

When you get to sickbay, both Lenore Strauss, the doctor, and her geeky assistant Ben are prepping the examination table.

"Where's she wounded?" Lenore asks, as you help a woozy Markie out of her suit.  

You glare at Ben as he gawks at her well-toned body. He smiles sheepishly and looks away, cheeks burning red with shame. Markie's drenched in sweat; she stares around wildly as Lenore straps her in. She examines the bite; it's just above the elbow, an inflamed bulging of the skin.

"And I was young and we were running," Markie rambles, "eyes bouncing up and down the shore while the sun cooked the corpses of washed up jellyfish."

You turn to Lenore, who's prepping some kind of tool.

1.[["What's she saying?"]]
2.[["What is that?"]]

You fire several shots into the sea of creatures and even kill a few, but they still surge toward you.

"What are you doing? Run!"

You both retreat. "Neil," you hear Meat yell over the comm. "Bring the Speedwell to the LZ. We need some fucking help here."

"Coming as fast I can," Neil says.

You run and run and run. You surge ahead of Markie and lose feeling in your legs, but somehow you keep going full speed anyway. Near the end, you swear that your heart is going to burst and that your lungs will catch on fire, but eventually you stumble out of the tunnel into the irradiated light of dusk.

Across the way, you see Meat running by himself. Ryan is nowhere to be seen. You've covered half the distance to Meat when, looking up, you see the Speedwell beginning its descent.

You're almost to him when you hear Markie scream. Turning, you see her fling one of those crab creatures across the ground.

"Fuck!" she yells.

Meat blasts the creature into pieces. The two of you rush over to her. She's holding her arm.

"It got me," she says; there's fear in her voice. She turns to Meat. "Where's Ryan?"

"Goddamn fucking thing ate him. It ATE him."

Meat's answer fills you with cold. Ryan is dead. No one that close to you has ever died before. Your vision becomes unfocused. 

A slap on the arm brings you back.

"We've got company, Julia. I need you here and now," Meat says, nodding at the mouth of the cave where the crab creatures are gathering. There must be thousands of them. Luckily, behind you the Speedwell is landing.

Meat fires several shots at the crabs, but they don't seem to be leaving the cave anyway.

You and Meat help Markie to the ship's elevator. Meat enters a combination on the keypad and the door slides open. Inside the elevator, as you ride up, all three of you remove your helmets. You notice for the first time that your face is drenched in sweat.

A ding. The door opens. Captain Jonas Salvucci, an older, muscular man with little patience for tomfoolery, awaits you—his hand wrapped around the pistol in his holster.

He takes his hand away from the gun when he sees there's no threat.

"Get her to sickbay."

You nod and help Markie through the hallway of the ship. Behind you, you can hear Salvucci interrogating Meat.

"What happened to Ryan?"

"He's dead, cap. Something got him."

"Hell, Travis. What did you find down there?"

When you get to sickbay, both Lenore Strauss, the doctor, and her geeky assistant Ben are prepping the examination table.

"Where's she wounded?" Lenore asks, as you help a woozy Markie out of her suit.  You glare at Ben as he gawks at her well-toned body. He smiles sheepishly and looks away, cheeks burning red with shame. Markie's drenched in sweat; she stares around wildly while Lenore straps her in.

She examines the bite: it's just above the elbow, an inflamed bulging of the skin.

"And I was young and we were running," Markie rambles, "eyes bouncing up and down the shore  while the sun cooked the corpses of washed up jellyfish."

You turn to Lenore, who's prepping some kind of tool.

1.[["What's she saying?"]]
2.[["What is that?"]]

You slide into your chamber and the hatch closes. You quickly fall into slumber. When you wake up, you're surounded by soldiers. One of them, a corporal, is saying something but his words are soundless. He takes you by the arm and guides you up from the pod.

From there, you, the captain, and Meat are transported to the military outpost in New Austin. You are all given private rooms and access to nearly anything you could want. You order a steak on the first night and it's delicious.

Just as Meat said, men in suits come and interview you about your experiences on the Speedwell. You answer their questions in as much detail as you can. They thank you for your time and promise you will be released soon.

"Soon" turns out to be three days later. You, Meat, and Salvucci meet on the base and request a transport to the nearest bar. There, you all drink in almost complete silence, only uttering the name of the lost from time to time.

You all take seperate cabs home. When you reach your house in the suburbs, you pass your mailbox but decide to check it later. It's only when you swipe your card against the door's reader and hear it unlock that you feel as though you are truly safe. Inside, you shut the door and hang up your coat.

You go into the living room and sit on the couch. You do nothing but stare at the wall for hours, in a trance of sorts. You rub you finger up and down one of the cushions of your couch. You are alive to do this, but you're not sure you're thankful for that.

You begin to see a therapist. You make progress--according to him, anyway. You never really shake the memories of your time aboard the Speedwell, but you're able to cope with them.

That's more than can be said for Captain Salvucci, who eats a bullet on the third anniversary of your return to Mars. You don't go to the funeral.

You and Meat stay in contact but the emails you send one another are largely going through the motions bullshit. You never send a word to one another that is true. Your failure to connect with him is indicative of your relationship with the rest of humankind. You never marry or even begin what you're comfortable calling a relationship with anyone. For the first ten years or so, this bothers you but you slowly grow comfortable with this new you.

You become a writer. Your sci-fi erotica, written under a pseudonym, sells well enough for you to live comfortably by yourself and away from everyone. You're mostly happy, but sometimes there's a thought that strikes at you like a whip: you are completely alone.

The End

"Seriously though, I wonder if we'll find anything down here. I still think it's erosion. I mean, sure, these tunnels are uh pretty deep, I guess, but erosion can do that, right? Erosion. Yeah."

You continue on, the darkness before you giving way to only more darkness. Your suit tells you that twenty minutes have passed, but it feels like an age. Ryan's chatter isn't helping.

"Hey, has Markie talked you about me at all? Actually, better question: do you know if she's dating anyone? I mean, back on Mars."

1.[["Sounds like a question you should ask her."]]
2.[["Why are you such a fucking horndog?"]]
3.[["Dude."]]

He nods. "Yeah. I mean, it's probably running around the ship, growing stronger by the minute, y' know?"

No one answers him. 

He takes a breath. "Okay, well, how are we going to do this?"

"We'll go to the cafeteria—big, open space."

You all make your way to the cafeteria, eyes watching the walls and vents. The journey is a safe one. 

All of you step into the cafeteria.

Neil looks out across the tables like a man looking at his own grave.

"I always thought lunchrooms were kind of scary when I was a kids, ‘cause of the bullies and all. Never thought I'd die in one, though."

"You'll be fine," Meat says. "We'll be in the other room. You're gonna stay in here and use your walkie."

"To do what?"

"Beg for help," Strauss says. "Cry. Be bait."

"How's it gonna hear that?"

"Marki—what used to be Markie has a walkie clipped to her belt," Meat says.

"And if she thinks it's a trap?"

"Then we come up with another plan. It's animalistic though. I doubt it'll pass up wounded prey," Strauss answers.

"Gee thanks."

"You'll be fine," Meat says as the three of you make your way to the kitchen door.

"I can't believe this shit."

You, Meat, and Strauss step into the kitchen and move away from the door. He turns to you. "Make sure you have your gun ready, okay? I don't want Neil to get eaten because we ran dry."

You check your pistol to make sure it has a full clip and nod. You all sit silently and listen to Neil in the other room. "Please help me," you hear him beg. "I can't find you guys."

This goes on for 20 whole minutes, Neil's acting growing steadily worse. "I fucking hurt my leg," he whimpers.

"A thespian, he is not," Strauss says.

"Just let the boy work," Meat replies, though it's clear he's getting tired of this as well.

"Oh fuck," Neil says.

1.[[Answer Neil.]]

"Okay, with what bait?" Neil asks.

You and Meat look at Neil.

"Oh," he says, getting it. "Well fuck that."

1.[["Man up already!"]]

"I hear that."

The two of you travel by cab to the nearest bar and order your weight in whiskey shots. You laugh as you reminisce about good times with the crew, then you cry as you mourn the tragedy of their deaths. And then comes the silence where you both sit, staring at the table, just drinking as you grapple with the fact that you're both alive.

"I should get home," Meat says. "Rhonda's waiting. Give me a call if you need anything, okay?"

1.[["You too."]]
2. [[Nod at him.]]

You can't bring yourself to eat the body of your friend. Instead, you drag his corpse to the bunkroom and close him in so you don't have to look at or smell his corpse.

You're not far behind him. When it's time for you to go, you climb atop one of the tables and close your eyes. You wake up once, twice, but not the third time. Your sleep is endless.


The End

"Right. I understand." She doesn't meet your eyes.

The cabbie drops you off first at your home in the suburbs.
"Zoe," Strauss says as you get out of the car. "Take care, okay?"

1.[["Yeah. You too, doc."]]
2.[[Simply nod.]]

"Damn it. Can't do anything about it now but, fuck, they're dead. And they don't have to be."

He runs his hand over his face to calm himself. "What should we do now?"

1.[["We sleep."]]

"The infection spread," Strauss explains.

"What fucking infection?" Meat interjects.

Strauss turns her cold gaze onto him. "I don't know precisely what is in her body, Travis. What I do know is that once I amputated her arm, it lunged at my throat."

"Bullshit."

"No, it's...it's...true," Ben stammers. "It's over there. Look."

There, lying on the ground, is a black arm with shriveled fingers caked in yellow ooze. You can barely make out three bullet holes.

"Lenore says that Ben saved her life by putting it down," Salvucci says.

1.[["That's good and all, but what about Markie?"]]
2.[["Nice job, Ben."]]

The homeworld is nothing like you thought it would be. The landscape is black as tar and the temperature readings make you thankful for the air conditioning in your suit.

The crater, the reason for your journey, is dead ahead, a half mile in the distance. You don't mind the trek; this is a far cry from the 35 million miles you and your crew had to traverse for two months.

What a long way you've come, you muse. But what is an ending but the beginning of another journey, wrote...who wrote that? You wrack your brain for an answer. The answer is just outside the limits of your consciousness, floating. You reach for it, grasp its tail, and then—

Sergeant Ryan Benson turns around to look at you.

1.[["Julia," he says.]]
2.[["Zoe," he says.]]

The gunshot echos throughout the hallway. Salvucci slumps against the wall with a bullet in his temple. Smoke drifts upward from the barrel of your pistol.

"God damn it!" Neil screams. "Why did he make us do that? It's all gone to shit!"

1.[["Screaming isn't going to get us anywhere."]]
2. [[Shoot Neil too.]]

You awaken in sickbay. Meat is standing over you, a relieved expression on his face. You realize your holster's empty; your pistol is gone.

He's armed. You feel the warmth of your own body. Something's happening inside.

"You okay, Zoe?"

1. [[Murder Meat.]]

"While I appreciate your clever literary reference, that is not, in fact, the password."

Strauss slams the fist of her unwounded arm against the door.

"Listen here, you little shit. You open this door right now or so help me I'll put you to sleep, slather whatever honey we have left in the cafeteria on your testicles, and we'll use you as bait for that fucking monster."

The door slides open. Neil's face, boyish as ever, awaits you and Strauss. He is unharmed.

"It eats honey?"

"I don't think I'll ever be able to fathom the depths of your stupidity, pilot."

Neil frowns; he seems genuinely hurt by the remark.

1.[["Come on. Let's just go."]]
2.[["Stop dicking around, Neil."]]
3.[["Don't be such a bitch, Strauss."]]

incoming: "What, no foam finger for me, pilot?"
text:
"Ah, she's funny, Meat! I forgot how funny she was!" he yells. Meat, grinning, shushes him.

"Oh, am I too loud?"

Salvucci soon arrives. Everyone, including you, buys each other rounds until you're all bloated and sick and green.

Outside, you vomit in the street while you wait for a cab.

"I'll...I'll get my car later," Meat says.

Somehow you all manage to tell the cabbie your respective addresses. You stumble out of the cab at your house and tell the boys you'll call them later.

"Bionic woman!" Neil shrieks as the cab takes off.

Your house, it turns out, looks the same as it did before you left on your mission. You take two steps into the living room and fall onto the couch. You grip it with your fingers and, face pressed into the cushions, laugh and laugh and laugh.

You are home. You are alive and you are home. The military sticks you with an analyst job. Though it's quite boring, there's no danger of getting your head chewed off, so ultimately you're fine with it.

Some years pass. You meet a lovely woman named Michelle at work. She asks you out to dinner. You like each other well enough, so you begin to date. Your relationship is a comfortable one that, though emotionally satisfying, often leaves you yearning for excitement.

Your life is quiet, peaceful. You still meet up with Salvucci, Neil, and Meat from time to time at the bar. They like Michelle.

One night, Meat takes you aside. "They're nuking earth."

1. [["Say what?"]]

"Meet us at the center of the crater!" Markie yells over the comm.

You look at Ryan's heart monitor; he's about to flatline. That's when you hear it: the roar from the black.

You have a single bullet left.

1. [[Shoot the beast.]]
2. [[Put Ryan out of his misery.]]
3. [[Run!]]

You hear him call your name as you turn and begin your sprint down the hall.

Idiot, it says. We will win anyway. I offered you evolution, wretch.

Blood drips from your nose. There's a pain in your stomach. You have to hurry.

You reach the hanger within a minute and seal the door behind you. 

You approach the hanger door and place your hand over the release button. Your legs go numb and you fall to the floor, hand still held against the button. You press it and close your eyes. There's a whoosing sound as air is sucked past you, stinging your cheeks.

The first thing you feel is the cold. You open your eyes to see the Speedwell in all its glory as you drift away. The thing in your brain screams in anger and despair, but another voice cuts through. "Just let go," Markie says, her voice free of malice and madness.

You turn away from your ship and peer out across the ocean of [[stars]] to gaze at the sun in the far distance. It's quite pleasant from afar.

You take her advice.

The End

incoming: "Are you really going to take her arm off?"
text:
She frowns. "Protocol states that any possibility of extraterrestrial infection must be removed with prejudice. We don't know what ungodliness is brewing in that bite, so, yes, I am going to take off her arm. Now stay and watch, or leave us to our work. I don't care either way."

You can't bear to watch the doctor dismember your comrade, so you leave.

You're now standing in the hallway outside of sickbay.

1.[[You go to the mess hall for a bite to eat.]]

The hail of bullets clip the tentacle above Meat. It falls to the floor, but the beast itself is unfazed. Meat scrambles over to you.

"We've got to go now."

You look to Strauss. She's crying as she's pulled toward the monster's face, its mouth stretching to accommodate her head.

You and Meat run past the monster. As you run, you see Strauss's face being pressed against all the jagged teeth. You're turning the corner in the hallway when you hear a sickening snap.

"Keep running! Don't look back!"

You both run until Meat, out of breath, stops. You fall to the ground, back against the wall.

"She didn't deserve to die like that," Meat says aloud. "I didn't fucking like her, but nobody deserves to go like that."

1.[["It was you or her."]]
2.[["No, she didn't."]]

"In that case, I'm with Meat. Both groups will hike down the wall and take their respective tunnels. We've got the third one on the right," she says, pointing. "You guys take the one over there."

1.[["This is kind of a shitty idea."]]
2.[["Aye."]]

incoming: "The fuck you think I'm holding up?"
text:
"Yeah, yeah, cut the tough bitch act and level with me: You think we got a chance against this thing? Whatever it is."

Neil leans in as well, clearly interested in your response.

1.[["Yeah. We just need to flush it out and kill it...somehow."]]
2.[["I have no idea, guys."]]
3.[["We're utterly fucked."]]

incoming: "To die among the stars? No thanks."
text: "What? No, of course not. I'm sending you back to the start, back to Earth with your memory wiped. Give you another shot. Maybe you'll make it out alive this time. Consider it...a reward for your selflessness, I guess."\n\n1.[["Let's say I believe you and that this isn't all some dying dream. What's to prevent me from making the same mistakes and ending up back here again?"]]

incoming: Let him get it out of his system.
text:
He stops punching the wall after a while. Blood drips from his fingers. He breathes heavily.

"He's dead...because of us."

1. [["Yeah? Well, let's make it fucking count."]]
2. [["That's bullshit and you know it."]]

incoming: "Yes, Markie I know what an earthworm is."
text:
"All right! Just checking. Creatures of the homeworld aren't exactly common knowled--did you hear something?"

You did. 

Markie slowly pulls out her pistol. "Just in case."

Suddenly you hear a high pitched whine from the darkness that sends a shiver down your spine. "Guys, we're not alone," Markie says into her comm.

"What's that?" you hear Ryan say over your comm.

"There's something in here with us."

She nods at you and you both slowly back away. You pull out your pistol.

"What is it?" Meat asks.

"No idea. Whatever it is, we're in its territory. I'm inclined to think we should leave it alone. Let's head back to the ship."

The whine again. You focus your eyes and see something moving in the dark.

Markie sees it as well. "Oh god, there's too many of them. Fall back!"

She fires a single shot. The flash of light reveals that the creature isn't one thing, but many things, with feelers and sharp teeth.

They rush toward you, hundreds of them.

1.[[Shoot the creatures.]]
2.[[Retreat with Markie.]]

Neil nods at you one last time. You make your way to the vent where Meat has just finished prying off the cover. The gas is thick in the air, making you slightly dizzy.

"Tight fit," he says. "I'll go first so I can remove the next cover."

Strauss follows Meat. You look back to see that multiple tentacles have penetrated the door. Neil is pointing the pistol in the air and is breathing hard.

You force down the feeling of despair in your stomach and crawl through the vent. When you catch up to Strauss and Meat, he's already kicking a cover.

"Almost got it!" With one last kick, the cover comes free. Meat grabs Strauss and pulls her through.You emerge into the hallway just in time to feel the ship shake violently.

Meat slams his fist into the wall over and over. Strauss looks on sadly.

1. [[Touch his shoulder.]]
2. [[Do nothing.]]

You and the bride-to-be get along well. She proves to be invaluable emotional support after Jack dies from a stroke.
Shortly after the funeral, Meat comes to visit and stays a couple of weeks.

He's bald and uses a cane because of a bum leg. You watch reruns of sitcoms and play chess. You talk of your loved ones and then, unexpectedly, he brings it up.

"Do you ever think of them? The crew?"

1.[["I do."]]
2.[["I don't."]]
3.[["What's the point?"]]

"Shit. All right, let's get her aboard."

You and Meat help Markie to the ship's elevator. Meat enters a combination on the keypad and the door slides open. Inside the elevator, as you ride up, all three of you remove your helmets. You notice for the first time that your face is drenched in sweat.

A ding. The door opens. Captain Jonas Salvucci, an older, muscular man with little patience of tomfoolery, awaits you—his hand wrapped around the pistol in his holster. He takes his hand away from the gun when he sees there's no threat.

"Get her to sickbay."

You nod and help Markie through the hallway of the ship. Behind you, you can hear Salvucci interrogating Meat.

"What happened to Ryan?"

"He's dead, cap. Something got him."

"Hell, Travis. What did you find down there?"

When you get to sickbay, both Lenore Strauss, the doctor, and her geeky assistant Ben are prepping the examination table.

"Where's she wounded?" Lenore asks, as you help a woozy Markie out of her suit.  You glare at Ben as he gawks at her well-toned body. He smiles sheepishly and looks away, cheeks burning red with shame. Markie's drenched in sweat; she stares around wildly as Lenore straps her in. Strauss examines the bite: it's just above the elbow, an inflamed bulging of the skin.

"And I was young and we were running," Markie rambles, "eyes bouncing up and down the shore while the sun cooked the corpses of washed up jellyfish."

You turn to Lenore, who's prepping some kind of tool.

1.[["What the hell is she saying?"]]

"Right. Sorry. Dumb question," he says sheepishly. "Kind of awkward to put you in that position anyway. I was just—"

A blur of blue darts across your light. You raise your pistol. 

Ryan looks over his back and then at you.

"What is it?"

1.[["I saw something."]]
2.[["Get out of the way."]]
3.[["MOVE!"]]

"Thanks," she says quietly. You get a cab and tell him to take you to the nearest bar. There, the two of you sit in silence for at least an hour, sipping your drinks. Finally, Strauss speaks.

"I killed the captain. I let Ben die."

1.[["Yeah. You did."]]
2.[["You're alive, doctor. Isn't that what counts?"]]

incoming: "What are you going to do when we get back?"
text:
She smiles sadly. "I don't even care at this point. Maybe retire? I have enough money...I don't know. Just no more space for me."

"I hear that," Meat says as he and Salvucci enter the room. "No more fucking space EVER."

"Command is going to decide that, I'm afraid," Salvucci says, stepping in front of his pod.

"If command thinks they're getting my ass back on a boat like this, they can go fuck themselves."

"I'll pass along the message when we get back." He turns to Strauss. "Are you okay, doctor?"

"Yes, I'll be fine. Just ready for this to all be over."

"Well, let's get on our way then."

You get in your pod and lie down. "Sweet dreams everyone," you hear Meat say right before your chamber shuts itself. You close eyes. The world gets even darker.

When you awaken, you find yourself being assisted by a corporal. He takes you by the arm and guides you up from the pod.

From there, you, the captain, Meat, and Strauss are transported to the military outpost in New Texas. You are all given private rooms and access to nearly anything you could want. You order a steak on the first night. It's delicious.

Men in suits come and interview you about your experiences on the Speedwell. You answer their questions in as much detail as you can. They thank you for your time and promise you will be released soon.

"Soon" turns out to be three days later. You, Meat, Salvucci, and Strauss meet on the base and request a transport to the nearest bar. There, you all drink in merriment, celebrating your survival, though you allow yourselves to mournfully drink a round and say small eulogies for the dead: Ben, Markie, Neil, Ryan.

When all of you are finished, you share a cab that drops you off at your respective addresses. You're the first. Your comrades tell you to call them soon just to check in. Inside your small house in the suburbs, you finally allow yourself a good cry. Not for the dead. Not for any reason at all, in particular, except that it's been inside you for so long, struggling to get out.

A week passes. You're relocated to analyst position on the military base in New Austin. You hear that Strauss is working at a military hospital in New Memphis. You never talk to her, really, but Salvucci and Meat send you emails all the time. Both of them have been reassigned to on-base positions; Meat's an instructor, and Salvucci can't tell you what he does. You imagine it has something to do with what you found on earth.

Years pass. You never marry or have children, but you're never alone. Girlfriends come and go, at a rate of about one every five years. You become attached to them all and break down in sobs when each one leaves. You never tell any of your lovers about your experience aboard the Speedwell.

You and Meat become close. You meet twice a week for lunch. On Wednesdays, you watch sitcoms; on fridays, there's salsa night downtown. You get a dog. 

This is your existence and it proceeds one day after another.

Inevitably, you grow old. Salvucci dies first. You and Meat attend his funeral. You and Meat take bets on who's next; turns out it's you.

You pass away one night in your sleep, your dog curled up behind you with his snout against your back, the poor creature peacefully unaware of your endless slumber.

The End

Meat fires. Strauss' head falls back and her limbs go limp. Markie turns to see all of you. She growls and drops Strauss.

That's when you fire a single shot at the control panel. Upon impact the door seperating the hanger from the rest of the ship comes down, seperating you from the hanger. Alarms shriek. You watch from the door's window as both Strauss' corpse and the creature are sucked out into space. The two forms drift away until they're dots, inseparable from distant stars.

None of you give a cheer or breathe a sigh of relief, however. There's a sense of shame that hangs over all of you, an awareness of your cowardice. You played it safe so that one of your crewmates could sacrafice herself.

The auto-close kicks in and the hanger door shuts itself. The alarms cease their cries.

"We should go check Neil's console," Meat says.

The three of you silently make your way to the cockpit. Inside, you find the autopilot already engaged. The console is covered in blood; the pilot's corpse is behind it.

"He knew he wasn't going to make it," Meat says bitterly. "Setting the autopilot must have been the last thing he did. Another goddamn hero."

"Everyone who died here will be honored when we get home," Salvucci says. 

"Oh good, because medals were really what I was concerned about," Meat says. "I'm gonna go check the rest of the ship make sure nothing will snack on us while we sleep."

"I'll go with you," Salvucci says. "Julia, go make sure the cryopods are ready."

1. [[Ready the cryopods.]]

"Well, if I had to make a guess, I'd say a giant-ass earth worm...you know what an earth worm is, right?"

1.[["A what?"]]
2.[["Yes. I know what a goddamn earthworm is."]]

"Meet us at the center of the crater!" Markie yells over the comm.

You look at Ryan's heart monitor: he's about to flatline.
 
That's when you hear the roar from the black.

You have a single bullet left.

1. [[End Ryan's pain.]]
2. [[Shoot the monster.]]

incoming: "What's up with you and Meat anyway?"
text:
"He's a fool. I'm not. End of story." The rest of the journey is silent.

The two of you approach the cockpit.

You knock on the door.

Neil's muffled voice comes from beyond the door: "Password?"

"Open the fucking door, pilot!"

1.[["Let's just go."]]
2.[[" Doctor Strauss is right; stop dicking around, Neil."]]
3.[["Take it easy on him."]]

You follow Salvucci as he leaves the room. Before you step out you turn to Meat. 

1.[["Don't get yourself killed."]]
2.[["You sick bastard."]]

incoming: "Let's say I believe you and that this isn't all some dying dream. What's to prevent me from making the same mistakes and ending up back here again?"
text:
The young man turns to you. His face is young, boyish. He thinks for a second. Finally, he speaks. "Nothing. There's no guarantee of anything. You just have to hope."

1. [["This is bullshit. If you can send me back, why can't you just make it so we all get home safely?"]]
2. [["Gee thanks."]]

incoming: Send someone to check on Neil.
text:
"I'll go," Strauss says. "Anything to get away from this moron."

"Be careful, sweetheart," says Meat. "It'd be a shame for you to get your face bitten off."

"Here. Take this." Salvucci hands her his pistol. She nearly drops it.

"Thanks, captain."

"Be careful."

Without another word, she disappears around the corner.

1. [[Continue onward to the mess hall.]]

"There are tunnels."

Ryan turns. "Come again?"

"Tunnels. In the crater. The last reconnaissance team didn't say anything about tunnels in their report."

"How long ago was that?"

"Seven years. Give or take a month."

"Erosion. Boom."

1.[["Shut up, Ryan."]]
2.[["Erosion...right."]]

"Me neither," he says, not meeting your eyes. That's all he says on the matter. The week passes. He leaves. His wife, Rhonda, calls you a month later to tell you he passed away in his sleep. You can't make the funeral because traveling would worsen your ailing health even more.

You wait. You spend days watching old movies. You try to make your way through a collection of Christine Love's works, but you keep losing your focus.

Death comes when you're sitting in your loveseat watching a news report on a bridge being built in a neighboring county. It is a quick, painful tremor that starts in your chest and spreads out.

And then the dark sets in;you never expected slipping away to be this easy.

The End

Meat nods. Twenty minutes later he's scavenged the supplies for another Molotov. 

Both of you return to Strauss' body. You watch silently as it burns.

"We shouldn't move the bodies," he says. "Might make us sick or something. Be a fucking shame to die over a little infection at this point," he says, attempting to smile, but he can't manage it. The will to smile or laugh has gone out of both of you. 

What future awaits you both now?

You both return to your cryo tubes and pop them open. They hiss and spew cold air on you.

"Two months," he says as he stares at the tube, which you realize now looks very much like a coffin. "Here's hoping nothing eats us while we're sleeping."

He gets in his. You follow suit.

"See you soon, kid."

You press the button on the interior of the door and it slowly closes on your tube. You hear the seal clamp. A mist falls over your face.

You slowly closes your eyes and hope you wake up.

1. [[Go to sleep]]

incoming: Take a bullet to the brain.
text:
You can't kill them. You thought you could, but you're not strong enough. 

"Julia, put down the gun...please,"  Salvucci says, hand reaching toward you as he approaches.

"Where's Meat?" Neil asks.

1. [["I'm so sorry."]]

incoming: "Watch your tone, Strauss. Getting real tired of your shit."
text:
Strauss says nothing.  You can't help but notice Neil's grin.

"When are they supposed to be back?"

"An hour from when we left," Strauss says.

"How long ago was that?"

"I don't know. I'm a doctor, not a timekeeper."

"Sheesh. Well, okay, so what should we do to pass the time?"

"Time's going to pass regardless of what we do with it."

"Right. So you're going to sulk over there in the corner. Fine."

He turns to you. Zoe?"

1.[[Play Rock, Paper, Scissors.]]
2.[[Play Tic-Tac-Toe.]]
3.[[Sulk in silence.]]
